Roles & Responsibilities
As a Senior Data Scientist, your main mission will be to provide your technical expertise both to shape the data strategy of the company and to provide actual solutions to business challenges faced currently by operational entities in the field of customer processes, business processes and new services.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Business Modeling:

Understanding operational needs by collaborating with specialized teams
Formalize needs into mathematical models and problems
Explore databases (including large databases, unstructured and open) to find relationships and insights

Problem solving:

By leveraging the formalization of appropriate problems, proposing solutions based on available tools
Statistics: regression and statistical analysis
Algorithms: data mining, clustering, artificial intelligence, machine learning
Deep learning
Select or create the relevant technical data processing solutions for the needs addressed
Manage and transmit the knowledge through appropriate documentation and events (training courses, seminar, etc.)

Contribute to the data strategy of the company:

Link business needs to analytical solutions
Build and promote data strategic assets for the business: marketing, products, services and tools
Maintain and evolve the part of the innovation process linked to the data science activity
Put in place the metrics and the dashboards to provide visibility for data science activity
Present and promote solutions through relevant communities and committees

EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics or similar;
Deep understanding of machine learning concepts (regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction), deep learning (CNN, RNN/LSTM, GAN), , time series data (DeepAR, Prophet), anomaly detection, compute vision and statistical algorithms;
Ability to model the reality of business into equations, and to understand the implications and limitations of a model;
Relevant work experience in data processing (data mining, social network analysis, text mining, etc.);
Proficient in Python & Spark;
Strong knowledge in machine learning tools and libraries (scikit-learn, MLlib, etc.), Python deep learning ecosystem (PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras, MXNet, etc), databases (relational and NoSQL), data visualization, web scripting;
At least 5 years of strong professional experience;

Associate Product Owner
About the Unit
There are more than 500 million smallholder farms globally. 2.5 billion people depend on Smallholder Communities for their food and livelihoods. Smallholder regions are characterized by low living standards, high rates of illiteracy and low agricultural productivity. Yara's mission is "Responsibly Feed the World and Protect the Planet". Key to achieving this is enabling thriving Smallholder Communities.

In 2017, Yara created the business unit, Digital Farming. At Yara Digital Farming, we are building solutions for farming communities, constructing hardware and sensors, crunching satellite data, applying artificial intelligence, and turning research results into services, products and solutions, all aimed at achieving this mission.

Our team is made up of designers, software engineers, hardware developers, data scientists, services and solution managers and product owners. Digital Farming is a strategic priority within Yara. Each year we significantly grow our global Digital Farming team and country coverage. With hubs in Europe, Latin America, Asia and North America, Yara Digital Farming is shaping the future of farming by building new digital solutions solving critical problems within agriculture.


Responsibilities
Work closely with Product Owner to support end to end product management and successful implementation of product into the market from Design, Research, Data and GTM activities
Support PO on backlog management, grooming and coordinating with the engineering team to deliver functional solutions
Develop and elaborate Acceptance Criteria for user stories
Conduct analysis into a number of activities including Sprint Planning and Backlog Grooming, and recommend next actions and decisions
Operate in cross-functional teams; including design, product, content, engineering and marketing in collaborative effort to share and implement research, data analytics and user experience insights
Work closely with digital agronomy and with Yara Core Business to create value for digital solutions
Align processes and decisions with G&C team to ensure smooth solution rollout & drive adoption in market
Ensure all team members/ documentation/ processes/ dashboards are properly documented and updated consistently in Jira/Confluence & other shared spaces for the project
Profile
Understanding and use of agile/ scrum methodologies
Possess core values such as accountability, integrity, mutual respect, and appreciation to different opinions
Consumer-focused, preferably in low LSM segment
Additional Information
We encourage all qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply and are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances.
Why us?
Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.
Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.
Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.
Apply no later than

Job Segment: Agricultural, Agronomy, Engineer, Sustainable Agriculture, Product Manager, Agriculture, Engineering, Operations

Roles & Responsibilities
At 17 Media SG, we rely on powerfully insightful data to power our systems and solutions. We’re seeking an experienced data scientist to deliver that insight to us on a daily basis. Our ideal team member will have the mathematical and statistical expertise you’d expect, but a natural curiosity and creative mind that’s not so easy to find. As you mine, interpret, and clean our data, we will rely on you to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover opportunities that lie hidden within—all with the ultimate goal of realizing the data’s full potential. You will join a team of data specialists, but will “slice and dice” data using your own methods, creating new visions for the future.

Objectives of this Role

Collaborate with product design and engineering to develop an understanding of needs
Research and devise innovative statistical models for data analysis
Communicate findings to all stakeholders
Enable smarter business processes—and implement analytics for meaningful
insights
Keep current with technical and industry developments

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

Work as the lead data strategist, identifying and integrating new datasets that can be leveraged through our product capabilities and work closely with the engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products
Execute analytical experiments methodically to help solve various problems and make a true impact across various domains and industries
Identify relevant data sources and sets to mine for client business needs, and collect large structured and unstructured datasets and variables
Devise and utilize algorithms and models to mine big data stores, perform data and error analysis to improve models, and clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy
Analyze data for trends and patterns, and Interpret data with a clear objective in mind
Implement analytical models into production by collaborating with software developers and machine learning engineers.
Communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement improvements as needed to operational systems

Skills and Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, applied mathematics, or related discipline
5+ years experience in data science
Proficiency with data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
Advanced pattern recognition and predictive modeling experience
Experience with Excel, PowerPoint, Tableau, SQL, and programming languages (i.e., Java/Python, SAS)
Comfort working in a dynamic, research-oriented group with several ongoing concurrent projects

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree in stats, applied math, or related discipline
3+ years of project management experience
Professional certifications

ABOUT NATIONAL GALLERY SINGAPORE
UNVEILING MODERN SINGAPORE AND SOUTHEAST ASIAN ART

National Gallery Singapore is a leading visual arts institution overseeing the largest public collection of modern

art in Singapore and Southeast Asia. Situated at the birthplace of modern Singapore, in the heart of the Civic

District, the Gallery is housed in two national monuments – City Hall and former Supreme Court – that have

been beautifully restored and transformed into this exciting 64,000 square metres venue. Reflecting Singapore’s

unique heritage and geographical location, the Gallery aims to be a progressive museum that creates dialogues

between the art of Singapore, Southeast Asia and the world to foster and inspire a creative and inclusive society.

This is reflected in our collaborative research, education initiatives, long-term and special exhibitions, and

innovative programming. The Gallery also works with international museums such as National Museum of

Modern Art, Tokyo (MOMAT), National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Korea (MMCA), Centre

Pompidou, Musée d'Orsay and Tate Britain to jointly present Southeast Asian art in the global context,

positioning Singapore as a key node in the global visual arts scene.

In 2018, the Gallery was the only museum in Southeast Asia that received a ranking in The Art Newspaper’s

annual global survey of attendance at museums and took the 38th place. It is also the first museum in Asia to

receive the Children in Museums Award by the European Museum Academy and Hands On! International

Association of Children in Museums. It also won the awards for “Best Theme Attraction” at TTG Travel Awards

2017, “Best Attraction Experience”, “Breakthrough Contribution to Tourism” and “Best Customer Service

(Attractions)” at the prestigious Singapore Tourism Awards in 2016 for its role in adding to the vibrancy of

Singapore’s tourism landscape. For more information, visit https://www.nationalgallery.sg.



Manager (Strategic Development)

potential impact to the arts and culture landscape.
Assist in other strategic development division related activities as applicable.

Proven track record in executing and project manage all phases of a research project.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and able contribute as a team player with strong
collaboration skills.
Good analytical skills with problem-solving aptitude and ability to interpret relevant data.
Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Competent in utilizing research analytics tools; SPSS is a plus.

plus.

scientists/analysts will be an asset.
Keen interest and knowledge in arts and culture.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

As Singapore’s leading supermarket retail player and a household name close to all, we have grown with you over the years. Job title: Experienced Financial / Business Analyst with a Commodity Trading MNC
Company: THE CAP CONSULTING GROUP PTE. LTD.
Job description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Experienced Financial/Business Analyst with a Commodity Trading MNC

CA/CPA with min 10 years of FP&A/performance Analysis exp, with some accounting exposure
Commodity trading industry exposure is a must
Hands-on


Our client is a renowned commodity trading MNC with a global presence. An opportunity now exists for a CA qualified financial / business analyst with min 10 years of FP&A cum accounting exp to join its team supporting a global trading business. The role is more focused on FP&A and performance reporting work, but there will also be some accounting related functions.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Stakeholder mgt and finance project work

Assist the finance mgr (global head) in fronting/ liaising with stakeholders such as the external auditors, front office, sales operations, wider finance team and tax etc.
Responsible for the effectiveness of Marketing Reporting systems and finance interfaces present within the business
Assess the accounting implication of new business initiatives which are often complex. Actively involved in the review of new business initiatives modelling and challenge assumptions [eg. WFOE, metal services]


Performance Reporting/Accounting

Responsible for the completion of the Monthly Performance Review/Quarterly Performance Review incl analysis and supporting information in accordance with internal requirements for the business unit. This includes the coordination of collection of performance data from all relevant dependencies.
Conduct analysis and provide insight into performance trends/ results to identify value/improvement opportunities.
Prepare and process data/information required for actual, forecast, budget, interim and year end reporting to support the reporting of results for the commodity and the Production BU. Evolve and develop processes to improve forecast accuracy for the Business Units to support decision making.
Support the Finance Manager(global head) in the review of the completeness, existence and accuracy of month-end data considering the expected results from front office commentary, alongside relevant margin and other KRA analysis


Business Unit Consolidation

Provide the PGM inputs into the Marketing BU and Production BU consolidated results (financial & performance reporting) for inclusion in the periodic reporting requirements.


Continuous Improvement

Implement/ execute improvement and development projects pertaining to the business. Involved in the changes and improvement to the front to middle office trading system (ASPECT)


QUALIFICATIONS

Strong academic credentials in Finance, with CFA, CPA or CA qualification.
Min 10 years of FP&A/performance Analysis exp, with some accounting exposure.
Exposure covering both FP&A and accounting gained with commodity trading firms is a must (with a stronger interest on FP&A work)
Commodity trading industry exposure is a must
Understanding/application of relevant accounting principles, IFRS, policies and processes
Financial Controlling / local statutory accounting standard, IFRS, and local tax law
Understands the fundamental principles of effective financial and accounting systems and is aware of how technology can be deployed to deliver efficiency, effectiveness and control to meet the defined business requirements.
Working knowledge of SAP preferred but this is not a must
Strong communication skills with excellent stakeholder management skills
Able to thrive in a global MNC work environment
Hands-on as this role will not manage staff directly (even as an experienced professional with more than 10 yrs of exp).
Driven, yet collaborative and team based


To apply, please send your cv in word doc to resume@cap-cg.com . Please also include details on your current salary, expected salary and notice period in your cv.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description

Esco Ventures X (EVX) is a biotech venture builder that is dedicated to nurturing promising early-stage startups with novel innovations and technologies in the life sciences arena that will improve human well-being and quality of life. EVX co-founds and invests in biotech startups with inventors and is deeply involved in all aspects of company formation, including assembling the team, business and research and development operations.
EVX is looking for an accomplished Scientist to join us in the incubation of an exciting new potential venture. The candidate must be independent, technically competent and able to efficiently work with project timelines. The ideal candidate is one who is energetic, innovative and highly motivated, with strong expertise in molecular and cell biology.

Responsibilities

Design, execute and troubleshoot experiments
Evaluate and interpret collected data and prepare oral presentations or written reports/ scientific manuscripts/literature for publication.
Present data from research work internally and externally.
Contribute to scientific and strategy discussions to achieve R&D milestones
Maintain accurate and detailed documentation of research data, inventories, protocols, maintenance logs, sample processing logs, SOPs etc.
Lab management duties including procurement and equipment maintenance by timely scheduling of maintenance/servicing/calibration.
Support the continued protection, creation, and expansion of company’s intellectual property.
Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

Job Requirements

PhD in Biology or related discipline
Expertise in molecular cloning is a must
Experience in construction and use of libraries, such as yeast 2 hybrid, phage display libraries or CRISPR libraries will be preferred
Experience with cell culture and a wide variety of cell-based assays is a must
Experience in next-generation sequencing will be preferred
Familiarity with in vivo experimental techniques such as drug administration by various routes, the isolation of cells from harvested tissues/organs will be preferred
General laboratory techniques that such as cell culture, cell-based assays, molecular assays (such as qPCR, ELISAs, western blot), microscopy, flow cytometry, in vivo animal experiments.
Able to manage and ensure smooth operations in the lab
Able to work in a fast-paced startup environment
Effective team player with a meticulous nature

Description

Need to work rotating shifts (the first shift will start at 9.30am and the last shift will end at 1am/2am.

ISAP/ITS Department Overview

ISAP IT Production Centre is an offshore delivery center managing IT Operations (RUN) for Europe and Asia. With over 200 people, it constitutes one of two main hubs for IT production teams. This setup was built 5 years ago and is operated in partnership with a Service Provider.

ISAP IT Production Centre is split in 3 departments covering the following aspects:

INFRA: core infrastructure and end user services
APS: application technical support and middleware management
Service and Process: transversal activities and services

The scope of technologies encompasses core infrastructures (Systems, Storage, Network, and Security), middleware (Data Base, Big Data, Production Services such as Control-M, MQ, CFT, SharePoint and Data Security), end user services (Citrix, VDI, and communication services), and applications and associated infrastructure.

Job summary

He/She will be a technical L2 resource for all Big Data services. As such, he/she will provide support for all production support activities within the Big Data team in Singapore. He/She is accountable for the overall health and stability of the technical solutions within his scope. He/She has to effectively work with technical peers such as architects, peer experts and project teams on technology road maps and projects. He/She will work with L3/Service Manager to gain control over the scope of technical activities, develop best practices and gain knowledge over all aspects of support.

The Big Data team operates the RUN activities and delivers projects for its infrastructure scope covering all Big Data associated technologies.

Job detailed description

As a L2 resource of his /her team, he /she:

Takes up technical tasks and also manages delegation for technical issues within the team,
animates the team to encourage collaboration and sharing of best practices,
supports new technologies and leverages them to provide consistency of service across streams,
proposes service improvements for all Big Data services supported throughout the organization,
documents, reviews, maintains and shares relevant technical information within the team
provides technical knowledge, supports services both proactively and reactively to maintain the availability and reliability of system infrastructure in accordance to the SLA,
works in line with policies based on LEAN best practices,
Actively engages during any high severity issue and drives for issue resolution.
reviews technology changes to identify potential risks,

As an experienced professional in Big Data Services, he/she:

supports his/her team during diagnosis when technical issues rise in his/her scope of expertise,
is aware of the global IT structure so that he/she anticipates interrelationships within the organization,
engages with technical peer, Development team, Service managers, Architect and project teams on technology roadmap and projects,
facilitates transformation projects and suggest future directions for new areas of improvement and change,
guarantees the production readiness and license to operate of new projects and solutions
is available and able to drive technically, any complex or high severity incidents that occur within the scope of their role,
actively engages to understand new technologies and technology trends and reviews them with a view to incorporating them into the operations,
actively assists in identifying the most technical skilled candidates for open roles,
technically coach and develop partner resources to improve quality and productivity,

Job specific environment and/or organization

Fluent English - written and spoken
French language is desirable
Working hours will primarily match Europe business hours
On-call support will be expected on a rotational basis

Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to the Chief Market Strategist, the Market Analyst role is an integral part of the company’s presence in Singapore and wider APAC region. You are the face of CMC Markets locally and as such the leading external analyst ‘brand’ for the business and can measurably increase the value of CMC’s offering to the end client. A key aim is to be a recognised media personality, whose view on market trends and events is actively sought by financial and mainstream press and who can generate a significant following on social media channels

In addition, you will drive the in-house client education, video content and seminar program, developing new material and working with the wider office to help meet targets. This can include delivering content in conjunction with external education providers at weekday and weekend events and seminars. The role requires a high level of self drive and the market analyst will be expected to build a relationship with our client base to understand what content drives client activation and engagement.

ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

To produce timely and forward-looking market analysis that seeks to identify key upcoming trends and market movers, for distribution both to external media and through CMC Markets own channels to our clients in English & Mandarin
Daily written reports in English & Mandarin on global market news across all asset classes offered on the CMC Markets trading platform.
Provide daily content for the APAC websites and social channels. Building English & Chinese language analysis around the region (Written, webinar and seminar)
To cover major market events with pre and post analysis, including interview features and media comments as appropriate
To continually monitor market trends, compile and maintain market and competitive information; work collaboratively with other teams to help identify areas where they can provide coverage or add expertise
To drive, develop and deliver appropriately targeted materials for training courses for all levels of trading client - including seminars, website content, recorded video’s and social media
Forward plan local content, Seminars, Workshops, Webinars and video’s including calendar management and new topical content (In English and Mandarin).
Help set the agenda for key market events where we should proactively seek external press coverage
To develop relationships with key press contacts in local and international media and use these to get high profile coverage for CMC Markets
Be available as a point of contact to answer media queries and give interviews at short notice
Provide regular reports that show the measurable contribution to CMC Markets of your analysis content and media coverage
In all internal and external contact, present a professional and positive image of the department and CMC Markets as well as maintaining constructive relationships - providing training and guidance to other teams with regards market analysis
Undertake such other duties, training and/or hours of work as may be reasonably required and which are consistent with the general level of responsibility of this role.
Contribute to the strategy of the office, working with the Marketing Team and the wider Distribution to ensure business objectives and office targets are achieved
To participate & present at conferences, seminars, and other events as necessary – on occasion it might be necessary to work on public holidays or weekends, although time off is earned in lieu for this

KEY SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Essential:

Degree in Finance/Business related disciplines with a minimum 3 years’ experience in derivative and/or financial industry
Media trained with at least 2 years’ experience interviewing with reputable networks on TV, radio and for written press
The ability to professional present key market data/trends/intelligence
Knowledge of and relationships with the local media networks
Experienced in developing a social following, notably familiar with Twitter and WeChat
Excellent written and verbal ability in English and Mandarin
Excellent communication skills are highly essential
Computer literate in Microsoft Office packages
Energetic and highly motivated with a strong desire and drive to succeed
Work to a consistently high standard and occasionally out of hours to maximise CMC’s visibility with audiences
Self Starter with ability to manage own time well and prioritise commitments with a high level of self management and drive
Very well organised with good time management skills, able to take proactive action when necessary
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Extensive knowledge and ability to analyse market movements
Ability to analyse, formulate and articulate opinion and informed reading of the markets
Proven reliability, dependability and ability to deliver the highest quality of work at all times

CMFAS Modules 1B and 6A
Adept at Technical Analysis for trading in products including equities, indices, forex and commodities
Trading experience is highly desirable

Job title: Data Analyst, Political Content, Trust and Safety
Job description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, a related discipline or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience in Data Analysis and Program Management.
Experience with SQL, Python and/or another data or scripting language.

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: coding, databases and querying, front-end development, statistical analysis.
Demonstrated understanding of how the Internet works economically, socially and technically. Interest in innovation, technology and Google products.
Understanding of fraud investigations, fraud risk management, Internet advertising and/or e-commerce.
About the job
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.
The Trust and Safety Enforcement team's goal is to ensure Google's ads are safe to run for our users, publishers and Google. We achieve this through partnership with Legal, Policy, Engineering, Vendor Operations and Product teams and by introducing abuse fighting solutions.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
Responsibilities
Investigate, identify and prevent/remove product quality issues by reviewing accounts, transactions, user-generated content, advertisements, local business listings and/or search results in order to enforce product-specific policies.
Engage in project work to increase quality and efficiency within large-scale processes by refining use of signals and data, improving internal tools and systems, exposing bugs and vulnerabilities and/or improving collaboration with other teams or companies.
Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Engineering, Sales and Legal to increase automation, update policies, fix product loopholes and to provide a better online experience for our users.
Perform complex data analyses to derive insight from our vast data stores.
Identify market trends and product vulnerabilities. Create data-backed recommendations to respond to trends and reduce vulnerabilities then work with cross-functional groups to ensure these recommendations are executed.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
JOB REQUIREMENT
2-5 years of experience in a role providing analytics and reporting for marketing, customer experience, operations, or related

Education: Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience

The incumbent plays a key role in partnering IMDA’s business divisions to conceptualize and drive implementation of data solutions, which leverage on proven as well as new technologies to transform how business divisions can do their work more innovatively and effectively. As the domain expert, the incumbent is required to contribute immensely to the Enterprise Architecture practice and Big Data stack development to support IMDA’s digitalization initiatives. The incumbent need to work closely with business stakeholders, IT and Digital teams to execute digital initiatives and deliver impactful business outcomes.


Responsibilities

Develop and maintain the Enterprise Architecture, common data models and framework on methodology, processes, tools and artefacts

Design, build and optimize the Big Data stack with internal Digital, IT teams and external vendors

Assemble large, complex data sets for both functional and non-functional business requirements

Design and develop enterprise grade Data Products with business analysts, product managers

Benchmark existing data solutions, identify gaps, and propose improvements or replace with better alternatives

Present and clearly articulate data solutions, technologies and platforms to senior stakeholders

Research and develop proof of concepts, prototypes for new technologies and data solutions

Provide actionable insights on business value creation, operational optimization and other key performance metrics

Support implementation of continuous integration and continuous delivery processes to deliver data apps to production, fostering a culture of continuous process improvement

Create and maintain data pipeline architecture in Big Data technology for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data


Requirements

Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or an Engineering discipline.

At least 5 years of relevant work experience in Big Data Architecture Development

Strong application development skills in Java/Spring, REST WebServices, Python

Have built and optimized Big Data platform, pipelines, architecture and data sets

Experience with Big Data tools, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka

Prior use in relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including MySQL and Postgres

Experience in using data analytics tools such as Power BI, Alteryx, Talend, Tableau

Proficient in using Enterprise Architecture tools such as Mega, Sparx Systems

Pro-active, dedicated, committed and responsible self-starter with strong customer orientation.

Results-oriented, self-directed and able to interact with the various business units.

Good EQ and excellent communication (both oral and written).

Ability to work on multiple projects at one time.

Be an innovative and hands-on leader capable of looking at both the technology and strategy around data assets and new insights

Continuously learn and be at the leading edge of industry trends


Position will commensurate with experience.

Only short-listed candidates will be notified.

About Bloomberg Intelligence
Bloomberg L.P. is a privately held financial, software, data, and media company.

Bloomberg Intelligence ("BI") is Bloomberg's research arm on the Bloomberg Terminal. BI teams deliver an independent perspective providing in-depth analysis and data sets on industries and companies. They:

 Analyse the unique attributes of each business, how it competes against other companies in its industry and how the business strategies translate into financial results.
 Examine industries changing landscape and how technology, regulation, demographic, ESG trends may affect company performances.
 Assess government, macro, credit, FX, ETFs and litigation factors that can impact markets and decision-making.

Introducing BI ESG Team
Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) and Sustainable Finance are at the heart of Bloomberg LP global strategy for over a decade with ESG teams spanning across the organisation in Global Data, Global Products and Global Research & Media.

As the investment research arm of Bloomberg, Bloomberg Intelligence currently has a global dedicated team of 5 Analysts - a growing team: BI ESG team. The team leverages on Bloomberg differentiated investment platform, proprietary technology, data analytics, and culture of innovation – to deliver unique ESG and thematic insight and solutions to our clients.

The Role
BI ESG team is looking to hire an ESG Analyst in Hong Kong/Singapore, to expand all aspects of the team’s work.

In this newly created role the analyst will drive understanding of how ESG and sustainable themes can be used to help investors make better-informed investment decisions through the development of company and industry proprietary research and effectively communicate relevant insights including potential financial impact. The analyst will also promote BI ESG insights, internally and externally.

In this role, the analyst will also have the opportunity to contribute to broader ESG initiatives within Bloomberg and in the markets.

We’ll trust you to:
Main focus: Research & Analysis
 Produce outstanding notes and reports concerning ESG issues, themes, and trends affecting companies, industries and financial markets - including the creation of impactful materials with a keen eye for visual representation of complex and striking data and findings.
 Translate research and analysis into investment implications in collaboration with sector analysts.
 Perform technical analysis and modelling of ESG data such as emission, proxy voting as well as financial metrics in order to explore potential market signals.
 Develop ESG analytical capabilities for BI but also contribute to the wider ESG product and data development projects within Bloomberg.
Internal Stakeholder & Client Engagement
 Build relationships and work closely with the BI ESG team to innovate and develop a strong franchise.
 Foster collaboration between with other research analysts, the BI sector teams.
 Partner closely with multiple teams across Bloomberg (including Bloomberg New Energy Finance (BNEF), Bloomberg Data and Bloomberg Product teams) in the execution of joint research work, and to design and construct ESG analytical tools and frameworks to suit investor requirements and preferences.
 Engage with clients to provide views and perspective in capacity as an ESG specialist.
 Travel as required and occasionally represent BI ESG team at internal and external events.
You’ll need to have:
Main requirements:
 The successful candidate will possess a passion for critical thinking about both ESG and financial markets, as well as a desire to be part of a fast-growing team.
 Previous experience in an analytical research role either in Asset Management or a closely related business is essential.
 Good communication skills are key attributes of the role as this person will regularly be collaborating on research with Bloomberg Intelligence colleagues, and will be communicating with Bloomberg terminal clients via phone calls, in-person meetings and online chat.
 Collaborative and team-oriented, with a creative and innovative mind-set, a pragmatic problem-solving skills, and effective clients and stakeholder management.
ESG Expertise and Passion
 Solid experience in ESG research, on the buy-side or sell-side, is essential
 Subject matter expert in various ESG themes with the ability to articulate investment relevant insight and research
 Passion for investing and sustainability
Research and modelling skills
 Track record of leading analyses and authoring thought leadership related to ESG
 Excellent written and oral communication skills to articulate methods, insights and recommendations from complex and quantitative analysis in a compelling and influential way, both internally and externally.
 Strong analytical and decision-making ability, combined with intellectual curiosity and honesty.
Industry/Market knowledge
 Solid understanding of financial markets, investment theories and asset valuations.
 Experience in client facing
Academic background
 A Degree in Accounting/Finance and experience working with Accounting/Financial Statements preferred or equivalent experience
 Working Knowledge of Bloomberg Terminal would be a plus
 Fluency in a second language would be a plus
 MBA/CFA would be a plus
If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match and we'll let you know of next steps.

In the meantime, check out:

http://www.bloomberg.com/professional/bloomberg-intelligence/

Develop and operationalise roadmaps
Work with product marketing team to develop whitepaper, brochure and marketing plans
Manage a team which includes data scientists, solution architect
Attend industry events and conferences to stay current and understand the competitive landscape

We are looking for a highly motivated self-starter to join us as Incident Analysts. As an Incident Analyst, you will be responsible to investigate and report data security, cybersecurity, ICT system outages or service degradation incidents.

Prepare investigation reports and periodic updates with relevant stakeholders

The Singapore Eye Research Institute (SERI) serves as Singapore’s national research institute for ophthalmic and vision research. SERI functions as the research arm of the various clinical ophthalmic centres in Singapore, including the Singapore National Eye Centre (SNEC), the national clinical centre for ophthalmology in Singapore. SERI has developed a world-leading reputation in broad-based clinical translational research programmes for eye diseases.

SERI is seeking a highly qualified individual to take on a significant role in a rapidly expanding ocular imaging program. The position offers the opportunity to do excellent research work at SERI.
He/ She will assist the Investigators and Consultants in the successful execution of the project(s). He/ She will be expected to:
Perform statistical analysis for ocular imaging data
Compile data, summarize and interpret results of the analysis in reports and journal articles
Collaborate with other imaging- and data scientists to derive and validate novel image-based algorithms in support of eye disease detection and patient risk stratification
The duties and responsibilities outlined are not intended to be an exhaustive list but provide guidance on the main aspects of the job. The incumbent will be required to be flexible in their duties.
Auto req ID
6806BR
Job Requirements
Bachelor of Science with 1 year of experience or M.Sc.in the field of Statistics, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, or Biostatistics or a related discipline.
Strong understanding of statistics as applied to data analysis and modelling.
Experience using major statistical analysis packages, such as R or Stata for data manipulation, visualization and modelling.
Previous exposure to programming languages and image processing skills such as MATLAB, Python.
Previous experience in optical coherence tomography (OCT) image analysis and software development in OCT and OCT signal analysis would be an advantage.
Able to work independently, as well as in a team-based, cross-functional research team

Roles & Responsibilities
The Planning & Analysis team’s role is to provide data-driven analysis and insight to help BIMA to grow sustainably and profitably.

We are looking for a Reporting Analyst to design, build and deploy a scalable, consistent, integrated and leading-edge Business Intelligence ecosystem that will enable BIMA to make better and more reliable data-driven decisions around how we can best serve our customers and grow our business in a sustainable and profitable way. The role will be focused exclusively on building and developing our BI ecosystem, with ongoing ETL and maintenance support activities in collaboration with our team of BI architects in Bangalore.

Initially, this will involve creating different centralized KPI tables from our main customer database to connect them using Microsoft Excel and Tableau to enable country managers and global and regional functions to self-serve our core customer and revenue data without coding or analyst support.

Beyond this initial development, which utilizes the existing Microsoft BI stack we then want to begin integrating our core revenue and customer data with additional data sources from dialer systems (for sales and customer services), lead generation partners (typically customer data received from mobile phone networks), insurance claims data (Salesforce being implemented), finance and HR systems (Workday being implemented), customer satisfaction data and mHealth app and tele-doctor consultation usage data. Historically the business has underinvested in systems, but we are now on a big investment drive to put in place new systems that will help us to scale over the long-term.

This role is an opportunity for a Reporting Analyst to really put their stamp on BIMA’s BI ecosystem and to help decide on and implement the best tools, processes and systems that will enable us to efficiently organize our data to help provide meaningful insights that will better serve our customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with business teams to understand, prioritize and deliver requirements
Design and deliver technical architecture and code for BIMA’s BI ecosystem to enable effective reporting and analytics and self-service by end-users
Identify BI improvements and potential new systems, tools and processes
Design and deliver automated reporting and dashboards as required
Ensure that data provided is high quality and clean and that data definitions are clear and consistent
Documenting ETL processes thoroughly to allow peers to assist with support as needed
Creating Training plans and provide training to the Business Users on the newly implemented Reporting solutions

Roles & Responsibilities
Singapore
Full-time
Company Description

For the past 45 years, we have established our reputation as a trusted source of knowledge and forward-looking insight for the world’s most innovative organizations.

Our teams are located around the world and deliver research and consulting projects based on our assessment and valuation of thousands of individual assets, companies and economic indicators such as market supply, demand and price trends. As a result, we can count the world’s key energy institutions and governments among our most loyal customers.

What you’ll love about Wood Mackenzie

We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We value everyone’s contribution and support them to reach their full potential while sustaining an organisational culture of health and well-being. There are opportunities to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join.

Hear what our team has to say about working with us:

https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/

We are part of a company that has been named as a Best Employer by Forbes Magazine and on the Forbes Most Innovative Companies list three years running. Verisk is one of only 15 out of 500 companies to appear on both lists. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!

What You’ll Love About Verisk

Verisk Analytics has an amazing story to tell. In 2017, Forbes magazine named Verisk to its World’s Most Innovative Companies list for the third consecutive year and to its America’s Best Mid-Size Employers list. We also earned the Great Place to Work® Certification for the second consecutive year in recognition of our outstanding workplace culture.

Verisk is a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, natural resources, and financial services. We’ve been delivering data, analytics, and decision support services to our customers for more than 45 years, helping them protect people, property, and financial assets. At Verisk, you’ll be part of an organization that’s committed to serving the long-term interests of our stakeholders, including the communities where we operate.

At Verisk, you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create a positive and lasting impact on the business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. Our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business will be heard. As key contributors to our success, our team members enjoy working in a business-casual, collaborative environment that offers state-of-the-art resources, advanced technologies, and an excellent benefits package.

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Job Description

Wood Mackenzie is looking for an enthusiastic Senior Research Analyst, Polyester to join our Global Chemicals team. You are passionate about the chemical sector, have an analytical mindset and an eye for detail. You are insightful and have a flair for presenting to an audience - both small and large groups.

Our Chemicals team is expanding rapidly and is a key vector of growth for Wood Mackenzie. This is an excellent opportunity to be an influential subject matter expert setting the industry agenda and to make an impact on our clients and our business success. If this interests you, please get in touch with us now!

About the Role

Wood Mackenzie Chemicals provides integrated commercial and strategic subscription research and consultancy services for the Petrochemicals, intermediates, fibres, films and plastics sectors. We provide insight combined with proprietary data, helping companies identify trends and take advantage of opportunities.

You will be a key member of the Petrochemicals Research team, leading our South and Southeast Asian coverage of the polyester and related markets, including downstream textiles and packaging, and raw materials terephthalic acid, dimethyl terephthalate and paraxylene. You will focus on analysing market fundamentals: supply, demand, price and profitability trends. You will produce and contribute to high-quality analyses in the form of thought-provoking reports, presentations and articles, and will also contribute to bespoke consulting projects. You will also participate and speak at major industry events and conferences.

Through your research and insight, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of this industry; identifying and diagnosing the key themes impacting our customers businesses, understanding the market dynamics that separate winners from losers and providing advice to C-suite executives.

Main Responsibilities

You will generate regional analysis of the markets in our short- and long-term services
Conduct primary and secondary research to build, expand and improve our proprietary market data, including supply demand, trade, prices, profitability, etc.
Maintain and improve in-house databases of industry information including inputting, updating and checking the consistency and integrity of data
Review, prioritise and analyse the data and information which you gather and use it to produce quantitative and qualitative commentaries for in-depth reports and presentations of the highest quality
Respond to customer and internal enquiries regarding analytics provided in research materials
Work closely with Wood Mackenzie’s analysts to develop an integrated view of the chemical supply chain
Establish relationships with clients, building on existing business contacts, establishing rapport and trust, particularly with individuals in sales, marketing and buying functions
Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to service clients and grow the client base

Through your research and responding to client queries, you will build your network of contacts at key companies and industry associations. Your contribution to our industry-leading written reports, supply-demand models and presentations will be valued. You will get the opportunity to travel.

Qualifications

About You and How You Can Excel in This Role

The successful candidate will have substantive experience in an analytical role. Relevant industry knowledge of the chemical sectors and regions mentioned would be advantageous. You will have good knowledge of commodity product behaviors, and capability to identify key drivers (such as macroeconomic indicators, industry and consumer activities, domestic prices, etc.) so that their effects on production, demand, price and trade are quantified in models by product and sector.

You are comfortable collecting and interpreting data, articulating your findings in a clear and insightful manner. You also have a flair for written communications and confidence when presenting your insights to small and large groups.

You are looking for a role where you can build on your existing knowledge and learn from others in a collaborative, commercial and customer-centric environment. You also enjoy sharing what you have learnt with others.

You can work independently and as part of a team, generating ideas you want to share. The way in which you work is productive and driven, striving to be best in class.

If you are looking for a new opportunity in chemicals, or to expand your existing network of customers and contacts in the industry, then this role will enable you to use your effective client engagement skills.

In addition to fluency in written and spoken English, knowledge of at least one Asian language would be an advantage.

Additional information

Please submit your resume and cover letter, outlining the knowledge, skills and experience you have to make you a suitable candidate.

We are looking for Data Scientists who are interested in using data to draw insights that will result in policy changes or business process optimisation, benefiting the public. Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs/pain points, scope the problem and develop business case on how to turn data into critical information and knowledge that are actionable, to be used for policy making, streamlining operations or developing solutions for citizens.

Potentially deployed to other Government Agencies to be their resident Data Scientist. Ability to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges
Understand key concepts, techniques and considerations in machine learning and data analytics

Data science tools such as R, Python
Visual analytics technologies like Tableau, Qlik
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders
Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem solving skills
Team player with strong organisation and people handling skills
Passion for the use of analytics and data to improve Public Service

Preferred qualifications:

Understanding of fraud investigations, fraud risk management, Internet advertising and/or e-commerce.
About the job
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Trust and Safety Enforcement team's goal is to ensure Google's ads are safe to run for our users, publishers and Google. We achieve this through partnership with Legal, Policy, Engineering, Vendor Operations and Product teams and by introducing abuse fighting solutions.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
Responsibilities
Investigate, identify and prevent/remove product quality issues by reviewing accounts, transactions, user-generated content, advertisements, local business listings and/or search results in order to enforce product-specific policies.
Engage in project work to increase quality and efficiency within large-scale processes by refining use of signals and data, improving internal tools and systems, exposing bugs and vulnerabilities and/or improving collaboration with other teams or companies.
Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Engineering, Sales and Legal to increase automation, update policies, fix product loopholes and to provide a better online experience for our users.
Perform complex data analyses to derive insight from our vast data stores.
Identify market trends and product vulnerabilities. Create data-backed recommendations to respond to trends and reduce vulnerabilities then work with cross-functional groups to ensure these recommendations are executed.

Job title: Associate/AVP, Analyst, Emerging Markets Non-Asia Equities
Job description:
Public Equity (EQ)
The Public Equity (EQ) department pursues active management strategies in equity investing. We invest globally and are organised along product groups specialising in different total return, relative return and quantitative strategies.

The EMNA team manages a concentrated portfolio of stocks in Non-Asia Emerging Markets like Russia and Brazil. The team consists of a group of generalist portfolio managers, each with his/her own domain expertise in particular markets or sectors. Collectively, we run a team portfolio of stocks exposed to long-term structural EM growth drivers. We are looking for an analyst/portfolio manager to join the team based in Singapore.

Responsibilities
Be a key contributor to the team. This includes performing analysis on investment ideas as requested by the team, modelling financial statements and developing an investment thesis for them
Conduct due diligence on portfolio companies or candidates, through corporate engagement, site visits, value-chain analysis, consultation with experts and other investors, meetings with suppliers, customers, competitors and on-the-ground data collection
Understand and debate on other stocks in the portfolio outside of Asia. Make portfolio decisions together with the rest of the team.
Generate stock ideas independently and make alpha-generating recommendations.
Collaborate well with colleagues from other teams in the Equities department

Requirements
Candidates should have 1-5 years’ experience in investment research or portfolio management.
Clear investment thought process with excellent spoken and written communication skills.
Strong financial modeling and analytical skills.
Possesses a generalist mindset and has the ability to look across sectors for ideas
Have the intellectual curiosity and drive to conduct deep-dive due diligence on portfolio stocks and candidates
Strong team player and someone who is in line with GIC values.
Must be able to participate in global conference calls, & leveraging on other team members’ strengths across different time zones.
Occasional travel to other emerging markets is also expected.

Reporting to the Chief Market Strategist, the Market Analyst role is an integral part of the company’s presence in Singapore and wider APAC region. You are the face of CMC Markets locally and as such the leading external analyst ‘brand’ for the business and can measurably increase the value of CMC’s offering to the end client. A key aim is to be a recognised media personality, whose view on market trends and events is actively sought by financial and mainstream press and who can generate a significant following on social media channels.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
To produce timely and forward-looking market analysis that seeks to identify key upcoming trends and market movers, for distribution both to external media and through CMC Markets own channels to our clients in English & Mandarin
Daily written reports in English & Mandarin on global market news across all asset classes offered on the CMC Markets trading platform.
Provide daily content for the APAC websites and social channels. Building English & Chinese language analysis around the region (Written, webinar and seminar)
To cover major market events with pre and post analysis, including interview features and media comments as appropriate
To continually monitor market trends, compile and maintain market and competitive information; work collaboratively with other teams to help identify areas where they can provide coverage or add expertise
To drive, develop and deliver appropriately targeted materials for training courses for all levels of trading client - including seminars, website content, recorded video’s and social media
Forward plan local content, Seminars, Workshops, Webinars and video’s including calendar management and new topical content (In English and Mandarin).
Help set the agenda for key market events where we should proactively seek external press coverage
To develop relationships with key press contacts in local and international media and use these to get high profile coverage for CMC Markets
Be available as a point of contact to answer media queries and give interviews at short notice
Provide regular reports that show the measurable contribution to CMC Markets of your analysis content and media coverage
In all internal and external contact, present a professional and positive image of the department and CMC Markets as well as maintaining constructive relationships - providing training and guidance to other teams with regards market analysis
Undertake such other duties, training and/or hours of work as may be reasonably required and which are consistent with the general level of responsibility of this role.
Contribute to the strategy of the office, working with the Marketing Team and the wider Distribution to ensure business objectives and office targets are achieved
To participate & present at conferences, seminars, and other events as necessary – on occasion it might be necessary to work on public holidays or weekends, although time off is earned in lieu for this
KEY SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Essential:
Degree in Finance/Business related disciplines with a minimum 3 years’ experience in derivative and/or financial industry
Media trained with at least 2 years’ experience interviewing with reputable networks on TV, radio and for written press
The ability to professional present key market data/trends/intelligence
Knowledge of and relationships with the local media networks
Experienced in developing a social following, notably familiar with Twitter and WeChat
Excellent written and verbal ability in English and Mandarin
Excellent communication skills are highly essential
Computer literate in Microsoft Office packages
Energetic and highly motivated with a strong desire and drive to succeed
Work to a consistently high standard and occasionally out of hours to maximise CMC’s visibility with audiences
Self Starter with ability to manage own time well and prioritise commitments with a high level of self management and drive
Very well organised with good time management skills, able to take proactive action when necessary
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Extensive knowledge and ability to analyse market movements
Ability to analyse, formulate and articulate opinion and informed reading of the markets
Proven reliability, dependability and ability to deliver the highest quality of work at all times
Desirable:
CMFAS Modules 1B and 6A
Adept at Technical Analysis for trading in products including equities, indices, forex and commodities
Trading experience is highly desirable
Existing media contacts
Experience in presentation to large crowd
KPIs
Build onshore brand awareness
Client retention and engagement metrics
COMPETENCIES
Self-management & motivation
Resilience & Adaptability
Problem Solving
Results focused
Strong communication & relationship management skills

Roles & Responsibilities
Overview : The financial analyst will be responsible for providing thorough reporting and analysis to support decisions. Person will also take part in projects to improve controlling and optimize company processes and will work closely with Retail & Wholesale team members.

Key Responsibilities :
Participate to and coordinate the annual budget process and bi annual budget revision
Follow up wholesale and retail network performance/operations, through the production of monthly KPIs
Work on month and year-end closing, providing accurate basis for accrual posting

Monitor Capex vs budget

Qualifications :

Master degree with at least 3 years of cumulated professional experience
Experience in accounting, controlling or internal audit a must
Excellent analytical skills with a thorough understanding of reporting and processes
Capacity to manage several projects simultaneously and timely
Strong computer skills with advanced knowledge in Excel required
Technical expertise in SAP or other ERP is a plus
Good communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills

Job title: Analyst / Senior Analyst (Research & Statistics, Energy Technology & Data Department)
Job description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Energy powers our economy, lights up our city and connects us all. Join our team at the Energy Market Authority (EMA) in keeping Singapore's future alight and help us power tomorrow.


We are seeking dynamic & talented individuals to join us in the exciting energy sector - to ensure a reliable and secure energy supply, to promote effective competition in the energy market, and to develop a dynamic energy sector.

If you would like to be part of the team shaping Singapore's energy landscape, find out more about us now.


Responsibilities
Plan, execute and coordinate the collection and ingestion of data from EMA’s internal and external stakeholders. This covers the entire project life cycle from requirements gathering, planning, execution, collation, organisation, verification and cleaning of data.
Plan, execute and monitor data management and data governance frameworks to enforce data quality standards, to facilitate data dissemination and engender greater data exploitation, and to oversee protection of and access to such energy data in the Big Data warehouses.
Support data management and digitalisation initiatives to achieve EMA’s operational and strategic goals.
Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality and ensure timely and accurate data publication, reporting and dissemination.
Performs data analysis required and works closely with internal and external stakeholders to troubleshoot data related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues
Analyse energy data and produce reports and analyses to assist in decision-making and policy planning.
Works closely with a team of data scientists, data architects and business users on their data needs.

Requirements

Education in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Computational Science, Mathematics, or other related disciplines with substantial quantitative content.
Relevant working experience and knowledge in data management, data mining, data production and Big Data database management would be an advantage.
Possess good understanding of system design, data structure and algorithms, data access and data storage.
Relevant working experience in power sector data management work would be an advantage.
Good knowledge in Microsoft Office (e.g. Excel and Access etc) and Visualisation tools.


Remuneration and appointment will commensurate with qualifications and experience.

All new appointments will be offered on contract basis.


Interested candidates, please apply online with your detailed resume and copies of your transcripts at www.careers.gov.sg. Incomplete applications will not be considered.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

We are seeking a hardworking, highly motivated individual to join our analysis team. You're one of those people who have a passion for energy markets, and you want to be at the forefront of this exciting industry. You naturally form original opinions, and you have an outstanding ability to communicate these to your audience. Your quantitative skills are strong, and you love to analyze critically complex subjects. Teamwork is important to you, and you are excited by the prospect of working with colleagues and clients from a diverse range of backgrounds.

Our team:
You will be based in our Singapore office as part of the analyst team within BloombergNEF – the world's leading independent provider of analysis, tools, data and research to decision makers leading the future of energy, transport, technology, and commodities. Our team of specialists, spread across six continents, provides independent analysis and insight, working with the largest corporations across utilities and generation, oil & gas, resource firms, equipment manufacturers, banking and finance, and governments.

Available online, on mobile and on the Terminal, BNEF is powered by Bloomberg’s global network of 19,000 employees in 176 locations, reporting 5,000 news stories a day. Visit https://about.bnef.com or request more information via https://about.bnef.com/contact.

BNEF Team Ethos:
To succeed at BNEF we need people who can work in an independent manner and show initiative to develop their own viewpoints, yet be collaborative with colleagues. We don’t rely on the status quo, we look for innovative yet pragmatic thinking that turns big ideas into real insights and impact. Working at BNEF sometimes feels chaotic; we need teams that are both dynamic and structured to generate the unique perspectives our clients really value. Our teams are diverse, creative, focused, and fun!

What's the role:
You will be responsible for undertaking primary research and analysis on the natural gas supply market as it relates to global LNG supply, with particular emphasis on the Asia Pacific region. Together with other team members you will identify topics of interest to BNEF’s clients, conduct research, develop and implement market-driving products, datasets, forecasts, and tools. You’ll be tasked with producing written reports and presentations on your findings in a timely manner. You will also be answering client requests and supporting commercial/business development initiatives through numerous client interactions. You on occasion could contribute to one-off pieces of applied research and/or consultancy on specific topics relating to natural gas.

We'll trust you to:
Become a specialist on global LNG with a focus on the supply dynamics, working as an analyst in the wider BNEF global gas and LNG team
 Track and write about LNG project developments and market supply
 Manage the supply-side analysis for flagship publications such as BNEF’s Global LNG Market Outlook and Global LNG Monthly Reports
 Maintain the global LNG export project and contracts database
 Assist in building our upstream gas economics model and LNG export economics model with various partners across BNEF
 Deliver value to our clients across the globe, through reports, datasets and direct interactions – such as briefings, seminars and conferences
 Collaborate with a high degree of professionalism with colleagues and clients from different backgrounds, cultures and countries
 Promote high degree of knowledge and thought leadership in the market
 Develop a network of contacts in the industry and promote/represent BNEF across a wide variety of senior partners, both internally and externally
 Present your research and analysis at industry conferences and clearly communicate it to Bloomberg clients and prospects
You'll need to have:
Interest in and enthusiasm for commodities, energy markets, and utilities
 2-5 years of experience in a related field and/or advanced degree in sciences, engineering, economics or business
 Outstanding communication skills in English: writing (for research reports), reading (to conduct research) and speaking (for presentations, client engagements and to media).
 Confidence and accuracy conducting numerical analysis and familiarity with data
 Strong familiarity with financial markets, financial analysis, and corporate strategy
 Ability to think critically and develop thoughtful insights and opinions by cutting through the noise of data and talk, extracting key patterns and asking probing questions
 Natural aptitude for data and chart visualization and concise writing
 An ability to quickly understand, distill and relate complex topics to non-specialist audiences
 Confidence in conducting research calls/interviews and communicating with senior industry professionals and academics
 Excellent time management skills and confidence working on multiple projects at once, able to keep up with a demanding, fast paced environment
 Curiosity and eager to learn new things beyond your specialty
We'd love to see:
Experience in oil and gas or commodities, particularly upstream
 Southeast Asia languages such as Thai and Indonesian Bahasa
 Advanced skills in various analytical tools and programs
If this sounds like you:
Apply. If we believe you're a good match we'll get in touch to let you know the next steps.

Roles & Responsibilities
You will work in a team of data scientists, solution architects, infrastructure engineers, cybersecurity experts and land transport planning and operations specialists to build, expand and maintain an island-wide network of engineering and commuter-centric IoT sensors and big data platform. You will work on ingesting and analysing real-time and batch data to sense make commuting patterns and operations anomalies for improving overall journey experience.

You will need to understand business requirements, support project implementation and perform ETL on large amounts of data. The ability to analyze data quickly and provide decision support to stakeholders is a key part of this job function. You will develop statistical or probabilistic models to derive actionable insights which also includes performing daily, weekly and monthly reporting tasks, e.g. for monitoring the quality and consistency of the analytical outcomes as part of the overall operations and maintenance of a big data ecosystem. You will also work on designing dashboards and compelling visualizations for decision-making and management reporting.

Computer Vision & AR Prototyper
We are looking for graduates with Computer Vision & AI experience to join our AR focused team. As part of the Experience Innovation Group (EIG) in the CTO office, the Software POC team needs people that can imagine new products, solutions and technologies – then quickly build them into tangible prototypes that can be tested.
At EIG we are a diverse range of people who have worked in industrial design, UX development, consulting, film, data science and more, all working together to create amazing solutions that have real impact at scale for customers. We’re a multi-functional, agile team with all the skills and capabilities to interact with customers, research and gather insights, explore future technologies, and develop them into products.
Our new Singapore innovation centre is a key part of Dell’s vision – come join us and you’ll get to use your skills to explore, research and build ground-breaking products and experiences where your ideas will make a real impact on our customers. We are a global team with a global remit who work across the full range of Dell products and brands like Alienware, XPS and Precision – exploring topics from the future of collaboration to the future of gaming & esports.
To give you a taste of the kind of things we get to think about, then here are some of the concept ideas Dell presented at CES this year: https://www.zdnet.com/article/ces-2020-dells-future-folding-dual-screen-and-handheld-gaming-devices/
Find out more about the work EIG does here:
http://www.dellexperienceinnovation.com/
If you’d like to join a group that’s focused on exploring augmented reality, human-centered design and the future of computing then you are the right place.
We are Experiences First.

Key Responsibilities

Participate in early stage design process and research, working with a wide variety of people to frame a set of solutions around the future of computing. As an early stage prototyper, your job will be to bring the latest available techniques to the table to both test the technical feasibility and impact on the user.
You should have the bravery to challenge the status quo and think different; thrive in ambiguity; work out loud together; thrive in a culture of giving ‘tough’ love to care for each other and the ideas; be ever curious, always connecting the dots.

You will:
Be a person who thinks of new ideas and fresh ways to try things, with a sound technical grounding.
Work with the wider team to find technical opportunities & build POC’s for testing
Be comfortable with stepping outside your domain area and learn other types of development, particularly around AR systems
Spend a portion of your week researching and trying the latest methods, ideas and applications in Computer Vision, AI and 3d technologies
Essential Requirements
BS/MS in CS or other relevant educational background
Experience in Computer Vision, ML/AI, image processing or geometry representation/tracking via personal projects, internships or previous engagements
Demonstrate a hunger for new knowledge and the ability to quickly source, test and demo ideas
Excellent communicator and able to thrive in a fluid, flexible and at times ambiguous innovation environment
Desirable Requirements
IoT, 3d content, Unity or AR/VR development experience; Mad Scientists are most welcome!
Front-end development familiarity, ie React or Angular
Experience with platforms like Flutter, and cloud services such as AWS/Azure

Job title: #SgUnitedJobs (6-month) SportSG Media and Social Media Monitoring & Analyst

Roles & Responsibilities
At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences.

Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport.

Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do.

Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family.

Responsibilities

You will monitor all traditional and non-traditional media and social media platforms, perform in-depth analysis and sense-make the data and sentiments on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.

Requirements

We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active.

In addition, you should possess the following;

Knowledge of the latest technology and social media trends
Good understanding of sports, health and the sporting fraternity.
Possess passion and interest in research and analytical function.
Previous experience in working in a media agency would be an advantage.
