The Applied Intelligence division of BAE Systems delivers solutions which protect and enhance the connected world. Everything we do creates a safer future. We want to solve problems for our customers and by bringing together great minds, we can work together to make the world a safer place. We help nations, governments and businesses around the world defend themselves against cybercrime, reduce their risk in the connected world, comply with regulation, and transform their operations. We do this using our unique set of solutions, systems, experience and processes.

We’re part of BAE Systems, the global Defence and Security Company. We have over 3,500 employees in UK & Europe, Asia Pacific, the Middle East as well as North and South America. BAE Systems Applied Intelligence Solutions target two primary sectors: Government and Financial Services. We have a particular domain focus into Cybersecurity, Communications Intelligence, Detection of Financial Crime and Digital transformation. As a member of our Applied Intelligence division, you’ll truly get to work on some of the most challenging cyber security problems in the world.
What the role is about:-
Our Solution Architect will focus on the design, development and support of solutions for a number of our key, high profile customers in the financial service sector. This role will own and perform the analysis & design of the solution, and provide overall support to the engineering activities related to the delivery of the solution. Although the role will principally be focussed on delivery, it will also play a key part in aiding the development of solutions in strategic business winning activities.
What you will do:-
Develop the solution architecture and design ensuring consistency with specified functional and non-functional requirements.
Ensure the architecture and design is agreed with both internal stakeholders and external customers.
Define the solution’s engineering approach.
Be fully responsible for all design aspects of the project and approve the design changes throughout the project life-cycle.
Oversee and assure the implementation of the design in collaboration with System and Software Designers.
Own and manage technical and solution risks, continuously working to reduce and mitigate risks swiftly and practically
Lead estimation efforts to rapidly develop an understanding of potential solution costs and delivery timescales including appropriate Service regimes for solutions in production operation
Ensure that all the appropriate standards are adhered to.
Be the expert resource to support interventions on projects where solution quality or progress has become an issue.
Work with Business Development team to build technical patterns for common problems.
Add technical value and solution guidance to business winning activities.
Work with quality and test management functions to ensure that proposed test strategies and approaches are fit-for-purpose.
Work with Delivery Assurance functions to agree how the quality and progress of a given solution delivery should be tracked, and act an expert resource to support interventions on projects where solution quality or progress has become an issue.
What we are looking for:-
A broad range of technical skills and knowledge across a variety of applications and systems.
10+ years in software application domain and 5+ years architecture / design experience
Experience working in Agile projects.
Experience in Data Transformation and Transfer applications and processes.
Knowledge of security domains.
Experience working with Financial Services systems.
Familiarity with architectural frameworks (e.g. TOGAF, Zachmann)
Experience in Java, Oracle, MQ, Linux/Unix
Knowledge of Cloud based projects, preferably AWS
Systems Engineering experience
Knowledge of UML.
Familiarity with requirements analysis, elaboration and management activities
About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence
We use our intelligence-led insights to help defend Governments, Nations and Societies from cyber-attacks and financial crime. Our customers depend on our evolving capabilities to help them safely grow their organisations. Our unprecedented access to threat intelligence, world-leading analysts and market-leading technology means we can help them to adapt, evolve and stay ahead of the criminals.
Division overview: Financial Services
At BAE Systems Applied Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and the financial sector is one of the biggest targets for cyber-attacks. Our Financial Services business unit is responsible for all of our clients in the financial sector and handle all areas of these relationships. AI’s Financial Services Division helps banks, insurers and other major financial institutions to combat fraud, unauthorised trading and money laundering, and meets their regulatory compliance obligations.
As a member of the Financial Services business unit, you will be responsible for providing critical services to clients in the financial sector and ensure that we remain a leading name in cyber security. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.
Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. We are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. We also welcome discussions about flexible working.

Application Instructions

We value your experience! People from a variety of backgrounds make our team stronger – please don’t look at the list of qualifications below as a checklist of absolutes, but a guideline for the type of experience we’re looking for.
Although the position is advertised in Singapore, we are considering applicants in other locations in Asia where Microsoft has an office, including Taipei, Seoul, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Sydney, and Melbourne.

Do you love data? Are you passionate about machine learning and deep learning and excited by the prospect of bringing ML-driven innovation to others? Do you enjoy solving difficult analytical and technical challenges with a team of colleagues, working directly with customers?


If you answered "yes" to these questions, we want to talk to you about joining the CSE Machine Learning and Data Science team. We are a team that engages partners in all corners of the world and work alongside them to bring a new breed of intelligent solutions to life. We are looking for an Applied Machine Learning Scientist with strong analytical and developer skills to join our expanding team.


You will encounter a wide variety of data types, from retail and financial transactions to machine telemetry, free text, images, audio, and video. Working alongside world-class software engineers and architects, you will be using the best of breed internal and open source tools to analyze data, build models, and put those into production. You will have the opportunity to attend, and even present your solutions, at top industry events.


The most successful candidates will have real-world hands-on experience working with data and applying machine learning algorithms across a breadth of modern technology platforms. They are customer focused and practical, enjoy rapid and changing projects and have strong analytical skills, technical aptitude, communication skills and a collaborative work style.
Responsibilities
In this role you will be responsible for:

Developing and deploying solutions with some of Microsoft’s largest customers for solving business problems using machine (deep) learning and predictive modeling techniques.

End-to-end execution of the data science process: from understanding business requirements, data discovery and extraction, model development and evaluation, to production pipeline implementation.

Providing technical subject matter expertise in OSS and Microsoft AI and Data technologies, ranging from helping our product teams understand our gaps, through to navigating our customers to the right technology choices for their business.
Qualifications
MS or PhD in Computer Science, EE, Statistics, Operations Research or equivalent technical field.

2+ years of real-world experience with machine learning algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, reinforcement learning, dimensionality reduction with expertise one or more application domains of NLP, image processing, time series analysis.

Skilled in Python, experience with Pandas, Scikit-learn.

Experience with agile development practices and Git version control.

Cloud-literate – even if you haven’t worked with AWS, Azure, or GCP, some knowledge of the concepts of taking projects to scale in the cloud.

Experience with one or more of the DNN frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Chainer.

Experience with Spark, SQL, Graph stores, or NoSQL stores.

Domain expertise in one or more of financial services, retail, marketing, health care, manufacturing.

Ability to communicate in business and technical settings.

Fluency in English, and ideally Japanese or Chinese (Mandarin or Cantonese).

We’re BCG Digital Ventures. Are you open to the adventure of a lifetime?

Our mission is to invent, launch, scale and invest in game-changing businesses with the world’s most influential corporations. We launch a new business every month and we have the backing of one of the world’s leading consultancy firms: the Boston Consulting Group. We combine BCG’s resources and domain expertise with our diverse, global team of accomplished designers, engineers, product experts and business strategists to launch ventures in many different industries, incorporating groundbreaking technologies such as blockchain or machine learning. All of us are entrepreneurs at heart, seeking to move quickly and nimbly in order to find new ways of delivering value to our customers.

Engineering at BCGDV

Our multidisciplinary engineering team tackles challenges at their core. From product and test engineers to full stack engineers and data scientists, our venture builders all share a passion for innovative and emerging digital solutions. Working in collaboration with product and design teams, they use cutting-edge and custom technologies to imagine, build and launch breakthrough digital businesses that disrupt markets and generate untold value for businesses and consumers alike.

About The Role

As an Engineering Lead, you’ll play the role of CTO on one of our ventures. Once the venture is launched, you’ll then ensure a smooth handover for engineering-related aspects, before rolling off to your next project.

You are responsible for the technical direction and delivery of the products and businesses we build. This includes everything from hiring and technical architecture, through to pitching for initial funding. You will work closely with our other cohorts such as product and design to ensure the team is focussed on doing the right thing, at the right time, and in the right way. We believe in and practice servant leadership here, so your prime goal is to unlock the potential of your team, not do it all yourself.

What You’ll Do

Lead engineering cohorts to build state of the art technologies that solve genuine, real-world problems
Create, grow and operate successful startups, working alongside venture leadership and other cohorts
Design and deliver elegant technology solutions to complex problems with innovative, modern architectures
Build, maintain and refine a scalable, high quality and performant code base
Champion a foundation for iterative product development with good agile practices and a focus on software qualities such as testability, security, scalability, operability etc
Mentor and support effective teams, oftentimes writing code with them
Cross-pollinate good practises and insights between multiple ventures to drive continuous improvement of Engineering at DV
Enjoy working in a diverse, dynamic, collaborative, transparent and inclusive environment where all ideas and opinions are equally valued

What You’ll Bring

Over 5 years of experience leading, developing, and scaling engineering teams.
Hands-on development and delivery experience with a broad mix of languages and technologies
The ability to build scalable, high quality, distributed services
Experience with architectural design whilst leading and inspiring software development teams
Experience working with Agile, Lean and Continuous Delivery approaches, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, Infrastructure as Code etc
Experience building cloud native software architectures
An ability to embrace and reduce uncertainty through continual validated learning
Strong people skills that contribute to an open and collaborative environment
Passion for solving customer frictions through simple and effective software
Experience in communicating technical vision to a variety of team members
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience

Languages / Frameworks
Front End: HTML5, CSS3, SASS, React, Redux, Progressive Web Applications
Back End: Ruby/Rails, Go, Python, JavaScript

Infrastructure
Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services, AWS Lambda

Scaled Operations (within Global Operations) manages the human expertise required for the integrity and experience of our community and business. If you like helping people, Global Operations is for you. Facebook is looking for experienced and entrepreneurial Data Analysts to join our team to help build out best-in-class program management capabilities for strategic initiatives aligned with and driven out of the Scaled Operations organization.

Perform analysis of data and trends to proactively deliver insights about operational performance, and drive improvements
Perform root cause analyses on key problem areas

Collaborate with operations and data-focused teams within and outside Scaled Operations to solve problems and develop solutions

Job title: Associate / Analyst, Specialist - FXMM Operations, Treasury & Market Operations, Technology and Operations
Job description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Key Accountabilities

Provide end-to-end (holding the trade from inception to expiry) processing support to Treasury & Markets on Foreign Exchange, Money Market and Non-Deliverable Forward products across Singapore, Australia, China, Korea, Indonesia, Vietnam, Taiwan and Hong Kong
Ensure accurate validation and timely settlement is being performed on all relevant trades
Provide end-to-end support to FX CLS processes supported across Singapore, Hong Kong and Korea entities.
Participate in critical initiatives, process improvements and projects to enhance processes and productivity, and take accountability to ensure successful implementation thereafter
Perform data analysis and problem solving at SME level
Proactively seek for opportunities to data discovery and insight

Responsibilities

Perform validation of all new Foreign Exchange, Money Market, Non-Deliverable Forwards trades against source documents in Murex or Front Arena systems
Authorise payments and receipts for above mentioned Treasury products
Perform NDF Fixing procedures in Murex and Front Arena systems
Liaising of settlement or fixing with respective counterparties and local T&M Ops
Monitor and handle end-to-end CLS process, including exception handling of unmatched/alleged trades and the necessary follow ups and escalation
Ensure all reconciliation breaks or exceptions are investigated and resolved within stipulated turnaround time
Ensure all inquiries (email or SWIFT) related to pre and post-trade are effectively managed

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent qualification with 1-5 years of banking experience, preferably with product knowledge in Foreign Exchange, Money Market and Non-Deliverable Forwards products
Experience in various operation functions which includes processing, reconciliation, settlements etc
Proficient in MS Word, MS Access, MS Excel VBA, MS PowerPoint, with O365 SharePoint and QlikView skills an added advantage


Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Roles & Responsibilities
Main responsibilities

Main responsibilities of the role:
Gather business requirements from Clients or Business Analysts
Design & Develop solutions based on requirements
Maintain a high standard of delivery quality
Innovate and look for new solutions/components
Build POCs to demonstrate new usage and present them in senior audience
Elaborate project documentation (Design documents, deployment guide, …)
Maintenance of existing BI projects
Interact and provide reporting to project managers

Continuous Improvement

Capability to be the force of proposal regarding the continuous improvement (such as “automation testing”, “auto packaging”…)

Qualifications and Profile

Technical

Knowledge in Microsoft SQL Server (2014- 2017)
Knowledge in writing SQL queries and optimization
Knowledge in database engine and data model
Knowledge in SSRS (2014 and 2017) and PowerBI
Knowledge SSIS (2014 and 2017)
Knowledge of BIML is a plus

Nice to have

Exposure to other data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik)
Exposure to data analytics, data science (Python, Spark, etc)
Exposure on development on .Net (2.0 to 4.5)

Other Professional Skills and Mind-set

Proactive style of working
Strong communication (written, and verbal) and organizational skills
Strong desire to keep abreast of emerging technologies
Team player mindset
Understanding and respect for cultural diversity

Job title: Associate, Junior Data Scientist, DBS Transformation Group
Job description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Job Purpose
Deliver Data Science analysis to support business decisions for various Business Units of the Bank. Develop Advanced Analytics components to be included in innovative applications by creating prototypes and developing solutions based on advanced analytics, leveraging internal data sources as well as investigating the potential of external data sources.

Responsibilities
Train Predictive and Machine Learning models to solve various business questions.
Perform ad-hoc exploratory statistics and data mining tasks on diverse datasets from small scale to “big data”
Select features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Extend company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Carry out ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear manner
Build Prototypes to demonstrate the derive actionable insights from data, as part of Agile teams
Work with Data Engineers to define data requirements and review recommended architecture
Program advanced analytics capabilities and algorithms to be included in new business solutions.
Develop visualization interfaces that help business make more insightful decisions
Maintain a cutting edge in Data Science
Take initiative in evaluating new approaches from data science research
Test new tools and packages
Support the programs for changing the business culture towards being more data driven
Identify, profile, analyse and present the data discovery output for analytics projects
Develop data ingestion pipeline and create the analytics data assets for analytics projects
Work with data engineer to enhance the analytics data infrastructure and develop enterprise analytics data mart
Perform data wrangling and feature engineering for machine learning
Create helper functions to automate frequently encountered wrangling and feature engineering tasks
Requirements
PhD/Masters/Bachelors in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or related disciplines.
Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Highly proficient with data wrangling, analytic, transformation and feature engineering using programming tools such as Spark, Python or R. Excellent knowledge of SQL.
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc .
Experience with data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, Pig
Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase
Good scripting and programming skills (Python, Java, Spark…)
Experience with commercial Analytics packages is a plus (Teradata, SAS, Qlikview…)
Practical experience in following domains, in addition to Machine Learning, is a plus: Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Time Series, Web/Log Analysis, Streaming Data Analysis, Geospatial Analysis
Great communication skills
Data-oriented personality
Excellent communication and presentation skills in English.
Taste for working in teams, self-starter, able to work on multiple projects in parallel
Industry experience in data analytics working in a big data environment
Experience working in multi-cultural environments

Company: CARGILL ASIA PACIFIC HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
Job description:
Roles & Responsibilities
1. STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT

As a seasoned, experienced professional, contributes to the identification, development, and implementation of business strategies relating to the development of new products, technologies, services, follow-on products, and/or industries.
Contributes to the identification of new markets, and determines the feasibility of business and product development. Performs economic analyses on new or improved product opportunities.
Works as a consultant to the Executive Team, Enterprise Leaders, Business Leaders, and Functional Leaders on corporate strategy direction, as well as with consultants and other advisors.
Contributes to the development of business models and tracks and quantifies market trends to substantiate prospects


2. BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT

Scans the external environment for business opportunities, maintains surveillance over market, and may perform strategic analysis and market due diligence for acquisition candidates.
Contributes to the development and monitoring of profitability, productivity, and growth targets. May help to prepare acquisition proposals, recommend financial and nonfinancial strategic objectives and alternatives
With Enterprise strategy, may oordinate business reviews, resource allocations, and financial analysis.
Participates in the development of gameboards and associated identification, investigation, and evaluation of acquisitions/divestitures, licensing opportunities and strategic business alliances that are in line with the organization's long-range goals.


3. STRATEGIC PLANNING & IMIPLEMENTATION

Lead project team that may consist of CSD associate(s), analyst(s) and/or client team members. Organize the project work and play a key role in bringing consensus to decisions in the strategic planning process in conjunction with CSD managers, Business/Function leaders, and Enterprise leaders.
Coordinates with internal departments in identifying and implementing business development projects. May work with sales, marketing and potential customers to determine their needs. Helps to develop and disseminate information on a continuous basis to all pertinent parties concerning the fulfillment of project goals and objectives.
Define and direct qualitative and quantitative data analysis, synthesize results and communicate actionable recommendations
Contributes to the development of long-range objectives and strategic plans for Cargill at the Enterprise and Group levels by identifying internal and external strategic issues that could affect growth and profitability.


4. REPRESENTATION & EXECUTION

May act as a spokesperson on strategy matters with senior internal leaders (examples: Corporate Executive Team) and external parties (example: representatives of third parties engaged in due diligence).
Engages actively in relationships with strategy consulting firms, graduate business schools, and other external advisors in his/her scope of work.


5.PEOPLE, RESOURCE, & BUDGET MANAGEMENT

Provides development and coaching to direct reports to prepare employees for placement into future leadership positions throughout all of Cargill.


Required Education & Experience:

5-7 years work experience
Master’s degree from leading MBA or equivalent management program, with familiarity with strategy toolkit of frameworks
Experience in a leading strategy consulting firm, with track record leading strategy projects
Experience in challenging and influencing senior executives
Experience in coaching high achievers

Roles & Responsibilities
About GoBear:

Imagine the supermarket of the future. Smart shelves only stock the relevant products a user needs, valuable tips and advice are just a click away, and they enjoy the convenience of a seamless digital checkout. That’s us, we are Asia's leading financial supermarket. Our mission is to improve Asia’s financial health by making financial literacy, financial inclusion and financial security attainable for everyone!

What fun you’ll have?

The Strategy and Corporate Development team, led by the Chief Strategy Office (CSO), is responsible for shaping GoBear’s strategic agenda and leading high-impact transformation projects across GoBear Markets, as well as working closely with the CEO and CFO to drive corporate development priorities for the firm.

Reporting to the CSO, this role will focus on corporate development initiatives (including fundraising, M&A, strategic partnerships, etc.) and business strategy to advance GoBear’s market positioning. Delivery of these important topics requires strong analytical skills and business acumen, thought leadership and close engagement across multiple stakeholders. The candidate must be a hands-on and highly motivated individual to develop, project manage and deliver successful outcomes.

1. Financial modelling and analysis

Develop robust financial models for capital raising, M&A / joint venture and business strategy planning.
Perform valuation and capital structuring analysis.
Assist in due diligence and data analysis to guide transaction decisions and outcomes.


2. Fundraising process facilitation

Create and manage fundraising plan, including clear milestones and risk mitigating steps.
Assist deal team in investor coverage and marketing activities, including investor engagement planning, creating company profiles and prepare investor presentation material.


3. Corporate development strategy and execution

Support corporate development strategy objectives, including development and tracking of top priority initiatives.
Assess commercial and financial viability of target companies / transactions.
Support due diligence process and other relevant tasks, as required.


4. Business strategy and transformation agenda

Shape strategic agenda by conceptualizing and managing strategy projects.
Assess innovative or breakthrough opportunities with high revenue growth potential for the business.
Assist to execute against business priorities and maintain alignment with broader strategic goals.


5. Project management and delivery

Have end-to-end ownership of projects or workstreams to deliver intended results.
Identify issues and propose practical solutions for implementation.
Ensure timelines/milestones are achieved per plan and propose mitigation steps proactively.


6. Market intelligence and insights generation

Conduct research and fact finding in a resourceful and reliable manner to distill insights.
Perform benchmarking analysis and evaluate competitive dynamics in the business areas and markets GoBear is operating in.


7. Communication and stakeholder management

Prepare presentations for senior management updates and decision-making.
Build relationships with key stakeholders and seek buy-in to ensure successful delivery of projects.


Got skills?

At least 3 – 5 years of work experience in corporate finance / investment banking / business strategy.
Prior deal making experience.
Proven skills in analytics and financial modelling, problem-solving, effective written and verbal communication, and project management.
Independent thinker with ability to work under pressure and handle tight deadline.
Strong interpersonal skills, detail-oriented and organized.
Possess intellectual curiosity, and outstanding ethics and integrity.
Knowledge of financial services / banking / insurance sectors in ASEAN markets and Greater China is preferred, but not a must.

More reasons to become a bear!

You’ll get to learn from a multi-cultural team of fin-tech disruptors at one of the fastest growing online brands in Asia.

Our work makes us innovative, agile, brave and result-driven but we also just love what we do – and because we love what we do, we’re fun to be around (well, we think so anyway). We’ve got an open and transparent culture so what you see is what you get: we’re not cool with office politics.

We value freedom and high performance above blindly following processes. In fact, we like it when you challenge our processes. We also like it when you show curiosity for new ideas that make a difference. And, we love it when you discover practical solutions to tough problems. We give lots of high fives for solving tough problems.

Workplace by Facebook's mission is to give the world a place to work together and help turn organizations into communities. Launched in 2016, Workplace is Facebook's enterprise communications platform that is used by over 30,000 organizations of all sizes and 3 million paid users worldwide to transform how they connect, collaborate and get work done.


We are growing our Data team which is responsible for building and supporting our data infrastructure to project and analyze our growth and investment in tools, products, and processes. We use data to influence strategic business decisions as we optimize processes, drive efficiency, and improve experiences for our internal and external stakeholders. We partner with multiple cross-functional teams including Sales, Product, Engineering, Marketing, Operations and other Data teams to deliver support at scale. Facebook is looking for an experienced and proven Data Specialist to drive better insights and decision making for the global Workplace Customer Support organisation.



The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook and the role that a connected workforce can play in improving the productivity of an organization and have experience in an Enterprise SaaS organisation. They will have a track record of: Building Data pipelines using various sources of data (Raw data files, DBs, Data Marts). Designing and building scalable data tables that feed reports which are in-turn consumed by our xfn stakeholders and senior leadership. Designing and advocating for metrics that would help track and measure processes we have and make sure these metrics represent current state accurately and will drive future improvements.


We are looking for someone with a strong background in data analytics and a technical mindset to provide quantitative support and problem-solving. A successful candidate will be effective at leveraging these talents to help us achieve operational excellence. With a specialization in analytics, you will individually deliver solutions that equip and empower the team with data to improve tools, infrastructure, and processes, partner with cross-functional teams, and enable effective product support for launch and growth at scale.
DATA ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as a data expert leveraging analytical and technical skills to successfully support operational needs, product support and growth, and tools development
Identify and drive scalable solutions for building and automating reports, pipelines, dashboards, and infrastructure to monitor key performance metrics, workforce strategy, and product growth
Execute quantitative analyses of data and trends to proactively deliver insights, define goals, and drive improvements
Establish short and long-term goals that will advance the Support Operations’ productivity through analytics
Effectively plan and collaborate with team members on data driven projects to improve internal tools, systems, and data pipelines
Solve exploratory analytical problems, and contribute to/suggest process improvements
Build a solid foundation and knowledge in support policies to be able to effectively advocate for workplace support operations needs with key stakeholders (e.g., Product, Engineering, Legal, and other cross-functional teams)
Work on forecasting problems to help drive sustainable growth of the organisation.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
B.A. or B.S. degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or equivalent experience
4+ years of professional experience, with a background in end to end project management and/or operations
3+ years of experience in data, reporting, and analytical problem solving
3+ years using SQL or equivalent and strong Excel skills
3+ years of experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
2+ years of experience with forecasting, capacity and demand modeling.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Masters/Graduate degree with a quantitative focus in Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or equivalent experience
Intermediate experience with at least one scripting language (PHP/Hack, Haskell, Python, etc.)
Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/SPARK/Presto)
Experience working in a customer experience domain ideally within an Enterprise SaaS organisation

About Tableau, a Salesforce company

Tableau helps people see and understand data. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing you to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!


What you’ll be doing…
The Corporate Marketing Analyst is responsible for developing a pipeline of customer references in support of all top tier campaigns and events across APAC Marketing activities. Customer Marketing Specialist APAC will work closely with our customers as well as our sales teams and development teams, events teams, content teams, and PR/AR teams connecting customers with opportunities to establish themselves as pioneers and visionaries in the world of analytics.

Build strong relationships with our customers and connect them to opportunities to share their stories, including speaking engagements, case studies, videos, webinars, press and analyst opportunities.

Contribute to a scalable system for tracking and discovering customer references globally.
Present Tableau demos and presentations at launch and prospect events.
Regular, predictable job attendance.
Who you are…
A True Team Player. You’re the best at what you do and you know how to work with your colleagues to get their best.
Detail oriented. Nothing gets overlooked when it comes to you.
Domain. E xperience selecting, building and/or implementing a customer reference technology program preferred. BS/BA or equivalent experience
Energy and Enthusiasm. You believe in what we’re doing and won’t stop at anything to deliver on your goals.
Excellent Communication. Excellent written and verbal communication skills including an ability to be an engaging presenter
Experienced. 5-7+ years of work experience in a customer-facing marketing, product or sales role. Experience in an agency or a start-up environment preferred.
Technically Savvy. Ability to learn new industry and develop a deep understanding of the market, our solutions and our competition

Roles & Responsibilities
At ACRA, we make Singapore a trusted and best place for business. Our people are proactive self-starters, empowered to create value and grow their careers in an environment that fosters trust and respect. Join us to make a difference! We now have the following exciting career opportunity available. You may also visit our career page at https://www.acra.gov.sg/careers to find out more about other career opportunities.

The Financial Information Department (FID) is responsible for managing the filing mechanism and format of eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL) for financial statements filed with ACRA. The FID also administers the financial reporting related exemptions granted to companies, including reviewing the related policies and laws, so as to achieve a good balance between compliance and ease of doing business.

As a member of the Financial Information Department, you will play a key role in creating a progressive and forward-looking financial reporting ecosystem in Singapore.

Key responsibilities
Accelerate the integration of ACRA filing requirements into companies’ accounting systems. This will include working closely with stakeholders, such as preparers, accounting software vendors and other government agencies, to enable seamless filing of financial data from companies’ accounting systems to ACRA.
Assist with the development of medium and long-term roadmap for the future filing of companies’ financial data in Singapore. The roadmap should consider global developments and the relevant digital solutions that could improve the productivity of the financial reporting value chain.
Continuously improve ACRA BizFinx system, to enable seamless preparation and filing of accurate financial data in XBRL format. This will include:
balancing the needs of data consumers and the challenges of preparers on data to be collected, taking into account changes in accounting standards and other related regulations;
initiating and driving system enhancements for smooth user experience;
conducting predictive data analytics to detect inaccurate data filed;
developing and taking enforcement action to deter inaccurate filing; and analysing the root causes of inaccurate filing to prevent recurrence.
Administer the exemption from the financial reporting requirements in Companies Act, balancing between the need to uphold equal parity, while addressing the constraints faced by the companies.
Embrace design thinking, data analytics and digital solutions to continually streamline our work processes and serve our customers better. Training will be provided.

Requirements:
Have the passion and drive to be a part of the team driving improvements to the financial reporting value chain in Singapore
Professional qualification / certification in Accountancy, Finance or IT
Strong interest in embracing relevant technologies and a firm believer in delivering innovation. Hands-on experience in system implementation will be a plus.
Reliable, independent and driven by challenges in a fast-changing environment
Excellent stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate their needs into deliverables

About the job
Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

Making the world's information universally accessible and useful doesn't stop at the desktop. Android has become the world's most popular mobile ecosystem, powering devices from smartphones to tablets, watches to TVs and everything in between. Our Android Security Operations team is responsible for finding new malware and unwanted behaviors in Android, reverse engineering them, and mitigating their damage.
As a Security Analyst, you will oversee the systems and workflows that evaluate these applications and conduct technical investigations with the goal of protecting our users and their data. In short, you can help make the Android Ecosystem the best and safest in the world!
At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.
Responsibilities
Design solutions that enable automatic identification of harmful or unwanted Android applications. Reverse engineer harmful or unwanted Android applications to understand their behavior and their impact on the Android ecosystem.
Conduct investigations to identify new harmful behaviors, enforce product policies, and analyze distribution trends. Improve tools or automation systems by influencing key stakeholders with data and analyses.
Enhance operational workflows via process improvements and automation. Collaborate with cross-functional groups such as Engineering, Sales and Legal to increase automation, update policies, fix product loopholes, and provide users with a better mobile experience.
Help define and implement team strategies for key service areas.
Understand Google's product policy, enforcement, and risk strategy in order to identify key policy and enforcement operational successes, risks and inconsistencies, and opportunities for improvement.

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish!

Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it!
We are seeking an experienced business analyst in our material team. Apple Support business strategy changes rapidly due to the dynamic business conditions. To support the growth, we are looking for an analyst who can handle information and data analysis, drive for excellence in operational KPIs and business result. This role involves working with managers, planner and buyer, project team lead and responsible for delivery result and reporting solutions.
You are business oriented, having deep knowledge on supply chain business and with strong communication and analytical skills. You are a problem solver who has passion for supply chain operation, data visualization and reporting. You will be consulting with business team to identify issues and understand requirements that stretch across multiple system and data elements to come up with business solutions. Strong conceptual and process-focused thinking abilities

Aptitude and interest in new technical concepts
High level of professionalism, energy and sense of urgency to “make things happen”

Patient and has attention to details
Experience in consumer sales/channel/retail reporting is highly desirable
Experience in facilitating business requirement workshops is a plus

- Support operation activities to meet business target
- Support data analysis on project roll out including supply chain operation and material positioning solution
- Support business meeting, training activities to achieve process optimization and improvements in the organization
- Coordinate, monitor and review result performance on implemented ideas and initiatives
- Document cases, process flows
Education & Experience
- Bachelors degree with more than 3 years of experience in a planning and business process data analysis role, preferably in supply chain environment
- Graduates with business information system/ Statistic/ Computer Engineering/ Data analytics & business intelligence degree will be preferred

Position Summary:
As a part of the Commercial Operations Team, the Compliance Analyst will be responsible for helping with regional audits and investigations, monitoring compliance program key metrics and assisting with risk assessments. The role will be accountable in region for quality and compliance across the regional Commercial Business – Sales, Field Service and Support, Customer Care teams operating in Singapore, Korea, Japan and Australia.
The Compliance Analyst will develop, analyse and provide reports and information to support compliance quarterly, monthly and daily reviews as needed. The Compliance Analyst will be responsible for coordinating requirements and completion of tasks, engaging with other groups and functions in support of the business. This role will support sustaining compliance requirements, process improvements and system evolution in both our direct business, and throughout our partner network.
Tasks and Responsibilities:
Ensure all required compliance processes are tracked and adhered to in-region through regular and ad hoc reviews; hold business leadership accountable; escalate non-compliance to management and Global Compliance Specialist as needed.
Monitor and analyse current systems and processes to evaluate effectiveness; Recommend, develop and manage tools, reports and processes to support regional compliance and Internal Audit requirements.
Actively participate, as the regional commercial representative in new and sustaining compliance related projects; Communicate regional strategic concerns to Global and back to QA
Effectively communicate with cross-functional teams to support process implementation, improvements and adherence to compliance guidelines in support of the business globally.
Lead meetings with, and provide training to, regional commercial resources on procedures and updates to compliance-related activities; Collaborate with Training on incorporating compliance content into training materials.
Help coordinate commercial participation in audits, especially in the absence of local QA; Assist in detecting, trending, and analysing global audit data; and report on analysis, make recommendations, and drive programs to improve processes.
Advise and consult on project/quality plans, risk assessments and remediation plans; Participate in investigations of quality system issues.
Provide regional perspective to Global Business Analyst on opportunities for compliance-related process improvements.
Helps coordinate actions on clean up and maintenance of documentation in multiple systems to drive standardization and meet compliance requirements; Collaborates with regional and global teams to ensure documentation is created, submitted for global review and follows defined document control process.
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.
Preferred Educational Background:
Bachelor’s degree (BSc/BA) or equivalent required.
Preferred Experience & Skills:
Significant experience working with a Quality Management System in a medical device or life science company.
Previous Audit/Regulatory experience in an MNC environment operating across Asia Pacific.
Experience with ISO 13485:2016, MDSAP, SOX and other compliance and regulatory frameworks.
Experience in managing the compliance of field support, sales and customer service.
Experience working with ERP (SAP) and CRM (SFDC) systems; using Microsoft suite including: Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio.
Strong analytical skills and ability to derive data from enterprise systems.
Demonstrated ability to build strong internal networks across diverse stakeholders.
Effective verbal and written communication in individual and group settings across multi-cultural global teams.
Ability to collaborate and communicate across all levels of the organization and effectively balance commercial, operational and compliance needs.
Detail oriented, good organizational and project management skills and be able to meet deadlines.
Ability to handle multiple tasks, embrace change, and innovate in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to handle stressful situations and demonstrate strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to effectively lead, plan and execute on plans for process improvement.

Roles & Responsibilities
The People Organization Group (POG) is the GovTech division that oversees and promotes our human resources. It is in charge of fostering the holistic development and enrichment of our employees, both individually and as a team.
We are seeking an analytics professional to join us as a Data Scientist to develop our advanced HR analytics strategies. You will be given opportunities to apply people analytics using advanced analytics technologies, subsequently making critical decisions to directly impact initiatives and solutions and meet business needs. Extract and interpret large data sets from HR Centers of Excellence using complex data analysis
Design holistic analytical reports, articulating and transforming them into actionable people insights for key HR stakeholders
Level-up analytical capabilities for POG by enhancing intellectual programming analytics through integrating current and new HR systems and technologies
Participate in data science studies and projects to discover new analytics technologies

Self-starter and passionate in data analysis

Roles & Responsibilities
Are you interested in leading a data science team and excited to showcase how data can optimize the agency’s work processes?
We are looking for a Data Analytics Lead who will help drive a strong data science culture within the agency. We envision that data science will be more pervasive within the agency, e.g. more divisions implementing data science projects, so part of your work is being this change agent.
This opportunity offers an interesting experience of applying ‘hard’ technical skills with ‘soft’ business and communication skills. You will need to understand the agency’s business domains, explore and scope new projects such that insights are actionable and models can be operationalized. You will also provide technical data science guidance to the team to ensure that the analytics approach is robust and meets the business users’ needs. You should also excite senior management on the possibilities of data science, and clearly articulate the impact of such projects.
You will be working on Enterprise Singapore (ESG) projects where data science can be applied to help the government stay closer to needs of SMEs, and help them grow beyond our local market. This includes projects ranging from process optimization to strategy formulation. There will also be opportunity to contribute to other whole-of-government analytics projects as an exposure to the wider themes of data science work.
Candidates must have working experience on data analytics, be comfortable with hands-on data manipulation, data modelling and data visualization, be able to engage stakeholders on refining their business problems, and have a keen sense to spot more impactful projects.
What to Expect:
Chart and drive the data analytics strategy at Enterprise Singapore,
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, scope the problems and develop business case to operationalize insights from data,
Guide a team of data scientists to perform data cleaning, pre-processing, feature engineering and build relevant models to conduct meaningful analysis,
Depending on the required business needs, designing of dashboards and interactive visualization as tools for data exploration may be expected, and;
Potentially deployed to other public agencies to be their Data Analyst Lead, which would involve leading a data analytics team and driving the data science culture within the agency.
How to succeed
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Quantitative Social Science or related degrees. Advanced degrees preferred. We will also factor in relevant certifications, e.g. Coursera,
Minimally 5 years of relevant working experience, preferably in public sector or data science field,
Experience in leading a data science team, and implementing domain-specific analytics project is a plus,
Ability to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges,
Understand key concepts, techniques and considerations in machine learning and data analytics,
Training and relevant experience in one or more of the following areas:
Data science tools such as R, Python
Visual analytics technologies like Tableau, Qlik
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders,
Team player with strong organization and people management skills, and;
Passion for the use of analytics and data to improve public service.

Roles & Responsibilities
Our real-world mobility solutions are driving us toward a safer, greener and better connected future. Aptiv is providing the “brain” and “nervous system” for vehicles that will change the face of mobility for people worldwide.

Aptiv’s Autonomous Mobility team is focused on developing, and commercializing autonomous vehicles and systems that enable point-to-point mobility via large fleets of autonomous vehicles in challenging urban driving environments. With talented teams working across the globe, from Boston to Singapore, Aptiv was the first company to deploy a commercial, point-to-point autonomous ride-hailing service based in Las Vegas, Nevada.

In November 2017, Aptiv acquired autonomous vehicle software startup nuTonomy, an integral part of Aptiv’s Autonomous Mobility team. With continued research, development, and both current and future commercial deployments, we are looking for talented and passionate people to join our team.

Work with leading engineers, research scientists, marketers and business development experts, all while enabling the future of mobility. At Aptiv, we believe that our mobility solutions have the power to change the world. For more information, please visit www.aptiv.com/our-journey and see our www.aptiv.com/careers for opportunities.

Responsibilities:

Know how to turn data into information and insights that drive decisions across an organisation
Will embed data collection and feedback mechanisms throughout our learning solutions to generate data-driven, actionable insights into the learning within the company
You are curious about the stories that data can tell, and imaginative in communicating these stories in a simple, yet compelling manner that connects to the organisation’s strategy and goals
Driven to build and execute learning analytics capabilities in company
Work closely and creatively in a fast-paced, agile environment with stakeholders, from researching and applying data-driven approaches to anchoring data strategy (systems, technological solutions and processes); and making recommendations that are clearly linked to company’s strategy and priorities
Requirements:

Degree in any field or related study
Practical and imaginative in problem-solving especially in emerging situations
Take full ownership of the entire data process from project scoping and management, data integration, data exploration and analysis to data visualisation
Methodical and have a healthy dose of scepticism of the value and limits of data

Are you interested in leading a data science team and excited to showcase how data can optimize the agency’s work processes?

We are looking for a Data Analytics Lead who will help drive a strong data science culture within the agency. We envision that data science will be more pervasive within the agency, e.g. more divisions implementing data science projects, so part of your work is being this change agent.

This opportunity offers an interesting experience of applying ‘hard’ technical skills with ‘soft’ business and communication skills. You will need to understand the agency’s business domains, explore and scope new projects such that insights are actionable and models can be operationalized. You will also provide technical data science guidance to the team to ensure that the analytics approach is robust and meets the business users’ needs. You should also excite senior management on the possibilities of data science, and clearly articulate the impact of such projects.

You will be working on Enterprise Singapore (ESG) projects where data science can be applied to help the government stay closer to needs of SMEs, and help them grow beyond our local market. This includes projects ranging from process optimization to strategy formulation. There will also be opportunity to contribute to other whole-of-government analytics projects as an exposure to the wider themes of data science work.

Candidates must have working experience on data analytics, be comfortable with hands-on data manipulation, data modelling and data visualization, be able to engage stakeholders on refining their business problems, and have a keen sense to spot more impactful projects.

What to Expect:

Chart and drive the data analytics strategy at Enterprise Singapore,
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, scope the problems and develop business case to operationalize insights from data,
Guide a team of data scientists to perform data cleaning, pre-processing, feature engineering and build relevant models to conduct meaningful analysis,
Depending on the required business needs, designing of dashboards and interactive visualization as tools for data exploration may be expected, and;
Potentially deployed to other public agencies to be their Data Analyst Lead, which would involve leading a data analytics team and driving the data science culture within the agency.
How to succeed
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Quantitative Social Science or related degrees. Advanced degrees preferred. We will also factor in relevant certifications, e.g. Coursera,
Minimally 5 years of relevant working experience, preferably in public sector or data science field,
Experience in leading a data science team, and implementing domain-specific analytics project is a plus,
Ability to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges,
Understand key concepts, techniques and considerations in machine learning and data analytics,
Training and relevant experience in one or more of the following areas:
Data science tools such as R, Python
Visual analytics technologies like Tableau, Qlik
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders,
Team player with strong organization and people management skills, and;
Passion for the use of analytics and data to improve public service.

Roles & Responsibilities
Our real-world mobility solutions are driving us toward a safer, greener and better connected future. Aptiv is providing the “brain” and “nervous system” for vehicles that will change the face of mobility for people worldwide.

Aptiv’s Autonomous Mobility team is focused on developing, and commercializing autonomous vehicles and systems that enable point-to-point mobility via large fleets of autonomous vehicles in challenging urban driving environments. With talented teams working across the globe, from Boston to Singapore, Aptiv was the first company to deploy a commercial, point-to-point autonomous ride-hailing service based in Las Vegas, Nevada.

In November 2017, Aptiv acquired autonomous vehicle software startup nuTonomy, an integral part of Aptiv’s Autonomous Mobility team. With continued research, development, and both current and future commercial deployments, we are looking for talented and passionate people to join our team.

Work with leading engineers, research scientists, marketers and business development experts, all while enabling the future of mobility. At Aptiv, we believe that our mobility solutions have the power to change the world. For more information, please visit www.aptiv.com/our-journey and see our www.aptiv.com/careers for opportunities.

We are seeking highly talented Research Engineer focused on computer vision & machine learning to support a variety of teams.

Job Description
A robust and adaptive perception systems is essential for creating fully autonomous vehicles. We are looking for excellent research scientists in Computer Vision that will focus on researching, developing, and deploying algorithms for extracting semantic information from RGB(D) video streams, including detection, segmentation, tracking and fine-grained classification, with the goal of using this information in a real-time robotic system with high safety requirements. In this role, you would work closely with experts of other sensor modalities to build a fully-integrated perception system, as well as experts in planning and control to “close the loop” on actual robots. To support your work, you will be able to use a state-of-the-art scalable computing, simulation, and testing environment, which allows a quick transition of your ideas from prototype to vehicles on the road. You will also be expected to mentor junior colleagues. Lastly, you will join an awesome group of motivated colleagues, both industry professionals as well as leading researchers from academia, who like to approach problems with both creativity and rigor, to push beyond the state of the art.

Requirements

Master Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
Extensive experience of one or more of the following:
Deep learning applied to images or video data.
Other modern machine learning methods, with a focus on rigorous statistics.
Geometric computer-vision such as SLAM, optical-flow and stereo.
Sensor fusion of RGB and depth.
Excellent analytical, communication, and writing skills.
Experience developing software as part of a team.

Bonus

Experience in automotive or other real-time and embedded systems.
Experience with temporal data-association, tracking, etc.
Experience with formal software development methods.
Experience with deep net compression methods.
Proven track record of publications in relevant conferences (CVPR, ICML, NIPS, ICCV…)
Familiarity with C++, Python, CUDA, Git, CMake, continuous integration tools and the agile development process.

Job title: Lead Analyst - Global LNG Market Research
Job description:
Position Summary
Refinitiv, formerly the Financial & Risk business of Thomson Reuters, is one of the world’s largest providers of financial markets data and infrastructure. Serving more than 40,000 institutions in over 190 countries, we provide information, insights, and technology that drive innovation and performance in global markets. Our 160-year Reuters heritage of integrity enables customers to make critical decisions with confidence, while our unique open platform, best-in-class data, and cutting-edge technology bring greater opportunity to our customers. By advancing our customers, we drive progress for the entire financial community.
The Commodities Research group was formed in 2012 within Thomson Reuters, and now is a part of Refinitiv’s Content and Commodities Research (CCR), a team comprised of 200+ market and business analysts providing analytic insight and model forecasts into the oil, natural gas, power, carbon, agriculture and metals global markets. Our core mission is turning data overload into market knowledge that empowers commodities professionals to make better informed decisions.
Refinitiv Commodities Research and Forecasts requires a Lead Analyst to join the Global LNG Research team. The position is based in the Singapore office, but you will collaborate with other team members in London and Oslo and will directly report to Refinitiv’s Director of Natural Gas & LNG Research based in NYC. The team delivers market data, provides fundamental forecasts of supply, demand and prices and publishes in-depth reports on the global LNG market. Our clients are natural gas and LNG producers, importers, distribution companies, trading houses and financial institutions.
Preferred candidates should demonstrate strong analytical and communication skills and experience in the global LNG market.
Role Responsibilities
Unique opportunity to launch Refinitiv’s LNG Research operations in Asia
Provide “vision” on next steps for service from Asian region perspective
Analyse and forecast supply and demand of the global LNG market
Analyse and forecast price development of the LNG market
Responsible for maintaining and develop market models
Write regular market insight reports to present market views to customers
Communicate market insight in reports, presentations and direct customer contact
Improve content and design of our Eikon-based analytical tools, charts, and tables
Mentor more junior staff
Experience and Qualifications Required
Strong analytical skills
Ability to synthesize, structure and explain in-depth analysis
Strong grounding in statistics and/or operational research
Experience in developing fundamental models
Experience in the global LNG market (5 years)
Excellent written and spoken English
As a global business, Refinitiv relies on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. Therefore we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. pro-active, resourceful and self-motivated to innovate and take smart risks to achieve business goals and customer satisfaction
able to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges

a team player with strong influencing and people handling skills

Have excellent communication skills
Experience with Scrum and agile processes will be a bonus

Experience or familiarity with automation frameworks such as GTest, Selenium, TDD, BDD will be a bonus

The Ideal Candidate

You understand what it takes to build and support business critical desktop clients, components, and frameworks

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Job Opening ID: 122870
Singapore, Singapore

Company Overview
Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.

Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?
Group/Division
KLA has manufacturing sites across the globe, including Belgium, China, Germany, Israel, Singapore and Milpitas (CA). The Global Operations (GOPS) team, comprised of Manufacturing, Supply Chain Management, Global Logistics, Manufacturing Engineering, Installation, and Quality, is responsible for manufacturing our leading-edge technology. We partner with our world-wide supply base and our design engineering teams to bring new products to market. The GOPS team is continuously working to build our products Better, Faster, Cheaper.
Responsibilities
Job Summary:
As a Global Logistics Service Analyst, you provide the global analytical support and lead for required data analytics, metric creation, and operational and financial reporting. This is an Operations role in a team that includes Logistics Warehousing, Transportation, (inbound, outbound, returns) brokerage, duty and crating. In this role you will lead initiatives for evaluating service network distribution models, planning, procurement, inventory and repair product Logistics strategies, participating in the design of logistic processes and procedures, and analyzing the global operations logistics network to help devise a logistics network & strategy to optimize delivery to customers.
Additionally, you will create and implement tools and reporting metrics to help the Global team manage the business, fully understand the efficiency and cost drivers that enable us to maximize customer satisfaction and value. You will ensure effectiveness of Global team operations with adherence to consistent reporting and measurement practices across the Global Service Logistics teams, inclusive of Logistics related SOX processes, controls and compliance. You will assist in driving initiatives that enhance the overall Operations Logistics performance and cost by working collaboratively, analyzing and developing logistic plans that support our annual goals and objectives. You will ensure low cost transportation and warehousing through analysis and research of transportation methods, review audited results of provider costs and reviewing performance. You will provide financial support to the Finance team and/or analysis in budgeting, planning, business processes, or reporting to a portion of a functional organization or to more senior Operational and Finance staff. You will perform research, studies and financial cost modeling to help future business planning decisions, and create reports and summaries as required by business drivers.
This individual must possess hands on logistics operational knowledge as well as excellent analytical and data management skills and technology know-how needed to work successfully in high-pressure, time sensitive situations where customer satisfaction and efficient performance is the ultimate goal.
Essential Functions:
Develop and optimize logistics solutions for our customers, KLA Corporation and internal business constituents and develop best practices to drive consistency and value to the business.
Develop, monitor, and manage appropriate logistics operational and business metrics to meet or exceed performance requirements
Deal directly with Third Party Suppliers in both operational and contract management and performance review and improvement plans.
Develop, monitor enhance planning and forecasting models for Operations transactional Customer shipment volumes (Spares), return and repair shipments and logistics mode and volume tier impacts.
Ensure performance of Global 3rd Party Freight Payment Provider ensuring processes, controls, reporting and audits are in place according to contract.
Responsible for departmental monthly spend reconciliation – support fiscal month end analysis and reporting activity as required
Prepare and drive operational, inventory and financial cost metrics in support of key decision making.
Acts as a liaison by providing financial and operational reporting support to all functions within their region, and, as necessary dealing with vendors, suppliers, carriers and customs brokers
Participate in 3rd party logistics and Freight RFP/RFQ’s and support by developing and validating data and cost models. Provide post implementation support and analysis, tracking savings and validating the terms of the new SOW.
Qualifications
Requirements:
Prior experience in logistics operations in freight, warehousing, courier modes, Inventory, SOX compliance and third party return experience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and organizational skills are required.
Prior experience with developing budgets and controlling costs.
Proven track record of surpassing objectives and delivering exceptional results.
Ability to perform multiple actions across multiple regions.
Advanced computer and analytical/problem solving skills and presenting solutions
Strong data analysis and Excel skills.
Experience with developing project plans, budgets and predicting project costs and driving corrective actions to cost overruns.
Responsibility and Interaction:
Responsibility:
The tasks this individual is responsible for are often unstructured and the issues addressed are less defined requiring new perspectives and creative approaches.
This individual will apply attained experiences and knowledge in solving problems that are complex in scope requiring in-depth evaluation.
Demonstrate good judgment in solving problems as well as identifying problems in advance and proposing solutions.
The potential impact of decisions made by this individual has significant operational or financial impact.
Interaction:
This individual must work effectively with Staff to Senior Vice President level employees and employees within and outside of their function and organization.
Limited supervision and direction is provided, as this individual can operate and drive results and set priorities independently.
The ideal candidate will be a proactive contributor and subject matter expert.
To be successful, this individual must demonstrate favorable results through regular leadership and influencing others.
Education & Experience:
A minimum of 10 years of experience in Logistics environment
A Bachelor of Arts or Sciences Degree, or equivalent experience in a Logistics environment.
Expert level Excel, Access and Microsoft Office applications user.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects is required.

We are looking for an experienced digital analyst to join EDB’s digital marketing team. This is a unique chance for a highly motivated individual contributor who can improve the marketing team’s data literacy and help the team make data-driven decisions. The ideal candidate is an analytical and systematic thinker, who is naturally curious about customer behaviour and passionate about using data to improve performance. If this is you, we would love to have you on the team.


Roles and Responsibilities


As our digital marketing analyst, you are responsible to collect, analyse and report on website and marketing data regarding visitors, leads, web behaviours and campaign effectiveness


Tagging implementation: Work with marketing teams and external vendors to determine the tracking and measurement requirements, including guiding vendors to implement the tagging and ensure that the tracking codes are installed and firing correctly
Performance reporting: Work with senior management and vendors to determine ongoing business intelligence needs in order to design and develop web analytics reports and dashboards. This will include co-developing website KPIs and tracking indicators with the relevant business and marketing teams
Campaign analysis: Uncover learnings and insights to guide search, social, email and paid media campaigns, including continuously mining Adobe Analytics data for information and insights to improve website performance
Web development and personalization: Work with the Website Marketing team to create test plans to enhance web visitors’ experience. This will include executing initiatives to drive quality web traffic to the website (eg. new features, SEO, paid media), generate leads (eg. web forms, pop-ups) and nurture leads (eg. remarketing)
Training and education: evangelize and train internal teams and stakeholders on web analytics metrics and dashboards


To meet the challenges of this role, you must have/be:


A degree in relevant discipline (eg. marketing, economics, statistics, math)
2-5 years’ experience in digital marketing analytics
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Advanced user of web analytics tools (eg. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics)
Experience in building performance dashboards using data visualization tools (eg. Adobe Analytics Google Data Studio, Tableau, Domo, Datorama)
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Good understanding of statistical analysis, inference and experimental design
Working knowledge of inbound marketing concepts and best practices
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to identify business questions, draw meaningful conclusions and develop actionable recommendations
Able to work independently, has strong project management skills and attention to detail
Singaporean
