Job title: Global Stakeholder Engagement Regional Analyst, APAC
Job description:
Job Summary:

The Global Stakeholder Engagement (GSE) Regional Analyst will assist in coordinating outreach and communication activities to the ICANN community to encourage greater awareness and participation in ICANN policymaking. The Analyst will also help to develop regional strategies for engagement using a data-driven approach, and conduct research and analysis related to public policy and the Internet. The core responsibilities of the position include support for engagement activities; providing general routine support to the regional GSE team; research and data analysis; assisting the development and implementation of the ICANN regional Engagement Strategy in line with ICANN’s Strategic Plan.
Key Responsibilities & Duties:

PROJECT MANAGEMENT:

Plan and execute key community engagement activities (online and on-ground) in the region
Support and manage community engagement projects – drafting reports, note-taking for internal and external use, and managing communication and engagement tools

STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT AND FACILITATION:

Relationship management and communication across different stakeholder groups
Representing ICANN in external engagement

INTERNAL COORDINATION:

Coordinate with the regional GSE team on day-to-day operations such as processing sponsorships, administration of partnership arrangements, and tracking departmental tasks and deadlines
Work cross-functionally to support the development and implementation of the APAC Engagement Strategy and regional strategic goals in line with the ICANN Strategic Plan

RESEARCH, WRITING AND ANALYSIS:

Engage in research, writing and other activities to provide analysis and critical thinking on developments in the region affecting the Internet and ICANN
Gather and analyse information and data to track regional community participation and activities for the purpose of identifying gaps and trends
Research and drafting strategy papers related to ICANN’s APAC Engagement Strategy in line with ICANN’s Strategic Plan
Other duties as assigned or requested.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs): (Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions)

Keen interest in Domain Name System, emerging technologies, Internet governance, engagement across different stakeholder groups, relationship management, communications
Excellent skills in communication, writing, presenting, research, event coordination, project management, relationship management, comfortable with social media
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to establish and maintain effective working relations with people in a multi-cultural environment with respect for diversity
Experience developing strong external stakeholder relationships
Excellent organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail and scheduling required
Knowledge of ICANN, the Internet and the Domain Name System preferred but not required
Proficiency using MS Office, and keen to learn new software such as Salesforce and other platforms
Education and Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree required; Study in Public Policy, International Affairs, Communications, Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a computer related field desired
Minimum two (2) years of experience or equivalent in a multinational business, intergovernmental or international organization

Language

Fluency in written and spoken English is required
Additional language fluency will be highly advantageous
Working Conditions & Physical Requirements:
Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed
Work is performed in a normal office environment

The S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies (RSIS), a Graduate School of Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, is a leading research and teaching institution in strategic and international affairs and policy-oriented think-tank in the Asia-Pacific region. RSIS is seeking suitable candidates for the position of Research Analyst.
The successful candidate will assist the Distinguished Fellow in RSIS in his research projects, articles and papers, write speeches and search for data and references. The candidate will participate and organise conferences and seminars and perform administrative support related to these events, and undertake research and publish in international journals and the media.
Applicants should possess a Master degree in International Relations, Strategic Studies, Asian Studies or related fields. Applicants should also possess aptitude, interest and commitment for in-depth research, able to work independently, fluent in English with good writing and research skills.
All applicants should submit a detailed CV with 2 writing samples, 2 reference letters, a cover letter specifying how your qualifications match the job description.
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Hiring Institution: RSIS

A minimum of two years configuration, implementation or business support experience with an HCM application.3. Works well independently and within teams.4. Excellent organizational and interpersonal and written communication skills.6. Responsibilities
Translate pain-points of stakeholders into problem statements, architect and implement AI technologies/solutioning and present results and insights to business stakeholders.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a Senior Operations Analyst. You’re a problem solver who loves to make a direct impact on customers globally? Join us to be part of a friendly cross-functional team at the core of our Tech Operations. You’ll help ensure that we’re delivering service to our customers at expected quality levels and within reasonable costs.

Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will include:

Ensure we have sufficient capacity of resources at reasonable costs.
Estimate future capacity needs based on recent usage and business trends.
Determine current capacity. Coordinate load-tests and interview datacenters to understand the nature and size of bottlenecks. Involve engineers as needed.
Determine gaps between current capacity and future needs.
Create and execute plans for procuring/replacing/deprecating resources to meet future needs. This involves complex decision making. You need to compare various vendors in terms of their service-quality to users, service-quality to us internally, pricing, and risk-levels. Negotiate deals with datacenters. Those involve not just pricing, but also conditions on volume-commitments, length, functionality, out-clauses, and other criteria. You also need to balance technical considerations like service-quality and security and risk levels.
Adjust our load-balancing and location-picking systems to optimize our customer experience while keeping cost within budget.
Design, document and improve processes. The nature of the team’s work is highly complex. Our processes need to enable normal human beings to consistently deliver excellent results.
Triage incidents and manage them to resolution. Issues can come from our internal monitoring systems, escalations from customer support-team, as well as our 150+ datacenters.
Create weekly SLA reports, analyze, find insight, drive action.

Success metrics:

Keep quality-metrics within SLA, especially relating to uptime and speeds.
Budget efficiency. Keep $ costs per active user within budget.
Requirements
At least 5 years of working experience.
Strong English verbal and written communication skills. You’ll need to communicate quickly and clearly with engineers on our team, as well as sales and tech-support staff at data centers.
You’ll need a driven personality. Demand fast turnaround times from the datacenters, chase and push to get things done.
You should have a keen ability to ask questions, dig into an issue until you understand it.
You must be comfortable handling competing priorities.
Strong analytical thinking. Comfortable doing basic data analysis in Excel or similar tools.
Experience in process-oriented problem-solving.[CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]

About the job
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges.

As a Financial Analyst, you will take on a number of technical and partnership responsibilities related to Google’s relationships with media agencies. You will work on projects with cross-functional and global teams that will be focused on reducing Google’s risks and increasing the company’s operational efficiency. You will also partner with APAC sales teams, acting as a key advisor to both the Finance and Sales Leadership teams on issues such as business performance, resource allocation, risk/opportunity analysis and budgeting.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
Responsibilities
Drive insights and analysis which support the APAC media and creative agency business and shape business strategy, in partnership with regional and country sales leadership.
Lead finance/analytical projects to develop the next generation of insights and recommendations that advance the efficiency of our agency- and deals-related processes.
Maintain and take ownership of a suite of finance tools that help produce financial insights globally and produce recommendations on improvements or build new tools as needed.
Partner with cross-functional and global teams to understand and surface industry, product, and business related trends.
Manage and drive efficiency in core finance processes such as P&Ls, financial and strategic planning, performance reporting, and opex management.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.

To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.

We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.

Job Purpose

The Local Corporate team is one of the most crucial teams within Commercial Banking.
The role of the Analyst within this team is important as the Analyst provides independent credit analysis and the basis of a credit strategy to maximizing our client wallet share to one or a number of Relationship Managers. They provide the Relationship Manager with a thorough understanding of the client’s industry, business cycles, and other relevant factors. To do this effectively they may focus on particular industry segments. In addition they effectively manage a credit portfolio

The Role Responsibilities

As a successful Analyst within the Local Corporate team you will provide proactive, comprehensive and timely credit analysis to Relationship Manager’s and the Credit community. Your daily job would include:

Provide Relationship Managers with client insights with regard to industry sector, client information and account plans.
Manage ongoing quality of portfolio, producing exception reports as appropriate review credit extent across entire portfolio to ensure consistency of approach
Educate Relationship Manager’s on macroeconomic fundamentals impacting their credit portfolio
Provide creative recommendations to Relationship Manager’s by monitoring peer groups, competitors, industry reviews, non standard industry information/ data (equity, credit reports, press and magazine reports)
Evaluate learning around exception cases and seeks to share this with other Analysts to help properly capture of risk profiles and ensure robust credit analysis
Assist, train and mentor Junior Credit Analysts, Interns and International Graduate’s
Assist Head CA / Relationship Manager’s / other team members on ad-hoc projects / deals etc. as and when required.
Our Ideal Candidate
Strong analytical skills with ability to analyze financial statements and perform risk assessment
Ability to prepare comprehensive and well articulated credit proposals and defend them to stakeholders
Good understanding of banking products such as trade , lending , FX etc
Team player with a can-do attitude
Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Roles & Responsibilities
The APAC team is looking for a Social Media Listening Analyst that will be an expert in research and analysis while interested to dive into the trend-spotting areas such as index scoring and validation.

Research & Analysis

You will hand period projects and calendar focused that will design, conduct and deliver standard and custom social media reports.
You will be responsible for hosting discovery sessions with the agency's clients to understand the business need.
You will translate this into constructed queries that will monitor the social conversation for internal client teams as well as competitive brands, Influencers, programs, products, marketing campaigns, and events.
You will deep dive into the data to uncover drivers of social buzz, then translates the data into a compelling story.
You’re accountable for deciphering what is important, meaningful data and then communicating the concise story in a way that allows the business to make decisions based on the reports.

Trend Spotting (Index Scoring & Validation)

You will monitor daily or upon ad-hoc requests various social listening and content monitoring towards trends and hot news.
You will create a semi-automated workflow that can pickup daily social triggers as guidance for internal and client teams. This would require quick thinking and fast turnaround on queries, and linking up with API access of tools to pull from selected data points.

THE TASK AT HAND

Consult stakeholders on topic definitions, social listening measures and filters to define objectives and set deliverables for standard and custom reports.
Implement social analysis for campaigns/events and present insights back to inform content /Media decisions for campaign/event activities and advise on actions to take from optimizations standpoint.
Social listening tool setup including keywords, query parameters, and dashboards.
Take initiative on the refinement of query parameter setup to ensure accurate and insightful mention analysis is available to report on by the end of the reporting period.
Pull and interpret data from social listening tools including volume, sentiment, conversation drivers, influencers, etc.
Create and edit reporting deliverables for PowerPoint, Newsletter and Excel formats that transform social data into a clear story. Visualize findings legibly using charts, tables, and infographics, and provide actionable insights based on concrete data.
Manage a deliverable calendar of recurring scheduled and ad hoc reports.
Good housekeeping - upkeep of shared calendars and the storage of report agreement documents and delivered reports.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, Communications, Economics, Computer Science, Information technology or Human-Computer Interaction or related educational concentration
2-3 years of professional experience in marketing/business analytics, statistical analysis, predictive modeling or segmentation experience setting
Minimum 3 years of experience in online/social analytics
Be able to properly set expectations based on program scope, reporting schedules and follow through on delivery.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and proven ability to transform data into a concise, yet compelling story.
Ability to synthesize information and produce insightful and accurate analysis and recommendations.
Good mix of technical understanding, business sense, managerial/connecting and Interpersonal skills (Experience with Boolean, Python, Excel prototyping of data visualization or using a data visualization tool is critical for growing in this role)
Strong familiarity and understanding of social media platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, Forums, Instagram, Forums, Chat applications, is required.
Relevant experience pulling data from social media listening/analytics tools such as Crimson Hexagon, Sprinklr, SimplyMeasured, Google Studio, etc.[CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]

Global Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues, and are strong advocates for the Facebook community.


We leverage data analysis, machine learning and a robust infrastructure to review the quality of promoted and organic content on our platform. We partner closely with several cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and operational teams, to ensure high quality and safe experiences for both people and businesses across the Facebook family of apps.


The analyst role is within the Central Analytics team within Global Operations. Members of this team focus on building and maintaining the key metrics and logging for Global Operations and providing insights through analysis and analytical tools that drive strategy for Global Operations. We are looking for someone who has strong analytical, communications, and project management skills and is passionate about deploying them to support data projects within the team. In this role, you will work closely with our global team to scope projects, plan and drive execution, and coordinate with various cross functional teams to ensure timely delivery of data infra and analytical projects.


This position is full-time and is based in our office in Singapore.
TECHNICAL ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage cross-functional programs covering a range of data products and data infrastructure for Global Operations
Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery
Collaborate with cross-functional partners to ensure awareness, agreement, alignment and commitment to the teams data projects
Perform risk management and change management on projects
Interface with cross-functional partners for project requirements
Analyze and understand the data to inform project scope and deliverables
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BA/BS degree with 4+ years relevant professional work experience in Analytics, Data Science, or Data Engineering roles, including at least 2 years experience with program or project management responsibilities
Strong leadership and communication skills and ability to build consensus across multiple stakeholders to create a collaborative, innovative, and high-performing Analytics network
Ability to influence Data Engineering, Data Science, and Operations teams through a strong understanding of data modeling and analytics
Experience using organizational and coordination skills along with multi-tasking capabilities to get things done in a fast paced environment
Strategic thinker with strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills
Experience with SQL, data analysis, visualization tools (e.g. Tableau), or programming languages such as Python
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math/Finance, Physics, Economics, Statistics or other technical discipline
Experience working with or in support of global communities
Experience working in an Operations environment for a large company

Our Company
For more than a century, our Company has been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, it continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

Who we are
Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as “Merck” in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as “MSD” in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.
We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.
What we look for
In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

IMPACT.
INSPIRE.

We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. As an IT Business Analyst for the SAP Supply Chain Solutions area, you will be part of an Agile project team utilizing the Agile / Scrum methodologies, working in a dynamic, interactive environment while working closely with business partners. You will work to build and configure new systems, improve existing systems, craft design documentation, software specifications, and testing/training scenarios and will evaluate processes for alignment opportunities. You will provide input on new functionality estimation, analysis, design and testing and define application requirements by collaborating with the Back End and Supply Chain partners and other members of the project teams.

As a project team member, you will support the entire project lifecycle from initial project definition to project implementation (including testing and training) through to project closure. You will also be an authority on current Supply Chain processes and systems; identify, recommend, and drive process improvements; and serve as a consultant on these processes and systems for partners and customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS:
Serve as an internal consultant and SME within Supply Chain teams and partner organizations on SAP capabilities and operations execution best practicesPartner with Supply Chain area domain experts to understand capability needs and to improve the overall efficiency of the teamsDrive delivery of supply chain Backend/Subcontractor solutions within our ECC toolsetDeliver medium-large scale, departmental projects by using an established delivery methodologyProvide functional and process guidance on system capabilities and solution approachesWork within different teams (Operations areas, other SCRUM teams, SC, PMO) to drive successful deploymentsUse metrics and performance data to understand opportunities for improvement

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:
B.S. / B.B.A in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Information Systems or equivalent work experienceGood interpersonal skills (both speaking and writing); Technical Writing skills are a plusGood knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio); Collaboration tools (SharePoint, Teams, etc.)Knowledge of Agile / SCRUM / KANBAN methodologies a plusMinimum of 1-3 years experience in SAP, preferably within the OM (Order Management) or LE (Logistics Execution) areas.

As the leader in innovative memory solutions, Micron is helping the world make sense of data by delivering technology that is transforming how the world uses information. Through our global brands — Micron, Crucial and Ballistix — we offer the industry’s broadest portfolio. We are the only company manufacturing today’s major memory and storage technologies: DRAM, NAND, NOR and 3D XPoint™ memory. Our solutions are purpose built to leverage the value of data to unlock financial insights, accelerate scientific breakthroughs and enhance communication around the world.

Industry-leading editing and writing skills

About the job
The Think with Google APAC team is a group of data analysts, designers, writers, editors, digital marketers, and strategists working within Google Marketing tasked with shaping and delivering—seamlessly and in real-time—the consumer, industry, and marketing insights that our customers need to win on the web. We put Google data and insights into the heart (and start) of all marketing. Google is at the forefront of a revolution in marketing — a shift from traditional ads to personalized, relevant and engaging formats. Through our Think with Google website and other owned channels, we share insights, research, data, and perspectives on the evolving landscape for marketers today. With a focus on what’s top of mind for executives at large advertisers and agencies, we aim to help our customers understand how they can make the web work for their businesses. At the heart of our value proposition to large advertisers and agencies is industry-leading content and insights from Google’s unique point of view. Whether it’s research and data on consumer behavior, seasonal consumer trends, or perspectives on major shifts happening on digital marketing platforms today… you’ll be leading and managing an editorial team that surfaces these insights and transforms them into business intelligence for our audience. Through both entrepreneurial drive and a data-driven mindset, you will lead a content strategy that can measurably improve our customers’ businesses.
Responsibilities
Oversee content strategy and editorial operations for all Think with Google channels (website, social, newsletters), working with stakeholders across Google Ads Marketing and Sales teams.
Work with business leads/teams across multiple markets and regional teams to create editorial content that drives our business narratives.
Establish, maintain, and continuously optimize the style and tone guidelines of the site and manage editors who are directly shaping all content on site.
Explore new formats and channels to extend our insights further, such as developing podcasts, video series, etc., and ensure platform features and UX support our content strategy, serving as driver of new functionality/features related to content consumption and messaging, and recommending testing programs to optimize content UX on site.
Build editorial partnerships with external industry groups, industry publications, and customers.

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst creates a strategy for customer interaction (through Account Manager and technology activities) for the purpose of increased retention, satisfaction or revenue. They live and breathe the client’s value proposition, by reviewing and analysing the benefits that can be delivered to the existing customer base.
Through in depth analysis of usage data and risk profiles, the analyst designs a series of sales playbooks and aligns their team to leverage that value proposition, with the intention to grow the existing customer base. The analyst leverages the client’s messaging and marketing collateral to ensure that a series of sales play books are delivered to the highest possible standards in line with their brand values.
Job Responsibilities
To engage senior internal stakeholders (leadership) beyond reporting and operations
Perform Data Analytics (relevant data, meaningful information, actionable insights)
Review usage data (where possible) to design sales playbooks that relate to customer interaction with a particular product or service
Report on and track revenue generating programs/campaigns
Publish specific dashboards/balanced scorecards with key metrics and conclusions
Produce account insight for QBRs (quarterly business review)
Perform Market Basket Analysis to drive Sales Volume
Define/ Influence sales metrics and measurement (diagnose root-causes, devising solutions, and pushing execution)
Utilise existing KPIs from Service Source whitepapers or identify alternatives that are suitable
Train/Coach sales force on effective report and dashboard utilization
Academics:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, preferably in Computer Science or Finance, with 4+ years of experience in campaign /marketing management, business analytics, dashboard design experience (preferably supporting a sales organization but not essential).
Competencies:
Proven track record demonstrating an aptitude to analyse trends, compile data into comprehensive reports, and making recommendations based off findings
Excellent communication skills – written and verbal with an ability to convey complex information to a broad audience
Proven knowledge and effective use of MS office applications
Demonstrated high level of proficiency in CRM, MS office (advanced Excel), SQL and Tableau.

5 days work week (Mon - Fri / 9.00am - 6.00pm)
Singapore office is at walking distance from nearest MRT (Labrador Park)

Global Operations' focus is on improving the health of our products and helping people understand how to use them through both direct support interactions as well as scalable solutions. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people’s issues and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms. Scaled Operations (within Global Operations) manages the human expertise required for the integrity and experience of our community and business. If you like helping people, Global Operations is for you.


*Site Operations Support* is a new team that has been set up centrally within the *Global Partner Ops *organization to enable our Partner Managers with the required analytics, process & intel support to run a robust Partner Site operation. The team will drive Site level analyses & insights and provide close operational support to the Partner Managers. We are looking for an Analyst based in *Singapore* to be part of this high-performing global team. The right candidate should be passionate about improving operations and be able to thrive in a dynamic, ambiguous environment.
ANALYST, SITE OPERATIONS SUPPORT RESPONSIBILITIES
Effectively plan and manage complex projects on the Site Operations Support roadmap from the initial ideation phase through final execution to further our mission
Set up & maintain robust Site-level scaleable processes for our Partner sites
Investigate & define clear business problems and prioritize solutions using data-driven analytics, developing success metrics to measure project performance and alignment with team mission and goals
Collaborate with operations and data-focused teams within and outside Scaled Operations to solve problems and develop solutions
Work with data and analytics partners to identify and track key program performance indicators, and ensure the results contribute to overall company, product, customer, and community experience goals
Identify and assess risks & opportunities
drive site level goals & metrics to improve performance
Explore new opportunities for site level collaboration
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Hands-on experience with data analysis with an operational context
3+ years of experience in strategy, analytics or process improvement within Facebook or in technology companies
Experience leading cross-functional projects and ability to work with people at all levels both inside and outside of Facebook
Experience managing with ambiguity in a high-pressure environment
Ability to communicate the results of analyses, along with the ability to compile briefing materials and other communications
Analytical ability with experience using data tools and SQL
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced degree (MS/MA/MBA)
Experience working with high-performance teams focused on Analytics
Strong program and project management experience
Demonstrated success presenting complex research data (qualitative and quantitative) in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action
Experience working with or in support of diverse communities and global teams
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.

Job title: Digital Business Analyst/ Programme Manager, Planning
Job description:
What to Expect:


 Support the planning process, such as envisioning, formulation of the Group’s planning guidance, development, implementation and evaluation of the Group’s plans, goals, objectives, policies and procedures.

Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplines

Job title: ED / SVP, Platform Architect, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology and Operations
Job description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Responsibilities

Define and own end to end architecture for Big Data Analytics Solutions for Consumer Banking Group. Drive our data analytics and ML application architecture.
Engage with business analysts, marketing, operations teams in Consumer Banking Group to understand their needs and create big data analytics solutions that meet the business needs
Work closely with Big Data Engineering and Data Science team to implement, troubleshoot, and optimise distributed applications based on modern big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. in both an on premise and cloud deployment model to solve large scale processing problems.
Lead the transformation of a peta-byte scale batch-based processing platform to a near real-time
Streaming platform using technologies such as Kafka and Spark.
Transition several 100’s of existing applications (based in Teradata, Informatica, Qlik View, SAS based analytics and ML models) to modern big data analytics applications based on Hadoop, Spark, Kafka etc
Well versed with Data Sciences, Machine learning and Deep Learning based solutions and frameworks. Apply technical knowledge to architect solutions that meet business and IT needs infusing key analytics and ML technologies where appropriate
Provide expert level support to data scientists, data engineers, and operations to deliver high quality analytics, machine learning data pipelines, APIs and end to end solutions.
Maintain and advance deep technical skills and knowledge, keeping up to date with market trends and competitive insights, and share within the technical community
Develop deep relationships with key business stakeholders and decision makers to drive cloud adoption within their company to enable them to be cloud advocates
Requirements
Technical Degree, min of Bachelors in Computer Science or adjacent fields with 15+ years of software development experience
10+ years of expertise in Big Data technologies including Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Hadoop, No-SQL databases such as Hbase, Cassandra, OLAP columnar storage systems, Bit Map indexes to handle millions of consumers and thousands of attributes while allowing real-time querying and segmentation
Must have hands on coding skills in Java or Python
Experience in building data services and applications on both structured and unstructured streaming data
Experience in operationalising Machine Learning workflows to scale
Breadth of technical experience and expertise in Business Intelligence, Big Data and Data Science
Proven track record of driving architecture decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (Senior Executives, IT management and engineers)
Hunger to Learn & Teach – Genuine interest to learn new technologies and share it with rest of the engineering team to keep them up-to-date on technology trends.
Problem solver – Enjoy new and meaningful technology or business challenges which require you to think and respond quickly
Open source – Prefer open source technologies and build it yourself mentality, open source contribution is highly preferred.
Team player – Enjoy working collaboratively with a talented group of people to tackle challenging business problems so we all succeed (or fail fast) as a team
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time
Preferred Skills

Experience with big data analytics and data science solutions developed in large cloud computing infrastructures such as Amazon Web Services, Azure Cloud, and/or Google Cloud
Prior experience as a data architect in designing large, complex enterprise data environments, for both structured and unstructured data. Expertise in data modelling, data governance, data mastering, meta-data management, data security and compliance, data lifecycle management, data-tiering and data archiving
Presence in open source projects will be huge plus.
Experience with Personalisation, Recommendation, Audience Segmentation systems

The Business Analyst II is responsible for support of clients in the daily activities related to their various business needs including responding to internal and external requests in an effort to identify process improvements, facilitating solutions and continually maintaining the client’s established business relationship, supporting service activities, and analyzing complex data for assigned APAC clients.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Analyze and clarify freight rate agreements received from clients so that these rates and business rules associated with these rates can be setup in Cass’ rating engine.
Analyze complex and large amount of shipment and invoice data.
Independently interact with clients via telephone, email, and in person to understand needs, answer questions, and resolve issues related to account processing (data and requirements gathering).
Provide superior, professional, ongoing, and consistent communication and consultative support with designated clients.
Proactively resolve issues and implement strategies for successful client relationships.
Thoroughly analyze processed data, issues, and requests and communicate resolutions verbally and in writing, customizing solutions to meet client’s needs.
Train external users, including clients and carriers, on new and existing services.
Assist with and write customer requirement documentation, procedures, and user manuals.
Act as a positive representative of the company, both internally and externally, in accordance with written principles of the organization.
Update account manager of significant issues on a timely basis.
Other duties as assigned.
SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Well-developed organizational skills in order to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Self-directed with the ability to work with little supervision.
Demonstrated ability dealing with a broad range of situations that require diplomacy, confidentiality, and sensitivity.
Ability to analyze complex details to resolve processing issues and provide customized data and reports.
Positive, professional, and friendly attitude.
Ability to quickly comprehend new concepts and embrace them.
Willingness to travel internationally.
A strong ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbally at all levels
Proficiency in written and spoken English, Mandarin preferred.
Technologically savvy with the ability to learn proprietary web-based systems. Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite (including advanced Excel skills) and SQL database.

MINIMUM LEVEL OF PREPARATION AND TRAINING NORMALLY REQUIRED:
A bachelor’s degree in a quantitatively oriented course or equivalent experience.
3-5 years of customer relations experience in a technical service environment or other related experience preferred (preferably in logistics and transportation).

Please apply directly to this position via the “Apply” button. You will be required to create an account and provide your resume, contact information and other pertinent employment information. This process typically takes 20 minutes or less. Should we find that you meet the minimum requirement of the position, a member of our recruiting team will be in touch to start the interview process.

ABOUT OUR COMPANY:

Cass Information Singapore PTE LTD is a subsidiary of Cass Information Systems, Inc., the leading provider of transportation, utility and telecom invoice payment and related business intelligence services, disbursing $40 billion annually on behalf of its customers. The support of Cass Commercial Bank, founded in 1906, makes Cass Information Systems unique in the industry.

Job title: Director, Shopper Insights & Category Management, Integrated Marketing, Travel Retail APAC
Job description:
Our Travel Retail APAC region is seeking to appoint a Shopper Insights and Category Strategy Director for their Asia Pacific (APAC).


This position is based in the Singapore offices of Estee Lauder Companies’ Travel Retail APAC HQ, and reports to the Vice President of Shopper Insights and Category Strategy based in New York, with a matrix to the VP of Integrated Marketing, TR APAC. The successful candidate will also sit on the leadership team of the Travel Retail APAC region and therefore will be a close partner to the President of the TR APAC region, and the Regional Business Directors for our brands.


This role is extremely high profile. It requires sophisticated subject matter expertise across qualitative and quantitative research approaches, and the ability to explain complex data in an engaging and persuasive way to a senior and international audience. Thus, the successful candidate should have worked in an insights leadership role within a corporate setting, have demonstrable experience of high level presentations and crucially, must be an insights professional with a deep knowledge of the Chinese consumer market, cosmetics and beauty.

Typically this role is focused on shoppers, and therefore has a heavy retail and retail dynamics focus, and also includes as a part of this, category strategy, meaning understanding key category and subcategory dynamics and supporting growth in these via provision of insight based strategic recommendation.

This role would include the following responsibilities:
Work with the President of TR APAC, Regional brand directors and VP of Integrated Marketing, TR APAC, to establish a strategic, focused, shopper insights and category strategy program for the fiscal year, ensuring adequate budget allocation. To do this, you will be expected to digest business questions and recommend creative and innovative insights solutions which support your stakeholders in answering these questions.
Act as the expert on the ground to the VP Shopper Insights and Category Strategy, based in New York, committing to regular knowledge sharing, supporting her in elements of high level strategy and business question solving.
Additionally work with internal commercial stakeholders to sustain our research relationships with key retailers, and ensure opportunities for collaboration are identified.
Work directly with Research vendors, agencies and tools to oversee the roll out of the insights projects you commission, keeping internal stakeholders updated, and ensuring deliverables are provided in a timely manner, and crucially shared appropriately to ensure actions can be taken.
Lead your team of two analysts (one based in Shanghai) and ensure their skills are appropriately deployed across the projects you commission, as well as supporting their growth and development and coaching their research skills.
Act as the ambassador for evidence based decision making within the region, offer up consultancy where required, conduct regular outreach and sharing sessions and ensure your industry knowledge stays updated.
Work with the wider global team of Travel Retail insights professionals to arrive at collaborative projects and deliverables with meaning beyond just your region; ie passenger insights, category gap analyses, category innovation studies etc.
As with all insights professionals, develop a passion for our brands and consumers which enhances the outputs you deliver

Qualifications

The successful candidate would be a degree holder, who has a wealth of experience working at a director level within an insights agency and or in-house in a corporate insights role, with significant hands on responsibility for running research projects and leading analysis.
To be successful in this role, you need to possess an ability to present data creatively. You would be a strong public speaker, possessing diplomacy, discretion, excellent listening skills and be articulate in both the spoken and written English and Mandarin.
You should also be passionate about brands, travel, media, technology, social media, and trends.
This role will require you to travel within the APAC region.

Our Story

Circles.Life revolutionizes the digital services industry by giving power back to our customers. Born in Singapore as Asia's first and most successful digital telco, our services have been rapidly gaining market share since our 2016 launch, while delivering best-in-class customer experience. We are owning the market in innovation, customer happiness and growth.

Looking ahead, Circles.Life plans to further leverage its telco technology, including a new digital data platform to create more lifestyle products. Discover is the first of many more.

We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

Working as a single point-of-contact and taken a self-driven and process oriented approach to various requirements

Experience or knowledge in basic statistical and analytical techniques

Basic knowledge in Python

Good to Have


JavaScript knowledge (D3JS etc.)
Knowledge in Shell scripting
Big Data Query engines (Hive, Spark, Athena etc.)

 JOB DESCRIPTION

The role will be responsible for assisting and coordinating the development, analysis and publication of strategic plans, including market, customer and competitor profiles/analysis. Analysis includes end market dynamics, performance measures/metrics, identification of sources of improvements, and assessment of business dynamics including recommended responses to threats.
The responsibilities of the role:
Plans, coordinates, and facilitates selected Planning Activities preparation activities and develops content consistent with the company's strategy, priorities, profit and growth targets.
Responsible for direct interface with the company's Corporate Planning for Strategic Reviews, Corporate Planning Conference, and numerous miscellaneous data gathering needs.
Assists in the preparation and coordination of Operation Reviews, Board Meetings and President’s Councils.
Conducts internal and external market research to develop and maintain a Strategic Planning knowledge database of market and industry conditions and trends (economic, technological and regulatory) and customer/competitor data to identify opportunities and challenges.
Works with the company's executives to develop growth plans and prepares analysis in support of key business decisions.
Participates in identification and analysis of strategic partnerships, alliances.
Directly supports Sales, Marketing and Business Unit needs.

Job title: GF - Citi Security Investigative Services ASPAC GIA - Open Source Intelligence Analyst
Job description:
Citi Security and Investigative Services (CSIS) is a full-service security and investigative team that protects the assets, integrity, and reputation of Citi and its clients. We accomplish this by offering in-house professional security services and independent investigations to clients across all of Citi's businesses and regions, and partnerships with other Citi business groups, law enforcement agencies, governments and industry counterparts.
The Global Intelligence & Analysis (GIA) program within CSIS combines a specialized global intelligence research and analytical resources, in support of threat (cyber, fraud & security) intelligence and business analytics.
Based in Singapore this position will report to the Regional GIA Manager. In support of CSIS Global functions, the incumbent will conduct tactical, analytical and operational analysis of various publicly available data sources and unconventional deep web sources with the purpose of assessing potential threats to Citi personnel and facilities. Additionally the incumbent will be responsible for providing follow-the-sun support to other regions and seeking improvement in methodologies used and creating new solutions - based on subject matter expertise in order to identify areas of operational efficiencies for the open source intelligence program.
Key Responsibilities:
Apply open source techniques to collect, organize, synthesize, and summarize data from multiple sources in order to provide actionable information to decision makers.
Produces analytical products and briefings/presentations for senior leadership and operational personnel on a variety of open source derived threats and intelligence reporting.
Liaise with a broad network of partners on open source methodologies and sources of information in order to develop best practices.
Innovate and generate new ideas, concepts, and models to improve methods of obtaining and evaluating data through qualitative and quantitative means.
Perform analysis on disparate external data sources and evaluate multiple internal sources of information in order to determine any useful correlations between OSINT and internal data holdings. Drive quality, reliability, and usability of all work products.
Demonstrate ability to identify and anticipate the problems and product/solution needs of our clients.
Type of Work:
Applies advanced disciplinary knowledge to handle all complex incidents independently
Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area
Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business
Thorough understanding of procedures and concepts within OSINT
Consistently utilizes project management skills to execute multiple tasks simultaneously
Consistently delivers information in a concise and logical way as well as be sensitive to audience diversity
Responsible for the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function
Problem Solving
Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information
Advanced understanding of intelligence cycle and how to apply open source techniques, tactics, and procedures
Advanced knowledge of how to organize, filter, interpret, synthesize, and analyze disparate data sets. Demonstrates consistent ability to validate potentially complex and dynamic material and transform information to useful intelligence.
Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange complex and sensitive information
Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner within anticipated and agreed upon timeframe
Impact / Accountability
Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization
Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual
Leadership / Management
Provides training to other team members on new techniques or methods learned in outside programs
Qualifications
Minimum BA, postgraduate degrees welcomed / Degrees in intelligence studies, international relations, journalism, statistics, finance, or computer science/information technology preferred
Minimum of three years of relevant professional experience in the finance industry, intelligence community, or fraud investigations required
Minimum of one year of analytical experience in OSINT community required / Previous experience with financial investigations or intelligence community is preferred.
Professional certifications (ACAMS, CFE, etc.) are helpful
Experience in utilizing visualization software applications, including Palantir, Semantica Pro, i2
Proven record of accomplishment of information gathering, including strong use of commercial databases, internet and non‐digitized sources
Demonstrated ability to analyze, evaluate and interpret complex data with a strong understanding and application of analytical techniques
Demonstrated self-starter and resourceful individual, with experience of operating in fast paced and dynamic operational settings
Broad professional experience, including prior international work experience/travel or experience working as part of a globally dispersed team an advantage
Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills. Ability to communicate, both orally and in writing, through all levels of the organization
Exceptional business grammar writing capabilities
Self-motivated with the ability and maturity to make decisions in the absence of detailed instructions
Advanced expertise in Microsoft Office products - Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, PowerPoint, & SharePoint – demonstrated creativity in use of these products to solve analytical problems
-

Time Type :Full time

Job title: Revenue Operations Analyst - based in Singapore supporting Japan market
Job description:
Summary
Posted: Dec 10, 2019
Role Number:200131953
Team up with Apple, one of the most influential technology leaders in the industry. Join the Apple Finance organization and make a positive impact on a company that is known for its impressive lineup of products, including iPhone, iPad, Mac, iPod and Apple Watch. At Apple, you will share in a commitment to excellence by partnering with world-class managers, all with one unified vision creating innovative products that delight customers. We do this by hiring quality individuals with integrity, personal accountability, teamwork, excellence and proactive thinking. If you exemplify our values and want to be part of something big, contact us today.
Apple’s Global Business Solutions (GBS) organization operates four shared service centers around the world. The Singapore shared services center delivers exceptional finance services in Record to Report, Procure to Pay and Order to Cash to support our businesses in more than 10 countries in the Asia Pacific Region.
Apple is looking for an outstanding finance professional for the position of a Revenue Operations Analyst. The successful candidate will become a member of the wider Finance Team with regional interactions.
Key Qualifications
Work with a variety of cross-functional teams and external customers or partners to drive sales incentive calculations and ensure sales incentive credit processing are executed and accounted for accurately and timely according to the Service Level Agreement (SLA)
Continually validate and challenge, by way of analytical review, customer rebate program terms and calculation methodology
Participate in process improvements and systems enhancements initiatives to improve the productivity and scalability of key processes
Build and maintain cross-geography relationships with internal partners and external customers
Work closely with Information Systems & Technology, Order-to-Cash, various Finance & Sales groups to ensure that processes are sustainable, scalable, and produce accurate results
Solid analytical skills to provide revenue adjustment and customer rebate metrics information to Management offering insight and analysis on the business trends, key work drivers, etc
Safeguard Apple’s integrity from a compliance perspective in ensuring compliance with Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) control processes and ensure they are operating effectively
Support as a backup where needed
Key Skills and Competencies:
Demonstrated ability to deliver high quality work in a fast-paced work environment and to strive for excellence
Possess positive energy and attitude with a desire to drive constant improvement and changes
An ability to cut through ambiguity, to listen, challenge and innovate
Communicate effectively; comfortable presenting to customers and senior leadership on regular basis
Work both independently and within a team environment
Strong customer service, business partnership and cross-functional leadership skills
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Strong process and data analysis skills
SAP Experience is an advantage
Advanced Excel skills is required
Minimum 7 years of progressive financial management experience
Japanese language proficiency (native or JLPT N1 level) to support the respective country
Description
This individual will be a team player and experienced in a customer facing role. You will be an inquisitive and creative thinker who understand business strategies and rebate program concepts and able to execute and deliver operational goals. With a broad awareness of business issues, policies and excellent understanding of business processes, you will also have the ability to balance business, customer and operational issues and make business decision recommendations. A flair for communicating complex issues in an understandable form to a diverse audience is important too.
Education & Experience
Bachelor degree in Accounting or Finance
MBA or CPA / CA preferred
Additional Requirements
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.

Roles & Responsibilities
The Senior Data Scientist will bring his/her experience in the definition, selection, rollout of technology platforms that support data analysis. He/She will work closely with the engineering teams that carry out analytics to ensure that the solutions are appropriate to support analysis of our service operations.

The role requires a considerable amount of teamwork and influencing skills to bring together many parts of the business to progress resolution of analysis and issues. Management of stakeholders at all levels of the business is expected, including senior management.

The role interfaces into the Technical Design and Development teams, Customer Experience teams, Business Units, Customer Support team, our Service Partners, Network Operations and to our Technology Suppliers.

Build and present reliable/robust predictive and prescriptive tactical and strategic insights for solving key business challenges.
Support teams within Inmarsat in analyses and modelling of service performance, leveraging a combination of internal and external customer data.
Work with other stakeholders and data scientists throughout the Inmarsat organisation to identify opportunities for leveraging company and external data to drive business solutions and improve the company practices in different domains.
Identify new tools and keeps abreast of new technologies for data analysis, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence.
Identify and monitor specific investigations and assess impact on our services, our network, our business.
Have innovative approach as investigations are unique and each use different Machine Learning techniques.

Qualifications - Essential Knowledge and Skills

At least 5 years of experiences in data science and quantitative analysis.
Degree in Computer Science/Stats/Mathematics/Physics or related quantitative discipline
Knowledge of satellite communications including L-band, Ka band, S-band
Knowledge of Service Delivery Domain and application to Value Added Service offerings.
Knowledge of IP Traffic and monitoring including DPI technology
Ability to comprehend complex contexts and to communicate ideas in a simple business language to stakeholders from CXOs to junior analysts.
Understanding of databases and proven experience of working with and creating enterprise data models and data architectures.
Analytics software knowledge and experience in visualising/presenting data for stakeholders using various data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, DataStudio).
Presence and charisma to convince any audience of the route to success and with the ability to build strong and powerful relationships.
An aptitude for strategic development and implementation.
Demonstrable track record of integrity and commercial acumen

We are looking for talents who are passionate to be part of an exciting 3-year-old marketing, sales & service consultancy. He or she will have the opportunity to work closely with the Founder and VK Transformation's rockstars to expand the practice and help businesses to navigate through the complexities and uncertainties business environment. You will have the opportunity to take the lead for our Data Analytics Center of Excellence, he or she will be responsible to develop analytics capabilities for the firm, acquire relevant data, analyze multiple data sources and translate them into actionable business insights for our clients to improve sales & marketing performance.

The Business Analyst will experience exponential learning curve if he or she can thrive in a fast-paced and ambiguous nature of a consulting practice startup. The analyses will cover advanced statistical concepts like multi-variate analysis, decision trees, random forest, statistical forecasting, data mining, recommendation systems, user behavior modeling etc. that will have a direct impact on sales and marketing metrics.Work closely with the team to deliver advanced data-driven decision making for the business.Develop analytical frameworks to capture new opportunities, improve sales productivity and business operations for our clients. This model will also support the coaching conversation between sales/business leaders and sales professionals.Document technical and functional specifications and proof of concept findings.Build sales & marketing models and scenarios.Conduct research and draw insights to review and develop business growth strategies for the firm and clients as well as improve their competitiveness in the market.Perform data analysis, market & trend analysis, market sizing and competitive analysis as well as qualitative research in support of the different client projects.Develop a market strategy and thought leadership to scale the firm’s practice in key selected regions for specific products.Become the subject matter expert and facilitator for analytics in sales & marketing.

The successful candidate should possess the following qualification and qualities:

• At least 2-3 years of business analytics experience with a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineer, Math, Economics (with Data Analytics) or any other relevant discipline.
Strong analytical aptitude (basic SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau Software and data visualization).Regional experience in consulting firms is required.Software programming using Python, SQL, VBA Macros or others is preferred.Strong analytical thinking with experience in deriving business insights from data analytics.Ability to communicate complex ideas and recommendations effectively (both verbally and in writing in English) to clients at all levels in an organization.Strong appetite to work in a startup environment and comfortable with fast pace changes & ambiguous working environment.Resourcefulness in exploring analytical tools to help clients to determine opportunity headroom.Keep up to date with new technology trends which will help clients with digital transformation efforts especially for SMEs and large enterprises.Strong appetite for quantitative problem-solving, bottom-line oriented thinking (problem sizing and impact), a thinker who can clarify, curious, understand and re-state business problems.
This is a non-exhaustive list of duties and can evolve with time.

Opportunity to join a growing, ambitious team

The Trade Operations (TradeOps) team is responsible for managing HRT's live trading environment. We help HRT create and maintain the most robust and efficient trading platform in the world. This includes configuring, monitoring, and optimizing the firm's trading as well as handling risk, regulatory, and development tasks. The Trade Operations team focuses on automating manual tasks and preparing for the unexpected.

The Senior TradeOps Analyst will be tasked with understanding our market and broker relationships, technology requirements, and regulatory commitments. This person will need to have exceptional communication and organizational skills as well as being hands-on with a strong technology background. Project areas include: market access, monitoring and compliance, algo/strategy evaluation and management, performance tuning, and automation.

Being a member of Trade Operations at HRT means working on a tight-knit, highly productive team. We're looking for someone who loves technology and wants to work on a broad range of projects using whatever tool(s) best solve the problem at hand. Excellent communication is a must, along with a can-do attitude.

The Skills


Excellent design, debugging, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills
Some experience in C++ and Python is great (not required), but good CS fundamentals and enthusiasm about learning C++ and Python is required
Knowledge of UNIX operating systems (we use Linux), system/processor performance, and network communication

The Profile


You attained a Bachelor's in Computer Science or have commensurate experience
You are familiar with at least one higher level language such as Python (preferred) or C++
Experience in trading is mandatory
Understanding of Market Data/Order Entry systems
Interest in how modern electronic markets work
You have excellent communication skills and a willingness to admit mistakes
You can analyze and fix problems quickly
You like to work with people who challenge you and make you better at what you do​
Attention to detail, strong memory, and an ability to identify patterns are mandatory

Culture

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we come from all sorts of backgrounds: mathematics, computer science, statistics, physics, and engineering. We're a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automated trading. Our culture celebrates great ideas whether they come from HRT veterans or new hires. At HRT we're friends and colleagues, whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Seem like something you might be interested in? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are we'd love to get to know you.

"Give me enough data, and I can change the game." That's you.
You understand our users and what they like. You understand our stakeholders and what they want. You understand our development teams and what they are capable of. You understand the market and how it works.
More importantly, you know just the very thing we need to do, to change the game. Solving problems and influencing business direction is what you do, with all the terabytes of data and business insights at your fingertips. You play a critical role in defining and enabling business change. You're the change maker.
What a Senior Business Analyst Does in Titansoft

Independently conduct data analysis to make business recommendations (cost-benefit, invest-divest, forecasting, impact analysis)
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs
Drive collaboration with stakeholders to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations
Support key decision makers to improve products and services
What we are looking for in a Senior Business Analyst
Qualifications
BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Technology or other equivalent qualifications
Experience

West Pharmaceutical Services, Inc. is a leading manufacturer of packaging components and delivery systems for injectable drugs and healthcare products. Working by the side of its customers from concept to patient, West creates products that promote the efficiency, reliability and safety of the world's pharmaceutical drug supply. West is headquartered in Exton, Pennsylvania, and supports its customers from locations in North and South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. West's 2018 sales of $1.7 billion reflect the daily use of approximately 112 million of its components and devices, which are designed to improve the delivery of healthcare to patients around the world.
Job Summary:
To perform routine and non-routine laboratory testing, maintenance and calibration of laboratory equipment, ensure smooth supply of laboratory operating items, review daily test reports/logs.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Conduct testing of incoming raw materials and finished products according to respective test procedures, compendia and YBB standards.
Support method transfers, protocols and validations related to YBB standards.
Perform analytical testing of cross-checks and product/process validation.
Co-ordinate and perform re-qualification of raw materials.
Ensure proper storage and disposal of all chemicals used in the lab.
Proper documentation and data entry of all test results.
Report all non-conformances and equipment failures to Chemist/Microbiologist.
Ensure all quality documents after review by the Chemist/Microbiologist (or designee) are properly filed.
Perform routine housekeeping in designated labs.
Maintain all retained samples, colour references and documents according to SOPs.
Perform routine equipment calibration, verification and preventive maintenance.
Assist in, or conduct, investigations of lab tests (OOS, LIR, deviations, excursions, trend review, metrology)
Develop equipment qualification and execute/review protocol.
Assist Chemist/Microbiologist in resource allocation, e.g. overtime planning.
Assist Chemist/Microbiologist in non-routine investigations.
Be aware of all relevant SOPs as per Company policy as they are related to the position covered by this Job Description
Be aware of his/her special responsibility towards health and safety in accordance with the company’s safety policy at all times
Be aware of his/her special responsibility for quality and conducts his/her activities in accordance with the Company quality policy at all times
Other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in microbiology laboratory.
Advanced Diploma / Diploma in Chemical Process Technology / Polymer Chemistry / Analytical Chemistry with two years (min) relevant laboratory experience
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Good communication skill; able to communicate effectively in both written and verbal manner.
Good computer skill.
Good teamwork player.

GMP
GDP

Job title: Group Audit – Regional Data Analyst, Principal Auditor – Assistant Vice President
Job description:
Description
Reporting to the Head of the Data Analytics in Frankfurt, the Data Analyst will be member of Group Audits center of excellence (CoE) for Data Analytics. This CoE is responsible to support all functions of Group Audit with data analytics services and audit automation solutions. As a newly founded team, the Data Analyst will do pioneer work in projects and help Group Audit to establish innovative and effective processes which will become instrumental for the success of the function.
Key Responsibilities
Evaluate data analytics requests and work collaboratively with auditors, data owners and developers to deliver working solutions and analytics in an agile and iterative manner.
Identify data analytics opportunities and use cases, liaise with the audit teams, and perform any standard or advanced/ specialized analytics work.
Identify automation opportunities and develop solutions that simplify audit processes and make them more efficient.
Driving innovation across Group Audit, leveraging the experience gained and data collected from successful data analytic projects.
Promote the adoption and integration of data science into the Group Audit organisation and inspire Group Audit colleagues by sharing background on successful adoption.
Apply highest quality standards as your solution will become an integral part of audit execution processes.
Develop and present success stories to GA management and internal stakeholders.
Key Skills and Qualifications
Master or Bachelor Degree (or equivalent) from an accredited college or university (or equivalent) in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Chemistry etc.) or equivalent work experience.
Proven experience working within data analytics teams and developing data analytics and automation solutions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in an understandable manner.
Goal oriented structured thinking and effective organisational skills
Experience applying data science techniques to solve real world problems (machine learning, advanced statistics, text analytics, NLP etc.)
Experience using a broad range of tools, including some of the following:
Big Data and NoSQL (Hadoop, Spark, Casandra)
Data Preparation (SQL, ETL, Warehouse architecture, OLAP)
Programming (Python, R, Java, PySpark, sparklyr, Scala)
Modelling Packages (Pandas, Scikit Learn, NLTK, Spacy, Spark ML)
Reporting and Visualization (Tableau, QlikSense, matplotlib, seaborn, D3, networkx)
A creative technologist passionate about data and information
Innovative, creative, articulate and able to work directly with a broad range of stakeholders
Able to demonstrate examples of previous successful deliveries and a track record in providing insight and innovation through the application of good data science principles
Ideally first experience in audit functions.
International experience, coupled with a familiarity of working within the operational requirements of a global bank.
Strong strategic/analytical thinking and capacity to develop and drive positive change.
Ability to work in virtual, global teams in a matrix organisation and transfer knowledge and develop capability of team members.
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

Job Summary:
In this role you will focus on plant routine and/or non-routine products testing, water and environment testing in Microbiology Laboratory. You will be responsible for lab equipment validation, maintenance and calibration to comply to cGMP.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Conduct cleanroom monitoring according to respective test procedures.
Conduct water testing according to respective test procedures and compendial.
Conduct finished product testing according to respective test procedures and compendial.
Perform bacterial identification on samples of water, environment, and finished products.
Proper documentation and data entry of all test results.
Ensure all quality documents are properly filed.
Support method validations and equipment qualification / re-qualification.
Support / assists laboratory investigation for deviations / non-conformances, Out-of-Specification (OOS) and etc.
General laboratory support includes housekeeping, equipment maintenance and calibration, inventory of consumables / supply, etc.
Support / assists to conduct risk assessment.
Ensure compliance to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), Good Documentation Practices (GDP) and Good Laboratory Practices (GLP).
Follow laboratory safety rules, regulations and standard operating procedures required for the task assigned.
Other duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in microbiology laboratory.
Advanced Diploma / Diploma in Microbiology / Pharmaceutical Science / Life Science with minimum of two years relevant laboratory experience.

Good communication skill; able to communicate effectively in both written and verbal manner.
Good computer skill.
Good teamwork player.
