This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Speed is the foundation of our company. We think fast. We work fast. We launch fast. We are honest, direct, and try to have some fun too. We're creating our own path, with a global team driving sustainable growth. To maintain our momentum, we need people to join us in finding new ways of solving our unique challenges - people like you.

Risk Data Analyst

Adyen's Risk Team focuses on powering all of Adyen's fraud prevention efforts. From providing risk solutions to merchants, to building out real time dashboards to detect anomalies and prevent payments fraud early, Adyen's risk efforts are central to what we do.

We are looking for a passionate Risk Data Analyst who has experience working in teams that build merchant facing solutions and is hands on with data analytics.

What will you do:

Provide necessary data analysis to create business value for the merchants.
Use predictive analytics to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.
Write SQL to query relational databases.
Work cross functions with development and data analytics team across regions.
Communicate conclusions across different stakeholders and generating insights, also including client facing.
Work with data visualization tools to turn raw numbers into easy to understand and impactful graphs.
Work with Looker, Grafana or/and Python.
Manage the risk strategy of large merchants and report to their management.

Who you are:

DNA: High energy, dynamic, self-starter with a proven entrepreneurial drive. Passionate for data analytics. You like to work in a high-paced environment where quick shift of priorities is not an issue.
Analytical experience: You have experience working in data analytics, preferably in payments/financial risk/credit risk. You are highly skilled at writing SQL to query databases. You have experience with different data and statistical analysis techniques.
Other experience: You understand machine learning algorithms and anomaly detection. You are able to visualize data and communicate conclusions to non-technical stakeholders. Looker, Grafana and/or Python experience is a plus.
Knowledge: You understand global payments ecosystem, as well as payments fraud, risk, trust & safety.
Ownership: You are committed and you have demonstrated an ability to maintain high levels of productivity with minimal supervision.
English business level – additional language is a plus.

Due to the current situation, you must already reside in Singapore, preferably do not require a working visa sponsorship.

Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for many of the world's leading companies, providing a modern end-to-end infrastructure connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. Adyen delivers frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. With offices across the world, Adyen serves customers including Facebook, Uber, Spotify, Casper, Bonobos and L'Oreal.

About the job
The Online Partnerships Group (OPG) uses our portfolio of product solutions, including AdSense and Google Marketing Platform tools, to help online publishers grow their businesses. You'll provide creative, industry-leading online advertising solutions for publishers and developers and identify new opportunities. Some of the largest publishers on the web rely on our products and we're always trying to exceed their expectations and strengthen our long-term partner relationships. We help grow Google's business with the largest online publishers and provide account management for users of AdSense, Google Ad Manager and more.
As a Strategic Marketing Analyst, you will use your analytical and technical skills to grow the online businesses of AdSense publishers and AdMob developers. You’ll be immersed in massive datasets using Google infrastructure and tools. You’ll connect your data expertise with the knowledge of other subject matter experts to uncover and develop new tactics our publishers can use to grow their businesses. You’ll partner with marketers to make sure they have compelling data that will be used to reach out to publishers with customized, personalized messages, while using and growing your data analytics skills to solve challenging problems. The work is a mix of campaign opportunity sizing, data mining, lead generation, measurement, data exploration, data analysis, and automation.
Google helps our partners find better ways to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. In return, our partners provide great content for our products, and they syndicate Google products to enhance their sites and apps. Global Partnerships team members expand and support these relationships by continually finding new opportunities and solving technical problems for our partners. The wider Global Partnerships team includes a variety of different organizations, including CorpDev, Emerging Business Development, Strategy and Operations, Google for Startups, Area 120 and our Display Advertising Business.
Responsibilities
Mine massive datasets and analyze them to create customized recommendations at scale to help our publishers grow their businesses.
Extract and transform datasets, explore and highlight insights through data visualization. Transform complicated problems into simpler tractable ones.
Build data pipelines and scripts to enable automation of scalable sales and marketing campaigns.
Design measurement metrics focused on strategic priorities, design A/B tests, and measure results for marketing campaigns.
Engage with the broader sales, marketing, product, and engineering teams to understand strategic priorities and identify potential recommendations that will resonate with publishers.

Credit Research
FintruX Network is a well-funded ecosystem platform built on the blockchain to provide liquidity to under-served SME globally. All loans are protected by proven credit-enhancements. We are seeking a credit researcher to work with our credit analysts to leverage untapped data to help improve our borrowers’ credit. By leveraging data, machine/deep learning and blockchain technology, you can help make a previously unprofitable market segment highly attractive. Successful candidate will have an opportunity to participate in building, monitoring and improving internal scorecards incrementally via artificial intelligence. We promote work-life balance via automation.
Jobs Description
You will work closely with our credit analysts to identify bespoke credit & financial data. Our technology team can support you to connect and integrate with relevant data sources that you identified. By applying state-of-the-art commercially available artificial intelligence, you can separate signals from noises and help improve our borrowers’ credit. Your effort should result in improved scorecard constantly.

Responsibilities
Study SME borrowers’ data to understand key aspects of analysis and summarize it for the credit analysts for review
Work closely with the credit analysts in investigating credit and financial data, identifying inconsistencies and understanding rationale for bespoke data
Apply machine and deep learning provided to help improve borrowers’ credit ratings
Conduct relevant economic and industry analysis
Identify relevant data sources and vendors for data acquisition
Work with our technology team to integrate data sources recommended by you
Incorporate feedback from credit analysts and borrowers to contribute in improving FintruX’s internal scorecard incrementally
Aim to reduce time spent on credit analysis with higher quality
Recommend innovative solutions towards simpler, faster, better
Offer Details
Optional one-day-a-week working from home.
Respect is expected from all team members and stakeholders.
Open, modern and pleasant office close to CBD and MRT.
A competitive remuneration package.
Group medical benefits included.
A learning environment where one can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact.

1-3 years of relevant work in finance or accounting
Experience in credit risk and data analysis is asset
Recognized degree in finance/accounting/business
Excellent qualitative and quantitative analysis skills
Interest and aptitude in data, statistics, metrics, analysis and trends
Excel in statistics, financial analysis, economics and industry assessment
Enjoys working on a large variety of topics related to SME commercial lending
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Creative and with strong attention to details
Solid research and problem-solving skills
A mindset of ownership and accountability
A self-starter attitude, adaptable, teachable, able to multi-task well in a innovative environment
Good team player with the ability to build meaningful relationships with all stakeholders.
Who We Are

FintruX Network innovates smart solutions for underserved startups and SMEs. We aim to be the one-stop resource and solution provider for business growth and sustainability.

We are looking for enthusiasts that want to design and deliver hospital operations management solutions enabled by real-time digital technology and consulting to transform hospitals into highly efficient organizations with the human element in mind.

Your mission and responsibilities:
You will work with the customer and the hospital operations teams to identify relevant data sources to be integrated into the EPS solution
You will develop algorithms to calculate operational Key Performance Indicators (real-time and retrospective)

You will include Artificial Intelligence algorithms and Machine Learning tools for predictive analytics

You hold a successfully completed Degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar experience

You possess excellent knowledge in data mining and analytics
You have solid knowledge in algorithms and how to implement them in IT systems
You have excellent knowledge in data visualization
You have experience with data analytics and BI tools

Your personality and skills:
You are a strong team player
You possess good presentation skills
You can explain value behind data to non-experts
You are curiosity to discover new insights out of large amounts of data

You can travel up to 40% in the region

Being part of our team:

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. More than 48,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.

Our unique team spirit arises from embracing different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge conventions. Change is a constant aspect of our work. WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You’ll work with our McKinsey Energy Insights team in Singapore.
McKinsey Energy Insights, a specialist data and analytics unit, provides distinctive analysis, insights, and support to energy players. We are seeking a data analyst to help build the next generation of analytical solutions for the Advertising Platforms Marketing team. And you’ll need to be comfortable with ambiguity and working within a highly distributed global team.

This is Adyen

We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Speed is the foundation of our company. We think fast. We work fast. We launch fast. We are honest, direct, and try to have some fun too. We're creating our own path, with a global team driving sustainable growth. To maintain our momentum, we need people to join us in finding new ways of solving our unique challenges - people like you.

Data Analyst

We're looking for an inquisitive, committed, thorough and fun Data Analyst. Your work will often be the starting point for new business opportunities. As such, you will make direct impact on Business Development, Risk Management, and to supporting flawless operations. You collaborate closely with other teams, such as Risk Managers, Account Managers, and the Partnerships, Sales & Compliance teams.

What you'll do:

Approach complex and multivariate calculations in a structural way.
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining and collaboration with other teams to provide actionable product insights.
Effectively communicating complicated data and findings in a simple fashion.
Solving ambiguous problems using data and providing practical business insights.
Turning analysis into effective communication and concise, actionable advice through storytelling.

Who you are:

You have excellent communication skills and you enjoy working together.
You are committed to challenge the status quo.
You are detail oriented and have the ability to multi-task.
You like to work in a high-paced environment where you may need to quickly shift priorities.
You are able to work in an independent way, while at the same time you are a strong collaborator, connecting with colleagues and sharing ideas to improve effective teamwork.
You take initiative and ownership and you dare to make decisions. You enjoy a start-up environment with little supervision.
You have experience in analyzing data and automating complex data handling through SQL, Python and/or R.
You have experience in data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Micro Strategy and etc.
You have a background in business quantitative fields such as Business Analytics, Econometrics, Statistic or a technical study.
You speak English fluently – other languages are a plus.
Experience or strong affinity with card present and card-not-present is a plus.

You already reside in Singapore, and preferably do not require a working visa sponsorship.

Who we are

Adyen is the payments platform of choice for many of the world's leading companies, providing a modern end-to-end infrastructure connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. Adyen delivers frictionless payments across online, mobile, and in-store channels. With offices across the world, Adyen serves customers including Facebook, Uber, Spotify, Casper, Bonobos and L'Oreal.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.About the DepartmentThe Credit and Risk Management function is comprised of three teams: Risk Management, Credit and Special Asset Management. We manage the risks arising from the Group’s business activities within the risk appetite established by the Board. This involves identifying and evaluating the risks, developing effective risk governance and strategies as well as providing independent assessment of the overall risk profile.Job ResponsibilitiesThe Role

The role is based in Singapore and will be part of a team of over 40 analysts supporting Personal Financial Services (PFS), Business Banking (BB) and Private Banking (PB) business segments in Singapore and regionally.

Analytical mind with sound business insight, excellent communicator (verbal and written), highly meticulous, and self-motivated

The Role Responsibilities

Identify and improve orchestration, data enrichment and triage capabilities through SOAR platform
Work closely with content detection engineering team to continuously monitor and tune alerts
Lead weekly threat use case working group to capture requirements for new threat use cases
Work closely with the automation team, the cloud security team and threat Intel team. And in the future will work on initiatives similar to detection lab and atomic red teaming.
Conduct research on attack patterns, techniques, and develop creative solutions to detect/prevent the activity
Our Ideal Candidate
3 – 7 years experience working in security operations role with experience identifying adversary behaviours and techniques used to conduct attacks
Strong knowledge of Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL) for rule and content development for alerting, metrics, and/or reporting
Experience developing security content with regular expressions, correlation, feature extraction, data classification and enrichment
Good understanding of security threats across multiple platforms/environments (e.g., Windows/*nix/Cloud/Mainframe)
Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, perl, bash)
Familiarity with Cloud/Container security and experience developing security content to detect threats across these (and other) technologies
Experience integrating threat intelligence platform (TIP), IOCs, into alerting and detection strategy
Excellent communicator and collaborative team player
Ability to work across functional teams to incorporate security products into SIEM
Proactive self-starter, takes ownership for issues and drives remediation with excellent problem analysis skills and solution synthesis
Stays abreast of latest happenings in technology and relation to cyber security
Knowledge of attack stages (e.g., footprinting, scanning, enumeration, gaining access, escalation of privileges, maintaining access, exploitation, cleanup)
Relevant industry certifications (e.g., OSCP, OSCE, GREM, GPEN, GFNA, GCFA)

About the job
As a Product Marketing Analyst (PMA) for Google Assistant, you’ll be an integral part of the cross-functional team that fuels the innovation behind Google Assistant. You'll identify actionable user insights and opportunities for user growth, and then drive the marketing strategy in ways that delight our users and promote adoption. You’ll help Google Assistant users around the region discover and use our latest and greatest features.
As the PMA, you will own important reporting responsibilities for product operations and partner with the larger team on data driven projects. You will collect and analyze data to evaluate products and services for different international markets. You will provide analytical perspectives to important strategic decisions. You will also partner with the Product Analytics team globally to plan and execute effective product metrics and sales strategies. You will often be called upon to work with cross-functional teams across Google, and to communicate with and present to senior management.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Participate in the development, implementation and maintenance of projects using research and performing quantitative and qualitative analysis on markets, products and competitors.
Develop forecasts and analyses, generating internal management reports, monitoring key performance indicators and driving the scaling and automation of processes.
Own, analyze and produce flawless reports for product operations. Present information with the right level of detail for the target audience.
Work with Global Marketing Analysts, Marketing Finance and Product Analysts on large projects and analyses for regional product operations. Liaise with team members and management to understand their data needs and provide data support.

Job title: Regional Analyst/ Senior Analyst - Road Transportation
Job description:
Our Client is a leading European Logistics Provider combining all transport and logistic activities. They are a 20 billion Euros MNC, employing over 90,000 staff spread across about 2,000 locations in about 130 countries.
Regional Analyst/ Senior Analyst Road Transportation
Corporate Unit: RHO
Location: Singapore
Reporting to: Director National Distribution

General Description
This position is responsible to support the activities related to road transportation business in the National Distribution Department within Contract Logistics / SCM Asia Pacific. Covering both domestic and cross border road transportation, the role includes the definition, collection, categorization and analysis of road transport subject matter and data, both from existing customer businesses and prospective customers. Other areas supported include road freight scoping and pricing, trucking vendor management, information systems and freight lane development.
Specific Accountabilities
Manage the timely reporting and consolidation of monthly road transport shipments from the various APAC countries

Responsible for categorizing, indexing and organizing transport-related information into easily retrievable and useful knowledge resource
Participate or support, as required, in transport RFPs or bidding exercise
Maintain standard templates for the evaluation of the sustainability, reliability and profitability of transport operations
Act as a channel for domestic or cross-border transport related enquiries from both internal stakeholders and customers or vendors
Skills Required
Familiarity in either the airfreight or oceanfreight booking, execution and payment cycle
Familiarity with the freight customer service role, including enquiry handling, quotationss, etc
Familiarity in freight handling from the shipper, forwarder and carrier perspective
Effective communication and presentation skills
Effective written and spoken English
Good with numbers and statistics
Team player
Experience and Qualifications
Diploma / Degree in Business, Logistics or Engineering
Over 2 years of experience in warehousing or trucking operations
Experience in managing transport ground operations and trucking vendors would be a distinct advantage
Experience in the use and application of computerized transport management systems
Experience working in Asian countries is preferred

Job title: Instrument and Pricing Reference Data Operations, Analyst
Job description:
Who We Are:
JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.7 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com.

What it Means To Work Here:
Here, you'll feel welcomed and valued. Our clients, transactions, deals and projects are global so we work hard to create diverse, inclusive teams that support our business and each other. Learn about our culture at https://careers.jpmorgan.com/global/en/about-us

Business Overview:

Global Reference Data Operations (GRDO) is one of the top priorities across the Chief Administrative Office. Our team will help the company evolve to a more integrated data management strategy, which is globally consistent and usable for business, finance, risk and regulatory requirements. Our processes and systems associated with the production and consumption of reference data are managed by a number of areas, in a variety of ways. As such, the Firm wide Data Management Executive Committee has agreed to establish a centralized technology and operations team that will be responsible for managing enterprise reference data, including the Financial, Instrument, Product, Pricing, Client and Common reference data our businesses and corporate groups rely on for reporting and other purposes.


The Asset Pricing & Reference Data (APRD) utility, a major component of GRDO with over 400 staff globally, services all areas of J.P. Morgan Chase – Corporate & Investment Bank, Asset Management, Consumer & Community Banking and the Commercial Bank. APRD provides high quality Pricing & Reference Data to its subscribers from major external market providers such as Bloomberg, S&P, Thomson Reuters under a single operating model. Data is sourced, validated, mastered and distributed via J.P. Morgan’s strategic Pricing & Reference Data architecture and is used for trading, risk management, settlement and regulatory reporting.

Position Summary:

INSTRUMENT REFERENCE DATA OPERATIONS – are responsible for creating, maintaining and investigating reference data across the firm’s strategic instrument reference data platform and various legacy applications acting as guardians of that data and responding to request and queries from the users.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Create new instruments for Equity Derivatives products in Reference Data system
Update/modify assets based on internal client initiated changes (Middle Office, Trade support, Settlements) or Corporate actions. Regular maintenance of securities that require coupon, rate fixing and/or factor updates on a daily basis from sources like Bloomberg, Reuters etc.
Perform research through Bloomberg and Reuters to find missing or additional information required to complete set up or maintenance.
Participate/Coordinate in special projects such as; data clean up, process improvement analysis, metrics reporting
Plan and prioritize all projects handled by the team.
Monitor rejects Queue and clears them on a timely basis. Ensuring Checklist, Metrics and EOD activities are completed and signed off.
Ensuring timely updating/review of SOPs, Issue Logs and Project tracker.
Handling and monitoring issue and query mails and escalating issues promptly to the Team Leader
A proactive approach to problem solving, taking ownership of issues and having the determination to follow things throughFlexible work approach – be willing to operate within a shift environment (Potential early and late shift starts)Availability to work a share of Singapore Public Holidays. Time off in lieu will be provided for public holidays worked.Relationship Management
College Degree with 2-4 Years of experience in Exchange Traded Derivatives.
Knowledge of external reference data providers –BLOOMBERG, REUTERS, etc. will be an advantage
Knowledge of handling various related instrument reference data, Middle office functions - desirable
Proficient in MS excel
Excellent communication skills both oral and written
Ability to multitask effectively
Flexible and willing to stretch
Focus on quality and controlled environment
Attention to detail.

QUALIFICATIONS
Undergraduate degree; Master’s degree is a plus
3-5 years of relevant work experience
Strong understanding of relevant content area (e.g., industry sector, functional topic)
Basic understanding of research techniques, information sources, and statistical analysis/analytic techniques
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Strong interpersonal skills and written/verbal communications skills
Solid problem-solving capabilities, intellectual curiosity and effective prioritization
Strong proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and relevant analytics/statistical packages
Knowledgeable in advanced analytics, automation, IIoT, and lean manufacturing principles
Experience in working with IIoT platforms, application programming, and database management
Authorization to work in Singapore
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You’ll be based in Singapore and will work with McKinsey’s Digital Capability Center (DCC) in partnership with the Economic Development Board (EDB) and Advanced Remanufacturing and Technology Center (ARTC). You will work to create an ecosystem for E2E Digital Operations in Asia.
The Digital Capability Center (DCC) provides a holistic view on digital operations across regions, industries, business lines, brings leading technology providers, research and end-users into one location, and leverages Singapore’s manufacturing, research and technology providers.
Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will work with teams to support and contribute to the factory of the future (Industry 4.0) vision.
You will perform research on smart manufacturing concepts and processes for cross-sector industrial applications. You will be involved in the technical planning and writing as well as execution and delivery of development projects for global industry members.
In this role, you will have an opportunity to work through big data problems which will range from data mining to data cleaning. You will also help build a concept of the model to support decision making through various data analytic techniques.
You will partner with consultants to understand knowledge needs and provide content knowledge in your area of expertise. You will drive analyses to provide unique insights and you will support the development and maintenance of capabilities, including assets, knowledge, tools, fact packs, case studies and primers.

Our formula for success is to hire exceptional people, encourage their ideas and reward their results.

As a Quantitative Trading Analyst in our Singapore office, you will have an opportunity to combine the disciplines of risk management, research and technology to create optimal trading and investment strategies within the regulatory framework. You will work closely with experienced traders, software engineers and quantitative researchers. You will gain exposure to multiple asset classes through hands on trading experience and data analysis. Individual discovery and collaboration with fellow team members are encouraged to develop your understanding of market behavior.

How you will make an impact…


Investigate the potential application of existing strategies to new products
Quantitatively analyze trade data and perform post-trade analysis of strategies
Assist in the development of analytical tools
Communicate relevant news, market events, and system behavior to team members in a clear and concise manner
Be willing to challenge consensus on existing methodologies and trading strategies to contribute to the advancement of the team

What you bring to the team…


A bachelor's, master's, or PhD in mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, computer science or related field graduating between December 2019 and June 2020
Advanced quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills and the ability to deploy those skills during time-sensitive situations
A deep curiosity of analyzing large data sets using your knowledge of probability and statistics
Familiarity programming in Python, C++, C or similar languages
Are adaptive, self-motivated, enjoy challenges and significant responsibility, and thrive in fast-paced, competitive environments
Can advocate for your perspectives on trading strategies and risk in a concise manner to the team
The ability to communicate effectively and work well in teams

DRW is a technology-driven, diversified principal trading firm. We trade our own capital at our own risk, across a broad range of asset classes, instruments and strategies, in financial markets around the world. As the markets have evolved over the past 25 years, so has DRW – maximizing opportunities to include real estate, cryptoassets and venture capital. With over 1,000 employees at our Chicago headquarters and offices around the world, we work together to solve complex problems, challenge consensus and deliver meaningful results. It's a place of high expectations, deep curiosity and thoughtful collaboration.

The Public Equity (EQ) department pursues active management strategies in equity investing. We invest globally and are organised along product groups specialising in different total return and relative return strategies.

Responsibilities

Understand the reporting needs/middle office functions and data infrastructure. Use your technology know-how to work with the stakeholders and assist the team in automating processes/reports.
This would include the building and maintenance of exposure, risk and performance reports/dashboards among others.
Provide order/portfolio management support for Portfolio Managers. This would include order preparation, supporting governance, regulatory and compliance requirements, transaction/portfolio reporting and monitoring, proactive management to ensure timely trade execution/processing and accurate reporting.
Provide ad hoc support to Portfolio Managers and work with other departments in the course of support activities.


Requirements

The ideal candidate will have the following attributes:
Degree holder or above preferably in a technical discipline.
Good working knowledge with MS Office, in particular MS Excel is critical.
Working proficiency in SQL and programming languages such as Python is preferred.
Good working knowledge with data visualization tools such as Tableau would be an advantage.
Interests in or direct working experience with equity markets/instruments will be ideal.
Ability to drive and deliver the automation/improvement work of existing reports/processes/dashboards.
Proactively understand business needs and engage different stakeholders, including ability to manage issues and deliver outcomes. Enjoys working in a fast-paced environment with a sense of urgency, and resilient to challenges.
A strong team player with excellent interpersonal, communications and analytical skills, who is keen to learn, support and contribute to the team’s mandate.
Comfortable working with data and doing analytical work. High level of initiative, meticulous and well-organised. Self-starter who is hands-on and comfortable to manage multiple tasks.

Job title: Technical Sales Data Analyst, Search Ads
Job description:
Summary
Posted: Dec 23, 2019
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200125657
At Apple, we work every day to create products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work.
Our technology and services power advertising in Apple News and Search Ads in App Store. Our platforms are highly-performant, deployed at scale, and setting new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy.
Launched in 2016, Search Ads is an easy, efficient and fast-growing platform for app discovery. With over 65% of all app downloads resulting directly from a search in the App Store, Search Ads is quickly becoming the app promotion platform of choice for iOS developers.
We are looking for a knowledgable, motivated Technical Sales professional to support our growing Search Ads business. In this role, you will service and support an expanding sales group from a technical lens, ensuring that we scale rapidly and efficiently. You will liaise with product and marketing groups, representing the voice of the customer, both internally and externally. You’re comfortable speaking with clients, and you have the technical acumen to analyze, respond and solve complex customer problems.
Key Qualifications
Relevant working experience ideally in the digital advertising industry, in a customer success, service and/or program management role
Experience with in-person client interactions, specifically performance marketers
Proven understanding of digital advertising landscape and critical metrics for web / mobile / apps. Familiarity with search engine marketing (SEM), app-install marketing, and channel partners (e.g., agencies, mobile measurement) preferred
Advanced technical skills a plus: experience with data-mining including querying data via SQL, scripting (e.g. Python) and 3rd party tools (e.g., Salesforce, Tableau)
Excellent communication, project management, and organizational skills
Strong personal code of ethics, integrity, diversity and trust
Description
Support and service the Apple Search Ads sales team globally, ensuring that problems/issues are identified, triaged and addressed
Subject matter expert (SME) for Apple Search Ads and all of the data associated with it, for the sales organization
Attend internal sales team meetings as the SME, representing the business and the product
Join sales in external client meetings, as the technical representative, with the ability to speak to customers about the product and data.
Consolidate, distill and embody the voice of the customer, and represent that narrative to internal teams at HQ
Collaborate with cross functional teams across Ad Platforms, in order to translate findings and needs of our internal and external customers.
Possess a knack for taking large data sets, breaking it down into easily understandable stories, and the ability to communicate these narratives to the organization

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our dedication to people, innovation, tenacity, partnership, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and teamwork while supporting our global community
Job Responsibilities
The BE ISM (Inbound Supply Management) team is looking for a dynamic and motivated individual to take on the role of Analyst intern. This is an opportunity for exposure to supply management and Procurement workflows which drive supply assurance in the very dynamic memory business.
In this role, you will work with a global spread of cross-functional stakeholders to map and build key supply management analytics, including critical project tracking, operational lead indicators, summarization of multi-faceted data into insightful dashboard reporting.

Expected primary project:
Establish a dashboard report to illustrate weekly demand forecast flux and supply management impact/actions. This will involve synchronization of information from different Micron systems (SAP, ARPS, etc) to present as a singular summary.

You will interface with various teams in Micron, including (but not limited to) sub-groups within BE ISM, Supply Chain and BE site operations teams.

Ability to think critically and break down complex data/processes to identify key levers.
Team player, with good interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to lead without authority.
Excellent written, verbal communication and proficiency in data analytics and visual representations.
Area of study: Business/Engineering.
Competent in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with Tableau and SQL will be a plus.

What’s your mission?

At IronNet Cybersecurity, our mission is simple: To deliver the power of collective cybersecurity to defend companies, sectors, and nations. In response to cyber adversaries who increasingly collaborate for collective offense, leading organizations in our critical infrastructure are using collective defense strategies and solutions to meet these powerful and ever-changing threats. We believe that collective defense is our collective responsibility and we are leading the charge.
IronNet delivers unmatched collective cyber threat detection for enterprise on-premise, cloud, and hybrid networks. We do this through the application of advanced behavioral analytics, AI, and machine learning techniques. Our team combines the tradecraft knowledge of the best offensive and defensive cyber operators in the world with world-class mathematicians and data scientists to engineer solutions that empower companies to defend against advanced threats.
IronNet is recognized in Gartner’s 2019 Market Guide for Network Traffic Analysis and was recently named a Vendor to Watch by Enterprise Management Associates. Our founder and Co-CEO, General (Ret) Keith Alexander, is a recognized cybersecurity innovator and a frequent speaker about current cyberthreats and effective defenses. We have a leadership team with deep government and commercial cyber experience and are advised by a board of esteemed security and venture investment professionals.

Your Role:

As a Computer Network Defense Analyst (CNDA) you will be responsible for monitoring our corporate and customer networks to detect suspicious and hostile activity that would jeopardize the confidentiality, integrity or availability of information systems. Analysts are responsible for reviewing logs and alerts from various security tools and network traffic analyzers. You must be able to compile information and prepare computer security incident reports based on intrusions, events, and incidents that are detected. You will work closely with our customer’s security operation centers to ensure the mitigation of all activity detected.
This CNDA position requires the ability to work night shifts and has limited travel.
Key Responsibilities:
Constant monitoring of various security appliances and networks.
Creation of technically detailed reports based on intrusions and events.
Provide assistance in computer incident investigations.
Coordinate with our customer Security Operations Center (SOC) teams to remediate detected incidents.
Analyze and evaluate anomalous network and system activity.
Recommend modifications to security tools to detect, prevent, and mitigate intrusions.
Assist in troubleshooting and problem solving a wide variety of client issues.
Provide quality customer service with excellent communication skills.
Desirable Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, professional training, or work experience.
3 years of hands-on experience in the detection, response, mitigation, and/or reporting of cyber threats affecting client networks and one or more of the following:
Computer intrusion analysis
Intrusion detection
Network defense
Incident response
Computer network surveillance/monitoring
Knowledge and understanding of network protocols, network devices, multiple operating systems, and secure architectures
System log analysis
Experience with current cyber threats and the associated tactics, techniques, and procedures used to infiltrate computer networks
Experience in developing, refining, and performing advanced analysis to uncover new or potential incidents and report on results.
Experience in assessing threat indicators (e.g. Malware/Malicious Anomalies/Abnormal network Activity/Root Level Compromise, etc.).
An advanced understanding of current threats and trends present in the Information Security and Technology field.
Must be able to provide feedback on product use and development for future versions.
Demonstrated ability to document processes.
Ability to work shift as required (night, weekends, and day shifts).
Requirements:
Initiative and a personal interest in Information Technology Security.
Analytical skills - Candidate must be able to look at the enterprise across a variety of points of view: adversaries, clients, administrators, end users, and consumers and understand “Normal Activity” as well as anomalous activity (bad and good). Must be passionately curious about the nature of anomalous activity while exhaustively analyzing and considering adversary actions, motivations, environmental considerations, and identifying sources and methods of intrusive activity.
Computer skills - Candidate must be able to use a variety of common office automation tools, analysis, and scripting tools to prepare their work products.
Communication skills - Candidate must communicate with clients, customers, and other computer network and information technology specialists to ensure that their work accurately reflects the situation and effectively expresses information in an understandable way (written or oral).
Creativity - Candidate must be able to think of new approaches to communicating ideas to consumers. They develop unique and effective work products that convey a recognizable meaning and deliver value on behalf of the company and our clients.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent problem-solving skills
Preferred Skills:
Relevant IT certifications such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP), GIAC Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA), GIAC Certified Forensic Analyst (GCFA), GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), Splunk, AWS, or equivalent experience in lieu of certifications.
People skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with various clients with the ability to explain and elaborate on technical details.
Experience with the various industry best practices and standards regarding computer security and incident response.
IronNet Cybersecurity offers an excellent benefits package, an award winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce.
IronNet Cybersecurity is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. (EOE –Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans Status/Disability Status/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity).

Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises.
Opportunity Overview
As our business continues to move to a consumer centric model the realisation of business requirements and transforming the way we work requires multiple teams, departments and countries to work together, evolve and collaborate for a successful outcome for Turner.

With Technology and Operations as the underpinning providers of capabilities on which we launch and operate our services, we are the central point of coordination across multiple stakeholders and 3rd parties to ensure we define and implement the end to end solutions to deliver the capabilities required by our business.

This role’s primary responsibility is to support the scoping and delivery across all T&O projects to ensure the overall business goals are met.


Essential job functions:

Business Analysis
Perform business analysis and solution design activities on projects of medium size\\length\\risk. This may involve gathering and documenting business requirements, user workflows, and system functional requirements.
Provide process improvement recommendations to the business through understanding the business workflows across all areas of the WarnerMedia value chain. This may include content supply, post production, channel playout and distribution.
Work with vendors to create feasibility documents, functional design and document technical specifications and requirements.

Stakeholder and Participant management
Work with stakeholders at all levels of the organization on the creation of business cases resulting in clearly defined projects and workplans. This may across all business units such as Content, Distribution, Creative, Ad Sales etc..
Effectively prioritise the backlog of business cases and ongoing projects by actively partnering with the wider business to understand their goals and objectives
Liaison between stakeholders, operating and technology teams (including 3rd party outsourcers) ensuring that all parties have the information needed to be able to do their jobs, make effective and metrics-based decisions.
Liaison with third party vendors and development partners to drive forwards project objectives and outcomes.

Delivery Management
Process communications to the VPs including telephone calls and email messages, if required, and provide assistance using independent judgment to determine those that enquire priority attention. Receive and distribute incoming mail; review and evaluate mail to identify those items requiring priority attention; composing and preparing correspondence that is sometimes confidential; arrange complex and detailed travel plans, itineraries, meetings, agendas and conferences. Some attendance to required meetings with clear, concise minute taking.

Security & Governance
Considerations are paramount to keeping our data, content and operations safe. This role ensures appropriate involvement of the information security office (ISO) on all deployments. Participation in audit and BCP activities as required including BCP and DR testing, SOX, internal and external audit.

Person specification:

Essential
Proven experience of working on business analysis, solution design or project delivery in a broadcast/ media environment.
Excellent communication skills.
Excellent Analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Leadership to drive change and influence others.
Familiar with SharePoint, Visio, Microsoft Project or other project management tools.
Superior customer service skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills to all levels within the company.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and manage priorities.
Effective problem solving and analytical skills.
Meeting facilitation and presentation skills.
Degree in Computer Science, MIS, business, or equivalent education/training/ experience.

Desirables
Experience with agile/ scrum/ waterfall development methodologies.
Solid experience working with mobile platforms iOS, Android, Windows 8.
Experience with ad serving standards such as IAB, VAST, VPAID and MRAID.
Knowledge of DRM software such as Microsoft PlayReady, Apple Fairplay, Google Widevine, Verimatrix.
Experience in analytics implementation with Omniture, Tableau, Appfigures etc. and with working knowledge of tools such as Google Analytics & Flurry.
Programming experience (.Net, Python, C#, PHP, JavaScript, HTML, XML, JSON).
Experience working with Akamai, Azure, CloudFront or other CDNs.
Experience working with different game frameworks (Cocos2d-x, LimeJS, Impact, Unity.)

But wait, there’s more!
Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Cool benefits such as Summer Fridays
More Fun, Less Fear, All In Culture

Nearly 8,300 employees across Europe, the Americas, Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and North Africa support the Bank's clients, meeting their financial needs throughout the world. You are also responsible for analysing industry performance, competitive analysis, end-use sectoral analysis, analysing grade portfolios and demand supply scenarios to proactively suggest opportunities and highlight threats to the business.

Provide support for pricing and operational decisions and market reporting by gathering updates on latest market prices, spreads, margins, industry trends, etc.

Develop Asian supply and demand balance models.
Provide views on forward product cracks and refining margins.
Develop arbitrage and cargo economic models.
Monitor futures / forward market structure.
Perform ship tracking.
Identify opportunities and threats to the business.

Excellent analytical skills to collect, collate and evaluate large amount of data.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing skills.
Understanding of the petrochemical market, products applications and pricing methodologies & practices
Ability to combine industry knowledge with analysis of internal and external data to present actionable insights, opportunities and threats for the business to address

Position Overview
 
JOB OVERVIEW:

The Component Analyst is responsible to take the excel data from our customers and manipulate to fit into our in-house quoting system, to facilitate the quoting process, and to extract this data from our system after quoting is complete back into the customers file using Excel. The CA will also be required to provide analysis and reporting using in house software and Microsoft office suites.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

RFQ/file extraction for customer's on-line quote system
With Program Management, review RFQs received from customers (on-line, excel, pdf) to develop the most effective process to prepare file for quoting
Prepare raw BOM Analysis (when deemed necessary) to assist Program Management with quote upload strategy. (Incumbent vs incremental vs new)
Manipulate raw bill of materials to prepare for upload, and conversion back into the customer's format.

Follow SOPs for uploading a quote, to ensure all relevant lines are captured for upload.
Quote manipulation to provide summaries as required including:

Pre-BOM analysis;

Sorting/extractions (by Mfr/BU/Region/Site/etc),

Subtotals

Mass update

Merge files
Award Reconciliation
Identify and communicate any missing/incomplete quote data resulting in potential problems in the upload/download of the data; and suggest solutions.
Provide executive summaries/extractions / award validations / feedback

AIC scan and mass updates into upload templates
Prepare supplementary analysis as requested to assist Program Management in data integrity, quote positioning, feedback and post mortem:
Executive Summaries
Awards/ Feedback files
Reporting / Analysis
Calculate and prepare cut in/cut over dates for customer copies
Prepare preliminary QMs for Program Management/Marketing review (i.e. Passives/National).

QUALIFICATIONS

A minimum of a Diploma or equivalent

Excellent knowledge of Excel (data manipulation, creating formulas)
Product and class knowledge of product
Ability to work as part of a team
Sense of urgency
Ability to multitask / prioritization
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

Our formula for success is to hire exceptional people, encourage their ideas and reward their results.
As a Software Developer on a shared services team in our Singapore office, you will solve challenging business problems while collaborating with experienced traders and researchers to design the right tools and solutions for the job. Your career path could include deployment to such teams as research infrastructure, compliance, risk management, trading infrastructure, or development services. You will have vast exposure to multiple teams within DRW and be given immediate responsibility to make an impact from day one. You will be surrounded by cutting-edge technology and senior technologists to provide you the best possible environment to succeed on our team. We do not require familiarity with or prior experience in financial markets for this role. We will give you the training you need to be successful.
How you will make an impact…
Design, develop and test proprietary software. Examples include:
Trading strategy simulation software optimized for distributed computation
Large scale data acquisition, storage, accessibility, and visualization
Real time trade management and risk analysis
Identify innovative solutions to complex problems and advocate for their implementation to your team by communicating your ideas in a clear and concise manner
Collaborate with other software developers, quantitative traders and researchers as well as business analysts in cross-functional team environments
Be mentored by industry leaders on close-knit teams
You will be right at home if you have…
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics or any related technical discipline graduating between December 2019 and June 2020
Excellent software development skills in any of the following languages: Python, Java, C++, C#, or C
Exposure to network programming (TCP/IP), multi‐threaded applications, computational intelligence, real‐time programming, or GUI programming
A strong understanding of in object oriented design, data structures and algorithms
A passion for computer programming and a deep curiosity to learn and absorb new technologies quickly
Strong communication skills to advocate your ideas in a clear and concise manner to the team
DRW is a technology-driven, diversified principal trading firm. We trade our own capital at our own risk, across a broad range of asset classes, instruments and strategies, in financial markets around the world. As the markets have evolved over the past 25 years, so has DRW – maximizing opportunities to include real estate, cryptoassets, and venture capital. With over 1,000 employees at our Chicago headquarters and offices around the world, we work together to solve complex problems, challenge consensus, and deliver meaningful results. It’s a place of high expectations, deep curiosity, and thoughtful collaboration.
For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.
California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Bunge is a big global team, but it often feels like we’re all part of a local business. We know our customers, we understand our markets, we move fast, we work brilliantly together and we share the same value.
Above all, we’re here to connect the harvests to homes, producing high-quality, safe products and acting as a reliable and trusted partner to farmers, customers and consumers.

We are now looking for a Senior Tax Analyst to join our big family.
Purpose of the job

The Senior Tax Analyst will support the Regional Tax Manager on Singapore and other Southeast Asia tax matters, including but not limited to tax advisory and planning, tax provision and reporting, incentives management, tax audit and tax risk management.
You will also focus on working closely with Bunge stakeholders across different functions, Bunge tax teams (particularly in Asia), as well as external advisers to ensure business decisions taken are compliant with both local and cross-border tax considerations, which properly documented and filed.

Tasks & responsibilities

Be the key point of contact on regional sales office entities for tax compliance
Support all Singapore and southeast Asia tax advisory, tax compliance, transfer pricing documentation, tax reporting and tax audits to ensure all legal and regulatory obligations are met, tax positions are properly accounted for, and tax risks are minimized
Ensure all relevant data for corporate income and transfer pricing returns are gathered for internal and external analysis
Prepare annual tax incentives returns to meet incentive obligations and assist in incentive renewal, where applicable
Collaborate with all relevant stakeholders including financial planning, controller and corporate tax teams to support the US GAAP tax forecast and provision processes for the region.
Support Regional Tax Director and Regional Tax Manager on tax planning initiatives
Be minded of newly enacted tax legislations in Singapore and Malaysia, and advise management on its impact due to the change(s)
Assist to implement group transfer pricing strategies
Ensure all material tax positions taken are aligned, executed and well documented
Liaise with stakeholders in various locations, including outside service providers and tax authorities under direction of tax leadership
Liaise with local government authorities where necessary
Support regional and global tax leadership on opportunities to centralize certain tax processes in a shared services centre (Bunge Business Services)
Assist and/or work on corporate projects, M&A tax research and analysis as required

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Tax and/or Law is required
3-5 years of experience gained in an in-house multinational tax environment with earlier career from the Big 4. Familiar in the commodity/trading sector is a plus
Good foundation of tax and accounting concepts. US or IFRS tax accounting is also helpful.
Experience with preparation and review of income tax returns
Familiar with cross-border and its implications
Experience in working across multiple cultures and cross functional business environments

What do you bring to the job

You are proactive, a go-getter and a strong team player. You possess excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Of course, you have a strong analytical mind and with great presentation skills, you are able to persuade and influence your stakeholders.
Interested?

For more information, you can reach out to bas.careers@bunge.com or visit http://www.bunge.com/.

Power Builder Developer Analyst

Roles & Responsibilities
We’re looking for a world-class design visionary to make our brand globally recognized as the most trusted provider of consumer internet privacy services. Our design teams craft delightful experiences enabling people to make their digital lives more private and secure. We believe good design is as much about behavior and emotion as it is about utility and ease. We’re guided by a highly iterative user-centered design process that combines research, data, and thoughtful critique. We are never satisfied with the status quo.

We currently have two design teams: a small team for our core product, and a larger team for marketing and sales. We’d like you to unify them.

Responsibilities
Defining and maintaining our visual identity and enabling all departments to use and support it consistently.
Delivering all visual assets across the entire brand, including our website, our apps for 7 platforms, advertisements, app-store listings, partner platforms and websites, and more.
One exception: A separate team is responsible for video production, at least for the foreseeable future, although we envision that your role will heavily influence that function.
Together with our product management team: design and specify UX solutions for our product and service to meet end-user needs.
Conceiving of ideas for split-tests to improve conversion funnels.
Your team’s success metrics:
Ease of use by our end-users.
Conversion rates.
Consistency of visual communications across all channels.
Contributions to achieving our brand goals.
Speed of unblocking other teams, many of which will take on dependencies on your centralized team.

As director of the team, you will:

Create future visions of our visual design and brand.
Define and execute the hiring plan. Partner with our recruiting-team to build your team with exceptional people in Hong Kong, Singapore, and other locations worldwide.
People-manage the design function. Currently that’s 8 full-time employees.
Set goals and track progress, assign responsibilities, coach, train, motivate, and hold the team accountable for delivering your expected results.
You’ll design the organizational structure for your team and build it out for the future. We want you to help define headcount numbers and expand your team to satisfy our growing global brand.
You’ll likely manage team-leads and some senior individual contributors.
Design, document, and operate processes for your team and its collaborations with other teams and external partners.
Foster a culture of creativity and efficiency. Train your team and others across the company as needed.
Facilitate cross-team communication and manage incoming and outgoing dependencies. Your team will work very closely with product management, sales, PR, brand strategy, data analysts, engineering, video, content writers and strategists, and more.
Create and promote a brand that consumers trust and recognize by aligning your team’s work with our brand strategy via our global brand team.
Manage your team’s work stack through your leads. Set big picture priorities.
Oversee projects and ensure timely, top-quality delivery.
Later: Be the design-ambassador of our brand at public events and field questions for media and PR firms as needed.
Fill gaps as needed and lead by example, especially when you haven’t staffed up your team yet.
Requirements
10+ years of experience in at least two digital design disciplines (e.g., UX/UI, product design, app design, web design, graphics, illustrations, or brand design).
5+ years of experience leading people. Must have experience hiring, conducting performance reviews, and creating skill development plans for your direct reports.
An outstanding portfolio showcasing world-class designs, including a foundation in typography, interaction, and visual design that reflects best practices and industry trends.
Excellent design skills with a strong sense of branding, colors, typography, and information architecture for digital media.
Some experience with split (A/B) testing to increase sales conversion rates.
Expert proficiency in at least one of the following: any Adobe Creative Suite product, Sketch.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Strong communicator with excellent command of the English language.
You’re great at leading people across several disciplines, backgrounds, and cultures towards a singular goal or vision.
Able to take direction and execute projects; deliver impeccable projects on deadline.
Great organizational and project management skills. You can define a vision and see in your head how it should be implemented.
You are confident but willing to learn. You give and receive constructive criticism well. We want to learn with you and from you.
Based in either Hong Kong or Singapore, and willing to travel between the two locations for at least two weeks per quarter.[CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE WORK PASSES NEED NOT APPLY]

Excellent base and bonus

We assist clients in understanding and challenging their current risk profiles and develop strategies to build digital confidence by embracing opportunities to stay competitive through building trust and resilience into their technology systems. We cover a wide range of disciplines, including risk and control evaluation, operational and strategic Information Technology processes, project governance, application implementation, data integrity, cyber security, and accounting/audit. Core to our service proposition is helping clients de-risk their business and digital transformation programmes to deliver successful outcomes and benefits.
Responsibilities
As an Associate/ Senior Associate, youâ€™ll work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive assurance, consulting, advisory, and industry experience, helping our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to de-risked execution. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Work effectively in different teams for varying periods of time building good working relationships with both colleagues and client personnel at all levels.
Being part of a team that performs services including IT risk and controls reviews, programme/project assurance, third party assurance, IT operational, security and data reviews, be able to analyse business and IT requirements to assess IT and business risk and suggest pragmatic risk mitigation activities for a range of industries
Identify and effectively report any issues and recommendations for improvement to clients, as well as drafting the related sections of formal reports
Being proficient in presentation and report production

Team player
Desirable

We are looking for Data Engineers with a combination of programming and data skills to build dynamic data pipelines that can be deployed to both Cloud and non-Cloud infrastructures.

The Assistant Manager/Manager (System Analyst) will work closely with the Principal Investigators and Assistant Director (Biostatistics) to ensure the successful completion of the research data work on time.

The appointment will be made on a yearly contract basis with the possibility of extension.

The main duties include
a) managing large-scale data from biological/clinical studies (e.g., customizing study specific data processing and analysis pipelines),
b) designing, creating, and maintaining back-end databases and front-end web-interface for data entry, query, and collation,
c) maintaining hardware (servers) and institute webpage, and
d) providing technical support in producing high quality reports for publication in peer-reviewed academic journals.

This is an interdisciplinary position, thus requiring the job holder to liaise with personnel from various background in order to gain a sound understanding of the topics under investigation.

Experience in maintaining a Linux server or cluster
Competent in written and spoken English

Overview:
Are you a proven sales professional looking to directly drive the success of one of the most exciting companies in Strategic Analytics? Alteryx has an immediate opportunity for an experienced, results oriented Account Executive. Our ideal candidate is a tireless hunter who lives for finding, developing and expanding opportunities for new business. 7-10 years of experience selling complex Enterprise level B2B software solutions to the executive/director-level as well as the analyst/user community; SaaS, PaaS and/or hybrid.
Proven sales track record with history of clearly meeting or exceeding quotas.
Technologically savvy with experience in Business Intelligence, Strategic Analytics, Data Integration/ETL, Data Services Provider or Data Discovery/Visualization technology is required.
History of successful technology sales to LOB, rather than straight IT focus.
Ability to develop the strategic goals and tactical plans necessary to identify, prospect and connect with targeted accounts.
Can successfully translate technology into business level conversations that bring value and uncover opportunity for our clients.

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business or sales management
A disciplined “prospector” who can continuously build a pipeline while working on prosecuting deals; leverage existing network and all social channels including LinkedIn to drive communications and account penetration.
Disciplined sales professional with ability to self-manage and push beyond the bounds of adequate performance and standard expectations.
Documented expertise in any of our primary vertical industries: retail/CPG, financial services, retail banking, QSR/FSR/LSR, telecommunications or real estate.
Ability to travel up to 40 to 60%.
Detail oriented, relationship building skills, and a focus on a high level of customer service
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including high caliber presentation skills; PC skills including PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Salesforce.com.

THE ROLE:
At Sparkline, we are in the people business! Our Analytics Consultants are passionate about helping our clients use data to develop a multi-perspective view of their customer and deliver improvements across the customer journey to achieve a competitive advantage and amazing customer experiences.
As a senior member of the team, you’ll leverage your consultancy experience to partner with the Business Development Team, qualifying business opportunities through innovative analytics solutions to real business problems. You’ll keep connected with the ever-evolving digital technology landscape to help identify new solutions and skills that could create greater opportunities to deepen our client relationships.
Driving impact at the account level, you’ll develop a deep knowledge of clients’ businesses and establish measurement strategies using advanced analytics techniques. As a passionate storyteller, you’ll present your insights in the form of a narrative. You’ll lead whiteboard sessions, share solution proposals, deliver presentations and run training sessions for colleagues and clients alike. You are comfortable across all communication channels and can tailor your message to help cross functional stakeholders connect with the bigger picture.
You are comfortable with a degree of ambiguity and with not having all pieces of the puzzle in front of you. Your natural ability with numbers and statistics, combined with your experience using agile data sets and external resources, allows you to identify opportunities and provide rich recommendations for your client. You’ll take an independent approach to work planning and use your experience to preempt and mitigate issues to deliver on time, every time.
You’ll be a coach and mentor for the Analyst Team, helping them ideate beyond the immediate deliverables to provide creative solutions. Using your experience leading team meetings and think tank sessions as well as delivering presentations and training sessions, you’ll different approaches to grow the bench strength of the team. Being commercially-minded, you will work with the team to identify opportunities to drive efficiency and scale in all that we do.
THE PERSON:
At Sparkline, social capital is king! Your success will be based on your ability to collaborate, cooperate and ideate with Sparks from across the business. Demonstrating your natural bias for action, you’ll chase every opportunity to flex your entrepreneurial muscles and contribute to delivering impactful solutions for our clients. You will be a passionate learner with the ability to pick up new tools and languages with ease.
You’ll bring:
A Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics (preferred) or related field.
5 years in a digital marketing/data analytics role in eCommerce, Publisher or Consulting Firms.
2 years leading a small team and/or project team with client-facing responsibilities.
2 years working with analytics and tag management solutions, specifically the Adobe and Google Analytics Suites.
Broad knowledge of the MarTech landscape and expertise in the main channels of online acquisition, related technologies and analytics tools; Advertising (Search Engines, SEO, SEM, Bid-management Tools, AdExchange etc), Marketing (Display, Content, Email etc), Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube etc), eCommerce.
Understanding of the statistical algorithms typically used in Marketing Analytics.
Practical experience using Advanced Excel VBA, R and/or SQL.

The role would suit a proactive person with a positive approach who is willing to help our team with various tasks ranging from organising projects to client reporting. The role requires someone that has great attention to detail and is highly organised, with the technical skills to automate recurring tasks, and develop new features.

Your responsibilities
