Our Big Data Engineers focus on collecting raw data from various data sources and transforming them into a standard format so that the data can be easily consumed by analysts and downstream applications. We develop and maintain data ingestion jobs. We also maintain Hadoop systems and are responsible for any infrastructure change. Big Data Engineers will work closely with data stakeholders, such as host systems and data scientists, and are largely in charge of architecture solutions to connect them.
Job Description
Design data warehouse architecture. Setup and maintain data warehouse infrastructure.
Setup and maintain data warehouse applications, such as data browser, job scheduler, etc.
Monitor data warehouse status and hardware capacity, optimize system performance.
Work with stakeholders including the data engineers, data analysts, and other data users to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs
Conduct research on trending data platform applications and solutions. Create POC (proof of concept) to innovative ideas, and come up with practical proposals
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fields
Self-learner with a strong sense of ownership
Passionate about coding and programming, innovation, and solving challenging problems
Programming knowledge in Shell, Python, Scala or Java. In depth understanding of operating system, networks, and other computer fundamentals
Database knowledge in MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, Redis or others is a plus
Practical experience in Hadoop/Spark, Linux/Unix development, and Cloud Solutions is a plus

We’re a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 4,000 people on six continents. And we’ve been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn’t change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper.
Who we’re looking for
You need to be well versed with the investment management industry, having worked in roles that required delivery of solutions for middle and back office operations. An understanding of regulatory reporting requirements for jurisdictions such as MAS and ASIC is essential, and a working knowledge of order management and data management of securities, especially OTC derivatives, is highly desired.
You will manage your own work, estimating its complexity and size, determining technical design (within architectural guidelines) and contribute to the continuous improvement of the agile team. The team members rely heavily on collaboration and communication and must place great emphasis on Agile Values and Principles in order to achieve a sustainable high performing status.
The base
This role will be based in Singapore
The team
You will be part of the Capability aligned agile delivery team, responsible for contributing to all aspects of the analysis, design, development, building and testing of solutions within a sprint cadence. Each team member is aligned to a single Capability and, while the Agile Analyst’s core contribution will be leading the analysis and design aspects of software development, they also significantly contribute to development and testing activities.
What you’ll do
Support Capability [Product] Owners and Epic Owners/ Analysts to ensure that Regulatory features and stories to be delivered by the Capability team are suitably well defined and structured
Responsible for leading analysis tasks which contribute to the delivery of working software required by the Capability [Product] Owner
Responsible for contributing to agile planning, including sizing stories, parsing user stories into tasks & etc.
Accountable for ensuring user stories are delivered to the ‘working system’ definition of done within agreed sprint.
Work effectively with developers and testers across/within teams and Vendors as well for delivery.
Chairing Regulatory Working Party Meetings and contributing to Global Working Party Meetings.
Work effectively with all business stakeholders local and global that have been engaged as part of service delivery
Accountable for ensuring committed PI Objectives and Sprint Objectives are meet.
Supporting the team in readiness for the System Demo
Performing the role of Scrum Master for the agile team if required to do so
Participate enthusiastically and effectively in Schroders Agile ceremonies
Ensuring continued improvement through conducting regular retrospective reviews and executing high priority actions that emerge
Committing to developing the wider Global Technology (GT) organization through leadership of communities, guilds or key involvement in other non-core activities
Take ownership of the delivering to the required outcome including high quality solution for all work assigned and demonstrate sense of urgency in responding to the needs of our clients.
To provide timely, accurate information of work in progress and ensure/demonstrate that risks / issues are pro-actively managed and escalated in a timely manner
To ensure Architectural design and processes are reviewed and that appropriate standards of governance and control are consistently followed when delivering change
Providing 3rd line support in the resolution of Production issues

The knowledge, experience and qualifications you need
Knowledge and experience in implementation and/or managing changes on Regulatory - MAS, ASIC, EMIR, MIFID
Working with OTC derivative instruments such as CDS, IRS, CFDs and Currency Forwards.
In-depth knowledge of at least one regulatory reporting vendor capability – Unavista is preferred.
Knowledge of at least one data vendor’s capabilities – Bloomberg, Reuters, MarkIT, IDC – would be advantageous.
Knowledge of reference data management especially portfolios, securities, corporate actions is highly desirable.
Knowledge of MarkitWire and DTCC.
Preferable knowledge of front and back office investment management systems like Aladdin.
Strong experience in using business analysis techniques, methodologies and artefacts to support agile software development.
Excellent understanding of the business context: processes within financial industry for an Asset Management firm.
What you’ll be like
Degree graduate with at least 3 – 5 years’ experience as a Regulatory BA / Agile Analyst.
Experience working with global colleagues and stakeholders and sensitivity to cultural differences, time zones etc.
Ability to handle various deliveries concurrently to meet deadlines and budgets.
Solution oriented, with strong problem-solving skills.
Communicate effectively and able to manage relationships across stakeholders and suppliers.
Self-starter, able to demonstrate autonomy in organization and take ownership of delivery.
Has a continuous improvement mind-set, challenges the status quo and seeks self-improvement.
Problem solver, comfortable taking the initiative in challenging and ambiguous circumstances.
Desirable Technical Skills
Preferable knowledge on SQL, Scripting, Reporting and Advanced Excel
Familiarity with Agile delivery methodologies, (SAFe is preferred).
Familiarity with tools and processes for backlog management as well as automated testing/build e.g. VSTS, TFS.
We’re looking for the best, whoever they are
Schroders is an equal opportunities employer. You’re welcome here whatever your sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age.

AXA Life and Health International Solutions – Local Solutions - Pricing Actuarial Analyst

This position is within AXA Life and Health International Solutions (ALHIS), an AXA business unit dedicated to international Employee Benefits insurance solutions worldwide, generating a turnover of more than EUR 2.4bn in 2019.


MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Working for the Business Line of Local Solutions, you will be reporting to the Pricing Actuary in the team. This position provides a holistic view of day-to-day business of reinsurance, with excellent exposure covering both front-end pricing and back-end portfolio monitoring.

You, as an actuarial pricing analyst, will focus on reinsurance of International Employee Benefits, with the following key responsibilities:

Assist with pricing of new business opportunities to issue competitive yet profitable technical solution tailored for the client
Assist with regular monitoring of portfolio growth and profitability, ensuring that they are in line with AXA’s top line and bottom line business targets
Assist with Account Management tasks such as statement of account, treaty wordings and addendum review, legal and compliance review, reporting to home office
Manage day to day enquiries or issues that may arise while creating a climate of trust and collaboration within the team as well as with our partners, encouraging the sharing of information, knowledge and best practices within the team


Qualifications
Successful qualifier of this mission:
University Degree in the fields of Actuarial Science, Applied Statistics or Mathematics, or individuals currenting pursuing an internationally recognised actuarial qualification
Minimum 2 years of related working experience
Good understanding of insurance product and pricing methodology
Dynamic, organized and possess good written and oral communication skills in English
Fluent in written and spoken Chinese (Mandarin) would be an advantage
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong team player but also with the ability to work independently
Experience in manipulating large data sets with or without use of database would be a strong advantage
Good understanding of IBNR would be an advantage
Programming knowledge (R / Python / VBA) would be an advantage
About AXA
AXA Insurance is part of the AXA group, a worldwide leader in insurance and asset management, and the world’s leading insurance brand for the tenth consecutive year, with 171,000 employees serving 105 million clients in 61 countries.
Present in Singapore since 1969, AXA Insurance has been serving the general and life insurance needs of individuals and companies in Singapore through a wide range of innovative products. As one of the top global insurers in Singapore, AXA Insurance protects more than a third of a million customers in Singapore. As a company whose business is about protecting people, AXA Insurance is committed to building a stronger and safer society by empowering customers to live better lives.
For more information, please visit www.axa.com.sg

We offer a wealth of career opportunities and a wide variety of positions in many fields. We want our employees to enjoy fulfilling careers and keep moving their careers in the right direction, whether at home or across the globe.

Our size and diversity of activities means our people have many opportunities to evolve, by moving roles cross-functionally or internationally, based on their performance and aspirations. At AXA, all work and no play isn’t our way. We’re creating the future with more inclusive, agile work environments. Speak to us to find out more.

Job title: Assistant Director/Senior Manager/Manager (Data Security), Government Data Office
Company: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Job description:
A. Company Description

The Smart Nation and Digital Government Office (SNDGO), under the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) plans and prioritizes key Smart Nation and digital government projects, raises the standards of Government ICT and services, builds long-term capabilities for the public sector, and promotes adoption and participation in digital and smart innovations. It takes a whole-of-nation effort, and we will actively engage the public, the industry and fellow agencies as we build a Smart Nation together.

The Government Data Office (GDO) is the SNDGO department that is responsible for (a) developing whole-of-Government policies to promote data management, sharing and use; (b) identifying and driving new initiatives to improve the exchange of Government data with commercial partners and the public, and (c) supporting Government organisations in their transformation to adopt new data science and AI technologies.


B. Responsibilities

We want a change maker like you who is creative, collaborative and looks for challenges.

You must be ready to roll up your sleeves and rally different teams across multiple agencies to meet our common mission: to speed up and ensure the adoption of data-driven decision-making within the public sector, and to realise the Government Data Strategy’s target of sharing data securely within 7 working days by 31 Dec 2020.

As an Assistant Director / Senior Manager / Manager in the Data Security team, you will be part of a dynamic and responsive team that drives how the Government manages its existing and future data security risks, while enabling greater sharing and usage of data. You will work with multiple stakeholders to develop strategies and implement initiatives to protect the Government’s data and promote the culture of using data securely across the public sector.

This position reports to Deputy Director (Data Security).

[Specific Job Responsibilities]

a) Develop strategies and frameworks, and conceptualise and implement initiatives to protect data and prevent data compromise, while enabling secure sharing and usageof data across the public sector.

b) Work with government agencies to operationalise the data security policies and measures

c) Work with agencies and stakeholders to build a culture of excellence among public officers to use data securely

d) Work with stakeholders in the government’s data and ICT ecosystem (e.g. Chief Data Officers, Chief Information Officers, etc) to enhance agency data securitycapabilities and practices.

e) Engage public officers and the general public on the government’s data security policies and practises.


C. Requirements

We are looking for dynamic and self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and excellence. You will be a leader in this exciting field and need to be able to contribute both at the individual level and provide guidance to your team members. If you share our passion in shaping Singapore into a Smart Nation, we welcome you to join us!

Candidates should have:
At least 3-5 years of working experience
Background in Computer Science/Engineering, Cybersecurity, Information Security, Data Science/Engineering or related fields
Good knowledge of information security.

Candidates should have experience in at least two of the following:
Experienced working with Security practitioners.
Experienced working with Data Scientists and Data Analysts.
Managed a technical implementation project or program
Experience in the Governance, Risk Management and Compliance

Having the following is advantageous:
Information Security certification such as CISSP, CISM, CISA
Background in applications development, especially information security solutions
Background in data science and data platforms
Experience in privacy protection technology
Experience in organisation development

[Personal Traits]
Strong communication and interpersonal skills that can create a consensus on action from a wide spectrum of external and internal stakeholders; including multi-agency and inter-departmental teams
Resourceful and proactive, particularly in proposing alternate solutions to achieve desired outcomes
Analytical and creative
Excellent written communication skills


D. Others

Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date.
Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

You will be a member of the Commercial Lending Management Unit. This team is part of the Citi Commercial Bank which specializes in providing trade finance, working capital finance and treasury solutions for the Small and Medium Enterprise and Middle Market corporate clients in Singapore.
Key functions include
As a member of the Citi Commercial Bank Commercial Lending Management Unit, you will be responsible for underwriting and assessing credit propositions and transactions submitted by Relationship Managers to ensure compliance with the bank's credit policies and procedures, risk acceptance criteria and regulatory requirements. You will also be responsible for managing the credit quality of a portfolio of clients. With the portfolio assigned, you will be performing ongoing credit risk monitoring to identify any clients with potential concerns. Periodic stress tests on the portfolio will have to be undertaken to identify accounts which warrant closer monitoring and possible loan loss reserves to the bank. During the course of managing the credit portfolio, you will participate in client calls with the Relationship Managers and Sales Head. Other duties include the monitoring and follow-up of past due credit obligations, overdraft and facility limit excesses, tracking and monitoring of facility covenants, credit and collateral data maintenance.
Qualifications
You should preferably be a degree holder with minimally 3 years of relevant credit, risk or accounting experience; seasoned Relationship Managers with credit experience can be considered for the role
You should also possess strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills and be familiar with MS software applications such as Word, Excel, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential
Other important qualities include ability to work independently and in a team, accountability and a positive work attitude

The overall objective of this role is to ensure the execution of Information Security directives and activities in alignment with Citi's data security policy.

Identify opportunities to automate and standardize information security controls and for the supported groups

Analyze source code to mitigate identified weaknesses and vulnerabilities within the system

Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication

Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
15 years of experience in compensation and benefits at a regional or global level.
Experience in strategic HR leadership at global multinational.
Experience in leading teams across numerous countries in Asia Pacific.


Preferred qualifications:

Experience in leading and implementing global C&B projects including compensation design/programs and benefit plan implementations.
Experience delivering strategy by working with cross functional peers.
Extensive engagement with leadership on compensation/benefit and talent strategy.
Ability to manage a complex set of stakeholders and advocate change through influence rather than authority.
Ability to analyze data, understand trends and develop recommendations for action based on analysis.
About the job
As Google’s global footprint grows, so does the complexity of our business. You will bring deep compensation and benefits knowledge of the APAC market to ensure we remain competitive from a total rewards perspective. You’ll be able to balance strategic and tactical work when needed, diving deep on analyses and providing resolutions to key business initiatives.
Our Googlers are innovative, take big risks and get things done, and our compensation plans are designed to reward them accordingly. We aim to better recognize outstanding performance, so as a member of this team, you're an unconventional thinker and are willing to make bold bets. You take Googlers' feedback seriously, and collect it often to continually improve and enhance our programs through a two-way dialogue. Combining data and feedback from our Googlers with the latest industry research, you'll make large-scale, data-driven decisions that impact Googlers in a meaningful way.
You will build and maintain innovative compensation and benefit programs that ensure we maintain our competitiveness, yet still set us apart as an employer of choice. As a leader, you will take ownership of various country benefit programs, yet be flexible enough to work on regional projects.
Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants, and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them". We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
Responsibilities
Build internal relationships with business leaders to create forward looking solutions that are market and/or function specific.
Manage both people managers, individual contributors and indirect reports.
Provide financial oversight of our compensation and benefit programs.
Represent Asia Pacific compensation and benefits as part of the global leadership teams.
Integral members of the Asia Pacific People Operations regional leadership team ensuring the overall success and growth of our colleagues.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Singapore Clinical Research Institute (SCRI) is an Academic Research Organization dedicated to enhance

the standards of human clinical research. SCRI strives to improve patient care through the design and conduct

of high-quality, cutting-edge clinical studies. SCRI supports academic, public-sector and industry-sponsored

studies ranging from proof-of-concept to late-phase clinical trials and epidemiological studies. SCRI is

developing core capabilities, infrastructure and scientific leadership for clinical research in Singapore.
We are in the process of expanding our Biostatistics team, and looking for a Statistical Analyst (SAS

Programmer) preferably with at least 3 years of experience in clinical research. Candidate with strong

knowledge in SAS programming and CDISC standards is preferred.
A brief description of the position is as below:
You will be responsible for the following:

Review study documents (protocol, case report forms, edit checks, dataset specifications, statistical
analysis plan, mock shells etc.)
 Programming and validation of analysis datasets (with/without CDISC standards)
 Programming and validation of tables, figures and listings
 Preparation and validation of Define.xml (with Pinnacle 21) and Data Reviewer's Guide (SDRG and
ADRG) documents
 Development of project-specific and global utility macros
 Conduct SAS programming training/workshop

Requirements:

Bachelor or master degree preferably in statistics
 3 to 5 years of practical experience preferably in a CRO or pharma company
 Excellent knowledge in SAS programming and CDISC standards
 Knowledge in clinical trials and regulatory activities
 Good oral and written communication skills
 Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment
If you meet our requirements and are interested in taking up this new career opportunity, we would like to hear
from you. Please send your resume to recruit@scri.edu.sg.
(Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted)

About Perx:

Perx Technologies provides a fully integrated solution that combines a next-generation SaaS loyalty management system and omni-channel marketing technologies to deliver revenue-driving digital customer experiences.

The Perx Loyalty and Customer Engagement platform allows large B2C enterprises to drive meaningful digital customer experiences targeted at millions of customers. The A.I. enabled platform is trusted by the likes of UOB, HSBC, Central group, AXA, Prudential, Digi, among others in the South East Asian and European markets to drive revenue.

We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders and HIPOs throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about creating and contributing to a top-notch culture and talent pool, join us!

Job Description:

We’re looking for an experienced SaaS Product Marketer to join our in-house marketing team. This role acts as a key conduit between Marketing, Product and the Sales organization. Besides product marketing experience, this role requires strategic thinking, SaaS and martech domain knowledge as a prerequisite.

Focusing on driving demand for and adoption of a product among existing customers and prospects at the top of the funnel, the role demands an acute understanding of the product’s vision, feature set, key differentiators and our target audience. This understanding will help develop the product’s positioning, messaging and customer facing assets and tools that would enable sub-teams of sales such as customer service and customer success. It covers the launch and execution activities in addition to the marketing strategy for the product.

Responsibilities:
Support Head of Marketing to drive product Go-to-market strategy and execution – Starting with mapping and aligning product’s roadmap with corresponding marketing initiatives.
Define and deliver core professional services, training and support deliverables cover positioning, messaging, and content to enable sales and customer success teams.
Work with cross-functional teams to support press & analyst briefings, demand-generation campaigns, and events.
Work closely with Channels/Alliances team to on product evangelising, onboarding and training for specific categories of partners such as re-sellers.
Thought leadership – Express your opinion on hot topics and trends pertaining to our space and your field of expertise through blogs, social posts and other field usable assets.
Field enablement – Work with sales leadership, field engineering, and user marketing to create and deliver compelling enablement materials and collateral to the sales team and partners.
Focus – Constant prioritization across several competing objectives for optimal use of time and resources
Skills And Qualifications:
Experience in leading cross-functional teams to develop and launch enterprise software products (SaaS an added plus)
Experience in positioning and differentiating in a crowded market
Great communication skills, including written, verbal, and visual
Understanding of Martech and Adtech ecosystem and applications and/or managing a data platform is a plus
Ability to travel as required
What can you expect:
Treat you like an adult – It’s all about a healthy work-life balance. We’ll trust you to get work done and take a break when you need it.
Give you what you need – We’ll supply the environment and tools for success, allowing you to focus on professional growth and career development.
Challenge you – You’ll be surrounded by people equally committed to driving their KPIs keeping in mind the over all KPIs of the organization related to culture, top-line growth and customer satisfaction.

 JOB DESCRIPTION
Our client is actively searching for a Senior Business Analyst to join their team!

Identify areas of inefficiency in the existing system/manual processes, and help users to define business requirements which may entail process streamlining and/or automation. Assist users and provide guidance in process mapping for as-is and to-be process modeling.

Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group's interests in Southeast Asia where it is present in all ASEAN member countries. About Our Client
Our client is a petrochemical manufacturer with global presence and influence across multiple industry sectors that includes government water systems, telecommunication, healthcare, energy and power and more. They are built upon a solid foundation of technologies that is has been improved through numerous rounds of innovation across the past 40 years. With the new-found project team spearheading an additional area of revenue, they too require an expert in market or business intelligence, who would be responsible for price projection and analysis, financial modelling, and competitor analysis. This individual needs to come with an understanding in aromatics or the MTBE / Butadiene.

Job Description
As the Aromatics Market Manager, you are to drive all aspects of market intelligence for the team. You would be responsible for being at the top of all trends and changes pertaining to the liquid chemicals concerned (MTBE and Benzene). In this role, you will also work closely with the strategy team as well as the market intelligence team.

You will also be challenged to the following:

Develop a systematic approach to track competitor movements and trends in order to analyse market outlook, changes in pricing, as well as how different regions and countries react
Develop insights through both primary and secondary sources of information
Create short term and long term market outlook based on historical data and trends
Suggest price points for all product components factoring timing, location, quantity and application, based on a thorough an analytical study and detailed forecasting
Hold a project management framework, and work as a team, being flexible to take lead and initiative of additional requirements that may arise
Be a liaison between internal stakeholders coming from different business units, and sharing insights through discussions and/ presentations
The Successful Applicant
Excellence academic qualification in Business, Engineering, Economics, Statistics or a related field
Petrochemical experience within a manufacturer or market research and analyst work with a chemical reporting company or consulting firm
Experience and knowledge in aromatics or the C4 strain - MTBE or Butadiene
7 years' or more experience in project management and market intelligence
At least 3 years' relevant experience in market intelligence or market research focusing on liquid chemicals
Strong communicator to deliver ideas effectively using Microsoft PowerPoint or any other tools during internal meetings or external client engagements
Cultural awareness to region specific practices and behaviours
What's on Offer
The role offers the individual an opportunity to take the lead in competitor intelligence and market intelligence, within a huge project where the company has thrown in large amounts of money as an initial investment for their 10 year goal. As this role is also open to candidates from petrochemical reporting firms, it offers the opportunity to move to the production angle and impact the company directly. This role will also offer the opportunity for future growth within the team, or across the other business units.

Zi Hui Lim

Overall Purpose of Job
The role of Capacity Analyst is to provide and publish reports based on actual available capacity to the organisation and forecast capacity trends to enable the engineering team to install capacity on time across all network layers horizontally and vertically.

The Capacity Analyst is also part of the customer ordering process and working with the technical sales team, service delivery team and provisioning team to ensure smooth implementation and Just-In-Time capacity and port availability and is also involved in network consolidation projects to provide forecasts of free rack space and power based on consolidation projects.

Key Responsibilities

Collecting usage data from the network
ODF port management and pre-cabling to MMR
Equipment ports
Equipment slots
Rack space and power utilisation
Matrix utilisation
Voice switch licenses usage
Voice number usage
Analysing the collected data and providing details to Network Planning
Provide trending forecasts of network capacity growth, port take-up, and SIP licenses.
Provide forecasts of rack space and power based on network consolidation programmes and upgrades required.
Allocate ports to provisioning
Reserve ports and capacity for high profile orders.
Uploading new ports to online ordering systems
Uploading new voice numbers to online ordering systems
Take part in internal planning and Engineering meetings

Job Requirements
Ideally has a data analyst, data scientist or software development background/education
Proficient in BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Good analytical skills and understanding of trends in data networks.
Knowledge of WDM, OTN, SDH, Ethernet, and MPLS
Knowledge of SIP and Softswitch operations a plus, but not necessary.
Good timekeeping
3-5 years’ experience in a telecommunication service provider
The selected candidate is subject to a background check
Analytical thinking and open-minded to solutions from others.
Curious and willing to explore solutions and self-study when required.
Detail-oriented.
Team player but able to work solo when required.

Excellent career development opportunity
This is an ambitious European energy trading multinational, with an established presence in Singapore as its Asia Pacific Regional Headquarters. Due to exciting developments in business strategies, an opportunity for a high calibre Credit Risk Analyst has arisen to work closely with the trading commercial team.
Reporting to the Asia Pacific Head of Credit based in Singapore, the Credit Risk Analyst will play an integral role in performing the Asian counterparty credit risk function and directly managing the relationship with the business unit heads. He/ She will serve as a key business partner working to support the business activities across locations in Asia, contributing to developing and executing business unit strategies and goals in the region. He/ She will analyse, structure and approve deals that are aligned with the firmâ€™s policies and risk appetite; educate businesses with regards to corporate and business counterparty risk policies/requirements/processes; as well as monitor and ensure compliance. The Senior Risk Analyst will partner other regional counterparty risk management teams, analytics, market risk, to leverage insight, data, capabilities, talent, tools and best practices and drive efficiencies.
You are degree qualified in a business/ finance discipline with 5-10 yearsâ€™ regional counterparty credit experience gained in Commodities trading or global banks covering complex commodities/ natural resources businesses. Track record in credit for structured trade finance will be a distinct advantage. You have strong business partnering, problem solving, analytical and change management experience. Fluency in Mandarin is essential as there will be significant interaction with businesses and counterparts based in China. You will also possess strong communication, presentation and influencing skills.

Company Overview
Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.

Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?
Group/Division
KLA has manufacturing sites across the globe, including Belgium, China, Germany, Israel, Singapore and Milpitas (CA). The Global Operations (GOPS) team, comprised of Manufacturing, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Manufacturing Engineering, Installation, and Quality, is responsible for manufacturing our leading-edge technology. We partner with our world-wide supply base and our design engineering teams to bring new products to market. The GOPS team is continuously working to build our products Better, Faster, Cheaper.
Responsibilities
Job Summary:
As a Global Freight Analyst, you will provide the global operational and analytical support and lead for required data analytics, metric creation as well as operational and financial reporting on the overall transportation network. This is an Operations role in a team that includes Warehousing, Transportation, all modes (inbound, outbound, returns) brokerage, duty and crating. In this role, you will lead initiatives for evaluating our service network and distribution models, developing standard operating procedures and analysis to devise a transport network & strategy to optimize delivery and minimize cost.
Additionally, you will create and implement tools and reporting metrics to help the Global team manage the business, fully understand the efficiency and cost drivers that enable us to maximize customer satisfaction and value. You will provide financial support to the global logistics team and/or analysis in budgeting, planning, and month end close. You will perform research, studies and cost modeling to help future business planning decisions, and create reports and summaries as required.
This individual must possess hands-on transport/logistics operational knowledge as well as excellent analytical and data management skills and technology know-how needed to work successfully in high-pressure, time sensitive situations where customer satisfaction and efficient performance is the ultimate goal.
Responsibilities:
Develop and optimize transport and logistics solutions for our customers, KLA Corporation and internal business constituents.
Pro-actively manage Third Party Suppliers/Forwarders in both operational and contract management as well as performance review, scorecards and improvement plans.
Participate in 3rd party logistics and Freight RFP/RFQ’s and support by developing and validating data and cost models. Provide post implementation support and analysis, tracking savings and validating the terms of the new SOW (Scope of Work) and BRD (Business Requirements Document)
Ensure performance of Global 3rd Party Freight Payment auditor which includes validating processes, controls, reporting and audits that are in place according to contract. This role will be the company-wide accountable person for managing this supplier globally.
Develop best practices to drive consistency, standardization and value to the business.
Develop, monitor, and manage appropriate logistics operational and business metrics to meet or exceed performance requirements.
Develop, monitor enhance planning and forecasting models for Operations transactional Customer shipment volumes (Spares), return and repair shipments, finished goods delivery based on service level modes and volume tier pricing impacts.
Support Freight Claims as needed
Ensure Global routing guide is established, maintained and companywide compliance is monitored
Responsible for departmental monthly spend reconciliation – support fiscal month end analysis and reporting activity as required
Qualifications
Requirements:
Bachelor Degree in Supply Chain/Logistics/Business or equivalent
Minimum 10 years of experience in Freight Forwarder and Logistics environment.
Experience in logistics and transport operations in freight, warehousing, courier modes, Inventory, trade compliance, brokerage and third party return.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and organizational skills are required.
Experience with developing project plans, budgets, cost control and predictive cost analytics and driving corrective actions to cost overruns.
Proven track record of surpassing objectives and delivering exceptional results.
Ability to perform multiple actions across multiple regions.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects is required.
Advanced computer and analytical/problem solving skills and presenting solutions
Strong data analysis, and Excel and Access skills

Our ASEAN Business unit is seeking a motivated and dedicated Senior Business Analyst to lead business improvement initiatives, to provide analysis and reporting on business performance with the objective to improve efficiencies and profits. The ability to partner with VP of ASEAN and other business and functional heads in the region is a critical component of this role. To do so the person is expected to independently undertake data mining, draw insights and make recommendations, as well as to clearly present findings to his/ her reporting manager and senior leadership in a clear and concise manner.

Support the creation of strategic plans

Outcom-focused, professional "get it done" attitude.

Lead the development of the department reporting strategy based on compliance and regulatory needs, client demands, continuous improvement, and inter-departmental requirements

Interpersonal skills necessary to manage staff and build relationships across multiple departments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail

Master’s Degree
3 years’ experience working with databases, datamarts, or data warehouses

Job title: Director, Product Management, Data and Advanced Analytics
Job description:
About Perx:

Perx Technologies provides a fully integrated solution that combines a next-generation SaaS loyalty management system and omni-channel marketing technologies to deliver revenue-driving digital customer experiences.

The Perx Loyalty and Customer Engagement platform allows enterprises of all sizes to drive meaningful digital customer experiences targeted at millions of customers. The A.I. enabled platform is trusted by the likes of UOB, HSBC, Central Group, Commonwealth Bank, Prudential, Digi, Starhub and among others to drive top-line revenue growth.

We are a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation and that is why we invest in high potentials and cultivating leaders throughout the organization. If you are passionate about creating and contributing to a top-notch culture and talent pool, join us!
Quick Snapshot:

We are looking for a data-savvy product manager who can story-tell with data and drive top line revenue for our customers through advanced analytics. You will need to have the vision to craft meaningful metrics into insights and identify trends for our customer data platform. We are rapidly growing in a dynamic and high energy environment and are looking for a self-driven, results-oriented leader who can take ownership of product management responsibilities; driving and contributing to the product road map. You must be an innovative team player who is able to manage a fast-paced workload dealing with a demanding and ever-changing marketplace.

What’s the role?
Understands that building products with data requires a data strategy and the technological infrastructure involved in building products at a technical level.
Hands-on analysing data and methodology with Data Scientist and Data Engineer and determine the appropriate next course of design directions
Identify business opportunities and deliver the overall data product solution by collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders
Define product roadmaps and owns the day-to-day execution of product management and product marketing tasks.
Synthesizes input from clients, Sales, market research, industry trends, revenue numbers, etc. to build and prioritize requirements.
Methodically negotiates product vision with tactical execution, ensuring the voice of the customer is prioritized.
Articulates business and product requirements for new products and enhancements.
Partners closely with Engineering to manage the product development life cycle, ensuring that specified functionality is correctly prioritized, released on time, to specification, and with high quality.
Works with Marketing to create presentations, marketing collateral, and other supporting materials to facilitate communication across all teams.
Acts as a key product expert, evangelist, and advocate for products and initiatives.
Supports Sales with client engagements, assisting with pricing, SOW development, and satisfying client requirements.
Assists with product bug identification, troubleshooting, and triage.
Incorporates customer and business partner feedback into future product requirements, balancing requirements across the varying needs of internal business units and client business models
Who are we looking for?
BA / BS in related field, preferably business or computer science related; MBA preferred.
5+ years of relevant experience in product management and/or product marketing with a proven track record of delivering SaaS technology platforms preferably focused on marketing and/or data analytics objectives.
Proficient in writing Advanced SQLs
Proven success in conceptualising and executing reporting solutions and/or data visualiser
Extensive experience writing business and product requirements for software, technology, data, and Internet products.
Experience with marketing technology platforms, SaaS, and/or loyalty marketing products and services.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact with cross-functional teams at all levels.
Experience, comfort, and aptitude interacting with senior management both internally and with clients and partners.
Must be self-motivated, resourceful, diligent, and adaptive.
Innovative thinker with aptitude in capitalizing upon market disruption to build forward-looking products and platforms to clients and partners.
Superior analytical and quantitative skills with a strong understanding of data-driven decisions and exhibited experience working with Data Science and statistical analysts.
Ability to monitor and succinctly report on key performance indicators, and deep expertise working with marketing metrics and measurement methodology.
Comfortable working with technical and Internet-related products, data, and inputs.
Strong organizational and project management skills.
A natural leader with experience managing constituents from various business units, selling ideas, speaking in public settings, and deep expertise in marketing or advertising technology.
Travel Requirements:

Available for periodic travel

What’s on offer?
Collaborative environment and the opportunity to work with one of Asia’s leading players in the Martech and Fintech space.
Opportunity to work with > 1Bn B2C global conglomerates in the banking, large retail, insurance and telecom sectors.
Work with a globally hand-picked talent of 70 employees who power some of the largest brands in the region who leverage the SaaS platform to engage with 50Mn+ consumers each day.
Great career development opportunities across marketing, pre-sales, customer engagement, and engineering teams offered with cross developmental training.

ABOUT JANIO
Janio is a cross-border logistics platform that provides an integrated end-to-end logistics solution to merchants across Southeast Asia (SEA). At our core we operate as a smart logistics solutions provider, serving merchants and logistics partners and connecting industry players across the globe.
Through Janio, we strive to create a truly integrated network that brings together every key player to become the backbone supporting SEA’s growing e-commerce ecosystem. Looking ahead, our platform would look to incorporate elements of AI and machine learning to provide a suite of smart solutions for real-time tracking, route optimization, warehouse management and dynamic forecasting to truly become a data-intelligent platform.

THE CHALLENGE
We are looking for Product Manager who will focus on identifying customer, business partner and internal stakeholder problems and are at the intersection of business, design, and engineering.

THE OPPORTUNITY
The successful candidate will:
be highly collaborative as the role will work closely with other business leaders and members to align and execute product development roadmap, especially so with engineering department to ensure product development timeline and roadmap are met.
have to be technical enough to understand how our underlying products are built and have a keen eye for detail. They are able to go extremely deep into the details of the product and its technical implementation while also being able to take a step back and strategize & present the broader vision
be a master communicator that work to bring teams together to drive towards a singular goal of making a product successful

THE TEAM
You will be joining a team that is consistently striving for constant innovation and improvement while being supported by an incredibly driven and supportive peripheral team. We are passionate about what we are doing and are obsessed with high performance. We have a strong commitment to make Janio a great place to work at and grow with.

THE REQUIREMENTS
At-least 2 years of experience in building software products as a Software Engineer/QA/Product Manager/Analyst etc.
Good understanding of the various technology stacks used for frontend as well as backend implementations.
Demonstrated track record of understanding and driving business requirements while working with various stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Analytical thinking with ability to ask the right questions to understand user problems and develop solutions.
Willingness to take end to end ownership and being accountable for the success of the product.

Job title: Data Analytics Specialist Lead (Wealth Management) - VP
Job description:
In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 17,000 employees* and a presence in 13 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.


Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 73 markets with more than 196,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.
BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career in an international business environment that is fast-paced, diverse and focuses on creating high-value relationships with our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits, as well as a working environment where you’re valued as part of the team.excluding partnerships
https://careers.apac.bnpparibas/
Position Purpose
This position, based in Singapore, is in the Business Analytics department of BNPP Wealth Management Asia. The candidate will lead a dedicated business analytics team that uses data, analytics and statistical methods to generate insights to guide business decisions. He/she will oversee activities of the team throughout the analytics lifecycle to ensure that analytics delivers business value and work of high quality. Additionally, he/she will be directly involved in analytics projects; by engaging stakeholders to understand and frame business issues, obtaining and preparing relevant data for analysis, building and validating analytics solutions and communicating findings and recommendations.
Job Responsibilities
1. Leadership Role
 Lead and oversee a team of business analysts
 Develop and maintain effective working relationships within the team
 Coach and mentor members to raise critical skills, competency levels and prepare them for professional growth
2. Analytics Role
 
Drive analytics activities at all stages of the analytics life-cycle – understanding business needs, defining business questions to be answered, sourcing, cleansing and transforming data, conducting exploratory data analysis, developing and validating models and explaining analytics results, implications and proposals in business terms
 Engage stakeholders to understand business issues, opportunities and to frame it in a manner that can be analysed and modelled
 
Plan and track progress of analytics development activities
 Identify and obtain relevant data, ensure proper data cleansing, transformation and aggregation rules are applied, explained and documented
 
Ensure that statistical methodologies, analytics and machine learning techniques applied are suitable for the issue at hand, and assumptions / constraints of the techniques are clearly understood
 
Translate analytics findings and insights into actionable business proposals and activities
 Build effective communication approach using data visualisation techniques, data storytelling and presentation best practices
 
Present findings and recommendations
3. Collaboration Role
 Facilitate individual and team collaboration with internal and external teams
 Ensure internal data & analytics standards are enforced and reviewed for continued relevance
 Support analytics operationalisation, validate relationship between performance and result indicators

Qualifications

1. Minimum 5 years of direct experience in leading data analytics teams in a banking environment
2. Proven track record of successful execution of data analytics initiatives where development of insights led to improved business performance. Candidate must be able to demonstrate success leading analytics and analytics teams, working with structured / unstructured data, applying statistical & analytics methodology to undercover insights, and explaining & presenting analytics recommendations to non-analytics audiences. Individuals with practical experience applying analytics in client franchise growth, sales management or portfolio diversification in private banks will have a strong advantage
3. Bachelors or Master’s degree in Data Science, Data Analytics or Applied Statistics
4. Knowledge and experience in usage of R, Python, Tableau, Business Objects and SQL
5. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and SharePoint collaboration tools.
Skills

1. Excellent verbal and written communication skills – this position requires individuals with exceptional ability to understand business problems, summarise expectations, translate and explain analytical results and recommendations clearly, and precisely in business terms. He/she is expected to interact with numerous stakeholders to aid them in applying data to guide decisions

2. Analytics skills – the candidate must have a passion for using data and data analytics to improve business performance, and be highly knowledgeable and skilled in statistical, analytics and data mining techniques

3. Critical thinking & problem solving skills – ability to assess situations, verify facts, reason logically to formulate and propose alternatives.
4. Interpersonal skills – highly driven and self-motivated, and very comfortable working with senior business executives from cross functional areas, with ability to interact with ease, collaborate with diverse teams, establish rapport and build trust.

Roles & Responsibilities
Summary:

You will be the domain Subject Matter Expert and build the technical and functional competency in Cash Management domain within the team. You will be responsible for delivering viable solutions that evolves the Cash Management platforms in order to accommodate business growth and meet the objectives in the APAC region.

Responsibilities:

Assist the Team Lead or Lead Business Analyst as a Functional Analyst
Perform business and functional analysis (end to end) for Cash Management services and products for Asia Pacific countries
Provide viable solutions that improve operational efficiency, user experience, and deliver business initiatives that is in line with solution
Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to details, strong work ethic, team spirit, exceptional customer serving attitude; operations experience will be an added advantage
Produce requirements in the form of Users Story to vendors and review vendor FS (where applicable), review and sign-off the artefacts and solutions produced by the vendor (where applicable); drive User Story grooming with vendor and close all doubts from vendor
Identify and map information requirement between internal systems and external parties i.e. Clearing House, Partner Banks, Local Service Providers or Outsourced Service Providers; continuous update of the Application Interface Specification
Escalate issues in an effective manner and resolve these in conjunction with the rest of the team and/or the vendor
Review designs from Technical Teams/Vendor (where applicable)
Review solutions from Technical Teams/Vendors (from functional view point that it fulfils the requirements objectively)
Review SIT cases, analyse defect(s) raised by Test team; liaise with internal Product Owner and/or vendor on fixes delivery date
Define UAT cases/ plan and be a liaison between project stakeholders and testing team during Testing Phase; ensure defects reported are tracked, follow-up and closed timely; establish and maintain close communication with Business and Operation to support day-to-day operation
Provide support on clarification during SIT/ UAT, Regression testing and Rehearsal testing
Work independently to resolve issues and/or identify solutions and escalate in timely manner.
Support and plan for users’ participation in Deployments and Implementation Users Sanity and/ or Penny Testing (PVT)
Develop new products jointly with other application/project teams
Contribute towards the end-to-end solutioning for these new products
Contribute towards defect leakage and quality improvement initiatives
Provide support and expertise by providing training and knowledge sharing sessions

Technical skills required:

Ability to work independently and/ or in a team to resolve issues and/or identify solutions in a timely manner
Good experience in Payments, Cash Management, and Transaction Banking projects
Extremely familiar with Payments (TT, RTGS, LVP (Payroll), Direct Debit, Cheques), and Receivables (Collections) processing across the APAC region
Sound domain knowledge in Corporate Banking Management
Sound functional analysis and project management skills with proven project/deliverables in working experience
Hands-on experience with data/ interface mapping and troubleshooting
Practice of SDLC and/ or Agile Scrum
ISO20022 payment standard and SWIFT messages
Straight-through processing (STP) and operational efficiency
e-Banking end-to-end client experience
Java/ J2EE platform, IBM WAS, Oracle Db is a plus
Technical skillset is a plus

Personal skills required:

Strong analytical skills and attention to details
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills
Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic and multi-cultural environment

General requirements:

Degree
At least 8 year(s) of experience in banking software development
Experience in Banking Industry
Availability: Immediate/ 1-2 weeks

Job Purpose:
The Head of Retail Analytics role will focus on driving business outcomes with our retail, investments and insurance business with end to end data and analytic solutions. As Citi increasingly looks to data to power our capabilities, an analytically-driven understanding of how to optimize our retail bank client experience is a critical enabler of success. Citi is seeking a business-savvy analytics professional to partner with key stakeholders to accelerate business results. Manage across a small regional team + analysts in multiple countries + larger team in center of excellence in India. Interface directly with the entire executive team to drive these critical areas.
For this role, we are seeking someone who:
is a proven leader who can take ownership for analytically identifying and driving solutions at scale to accelerate retail bank, investment and insurance outcomes
has the ability to interact with multiple stakeholders at different seniority levels across 17 markets in the Region
consults with partners to initiate projects aligned to business needs and manages them end-to-end, breaking large programs of work into deliverable iterations and leading work priorities for our team center of excellence in India
Key Responsibilities:
Insights and Analytics: Use data and analytics to identify and scale opportunities to accelerate business outcomes across acquisition and cross-sell, Citi segments, quality and Citi Priority and Citigold elevation, unlock the full potential of FX and use data to drive sustainable wealth management growth. Bring the power of data and analytics to identify and execute on outcomes for Multi-Relationship Clients
Always on Data-Driven Apps: Partner with our stakeholders and capabilities teams to scale business solutions using always-on data driven apps to improve customer engagement and create frictionless onboarding experience, empower retail banking digital capabilities and personalized and contextualize our reach
Sales and Distribution Empowerment: Use performance measurement and analytic techniques to ensure our sales teams and processes are aligned, our universes are optimized and we have scaled solutions focusing on driving productivity in our network and our relationships
Knowledge/Experience/Technical skills:
10+ years of experience in analytics roles in consumer businesses
Deep understanding of retail and investments analytics and ability to identify the best analytical solution to business problems
Proficient in analytical methodologies and data patterns
Optimization, Segmentation and Hypothesis Testing
Business Impact Analysis
Demonstrable experience managing relationships across multiple geographies
Strong Project management skills
Understanding of customer lifecycle management including acquisition, engagement, servicing and retention
Understanding of customer touchpoints and Sales and Distribution framework
Possesses both strong analytical depth and technical familiarity across data and analytics core competencies (data, systems, analytics, machine learning)
Understands technical platforms and is fully aware of how to create and drive scalable solutions
Ability to link analytical techniques and framework to business goals and/or customer experience and to measure impact
Deep Understanding in SAS, SQL or similar
Basic Understanding of visualization tools as Tableau
Personal Skills:
Self-motivated & accountable – demonstrated ability to follow through to execution
Project Management Skills, ability to lead cross functional teams towards a common vision
Problem-solving – gains energy through solving challenges and problems; able to handle and attack ambiguity as needed
Organized – can juggle multiple, potentially competing prioritiesDetail oriented – obsessed about quality and delivering against high standards
Creative – demonstrate a creative flair
Superior communication skills – able to clearly articulate complex strategies/techniques and ideas, in both oral and written form, to senior management, with associated poise
Execution oriented – doesn’t remain in the theoretical; is able to make choices/decisions in the name of delivering rapid business impact
Collaborative – easy to work with, across all levels of the organization; builds effective working relationships
Bias for change – actively seeks out ways to improve processes, people, etc
Influence skills – able to influence outcomes without necessarily direct authority; experienced navigating large complex organizations to achieve results
Must possess and demonstrate a “commercial mindset”

 JOB DESCRIPTION

The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for providing the ICT Infrastructure where the whole government will rely on for its digitalization effort and smart nation initiatives. Good team player with strong analytical and problem solving ability

Who we are

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

As a Senior Data Scientist, your role will encompass:

Leading and conducting ambitious projects in the transformation of clients through data
Having a contributor role in raising the level of competencies of the data science team
Harnessing the expertise from the other Divisions (Activation, Creativity, and Strategy) to provide comprehensive services to your clients
Developing privileged relationships with our clients, using your technical abilities to assist in the transformation of their marketing department
You’ll also participate in international projects. Business travel is something you enjoy!

Among your responsibilities as Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for:

Leading data projects

Managing the resources on your projects to ensure challenges and skills are well match
Securing delivery on your projects
Communicating the successes of your projects among the company
Working closely with your Consulting counterpart to build and maintain strong relationships with your clients and best understand their needs
Caring for the happiness of the team, ensuring work is delivered to a high standard and providing feedback and mentoring

Being a great tech role model

Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clients’ initiatives
Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
Sharing best practices and contributing to Artefact’s institutional knowledge
Embodying Artefact’s values and inspiring others to do the same

Qualifications: Education & experience required


A Master’s degree in machine learning, mathematics, computer science, or related fields
2+ years of hands-on experience developing and applying data-driven solutions in a corporate or consulting setting, preferably in a consumer marketing context (experience in the web industry is a plus)
Strong experience and knowledge of data processing, data modeling, algorithms, and data architecture
Experience leading a technical project in a business context
Intellectual curiosity and excellent problem-solving skills, including the ability to structure and prioritise an approach for maximum impact

What we are looking for

A Doer: you get things done and inspire your teams to do the same
An Analyst: you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions with facts
A Pragmatist: you have a hacker mindset and always find the quick wins
A Mentor: your clients and teams naturally seek for advice
An Adventurer: you’re an entrepreneur constantly looking for problems to solve

Why you should join us

Artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of marketing
Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
Entrepreneurship: you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

Looking for applicants who have experience in supporting Statistical Systems and Data Warehouse

Work independently in gathering requirements from users, designing, implementing, maintaining application systems and project management.
Able to service ad-hoc and urgent statistical requests & maintain the statistical and survey systems
Supporting Data warehouse design, development and its maintenance, Data loading and its process

Risk Analyst

Our client, a reputable Global Bank is looking for a Risk Analyst for their Corporate Model validation team.

The role will be involved in the department's assessment of statistical models and quantitative rules that enable the bank to manage credit risk and financial crime risk, as well as and other models used in the retail banking business.

Key Roles & Responsibilities

The candidate will be working on a variety of models covering many all aspects of the model life cycle. These include data management, methodology, programming, quantitative assessment, governance and compliance to standards:

Independent evaluation of new and existing risk models including IRB/IFRS9/Scorecards
Assessment of changes to existing models and related risk data and infrastructure.
Assist with the delivery of the validation plan, ensuring timely identification of issues and projects are completed to the required standard.
Qualitative review of model development process including underlying assumptions & theoretical basis.
Quantitative assessment of model performance via data evaluation and statistical testing.
Coordination with internal stakeholders on model issues, achieving suitable resolutions.
Documentation of findings and communication of results / justifications to senior management

Qualifications & Skills

Graduate level qualifications in statistics, banking, finance, econometrics, mathematics or related quant field.
Experience in risk analytics, predictive modelling or developing or validating statistical models across the Commercial and/or Corporate and Institutional portfolio
Proficient in statistical and data analysis of large datasets using data management software including SAS and Excel and VBA.
Understanding of the regulatory environment related to financial crime and credit risk modelling and experience in dealing with regulators on complex technical issues will be highly regarded.
Exposure to developing and automating risk MIS / model performance monitoring.
Ability to understand and interpret regulatory requirements and explain such interpretation to stakeholders and senior management.

Due to the nature of the role, only Singaporeans or Singapore PRs will be considered.
